loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is 45 years old, married to a driver, and has five children.   She is a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She pays for her children's schooling and works hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Carmelita oversees operations of their jeepney (see footnote) transportation business. She has a one-unit jeepney with a 14-16 person capacity, who pay a daily quota. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 1,000 PHP a day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a loan for 11,000 PHP, which she will use to to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of her jeepney. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Carmelita dreams that her children will finish their education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her work every week.  

Curiously, jeepneys have purely American origins. They were first used by American soldiers helping the Philippines throw off the invading Japanese. Filipino ingenuity, however, managed to see this vehicle as an opportunity to earn, and modified the Jeep into a 20-seater jeepney, open enough to provide adequate ventilation, sturdy for every day travel, and cheap enough to buy and maintain. Now, the jeepneys are one of the things that makes the Philippines truly Philippines.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study tGod, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for and maintain their jeepney unit.

loans.name: Kassem

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 48 years old, married, and has three children. One of his children works. Since 2011, Kassem has owned a shop where he sells plastic materials. He has sufficient experience in this field to have a deep understanding of his local customers and their needs. Kassem has a good reputation and he is well-known in the surrounding areas.

Kassem is requesting 3,000 USD loan to redecorate his shop and install sliding doors. He aim is to gain more profits to provide him with the opportunity for a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to redecorate his store and install sliding doors

loans.name: Youma

texts.fr:
Madame Youma est  une dame de 48 ans, mariée et mère de 6 enfants  dont l’ainé a 25 ans et le cadet ,9 ans. Elle fait de la vente de glace, crème glacée, de lait caillé et de jus d’oseille .Elle demande un crédit de 100000F CFA  afin d’acheter les ingrédients nécessaires pour fabriquer  les jus et stocker : du sucre, du lait en poudre, du pain de singe. Ce qui lui permet de sentir plus son bénéfice.
Youma participe à la dépense quotidienne et est aussi aidé par son fils ainé.
Le crédit va impacter sur son épargne et va améliorer les conditions alimentaires de la famille ; et compte tenu de cela, elle pourra rembourser normalement son prêt.
Elle a comme projet futur : d’acquérir  un congélateur pour agrandir son exploitation.
texts.en:
Madame Youma is 48 years old, married and the mother of six children, aged between 25 and 9. She sells ice, ice cream, "lait caillé" [a thin yogurt-like sauce], and sorrel juice. She is asking for a loan of 100,000 CFA francs in order to buy ingredients to make and store juice: sugar, powdered milk, and "pain de singe" [baobab fruit]. This will allow her to make more profit.

Youma contributes to daily expenses, and is also helped by her oldest son.
The loan will affect her level of savings, and will improve the family's living conditions. Therefore, she will be able to repay the loan without any problems.
One of her goals for the future is to buy a freezer, in order to increase her activity.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make juice (sugar, powdered milk, baobab fruit).

loans.name: Fifa Group

texts.fr: Le groupe FIFA est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. C'est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Défodé Judith est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Défodé Judith est âgée de 24 ans et vit au Bénin. Défodé Judith a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Défodé Judith est une célibataire n'ayant aucun enfant à sa charge. Afin de subvenir à ses besoins, Défodé Judith mène comme activité depuis huit ans, la vente de produits vivriers et des divers à son domicile. Défodé Judith s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Défodé Judith sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe FIFA, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le premier crédit a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
The group FIFA consists of three people who live in the same neighborhood. This is the group’s second time seeking financial assistance from ALIDé to bolster their activities. 

The group’s representative is Défodé Judith, seen with her hand raised in the photo. She is a 24-year-old single woman who lives in Benin, and she has no children. She attended primary school. 

To support herself, Défodé Judith started selling food products and various goods from her home eight years ago. She buys her merchandise in a market of Benin.

To meet customer demand and to increase her sales and revenue, Défodé Judith is seeking a second loan from ALIDé together with the other members of the group FIFA. Their first loan was repaid without incident.

loans.use: to buy food products and various goods for resale.

loans.name: Tarlah

texts.en: Tarlah lives in West Point with her husband and children. She has three children between the ages of 2 and 12 that are in school. For the past eight years, she has been running a shop where she sells soft drinks, alcoholic beverages (such as beer, wine, and gin), rice, oil, and other items. She is requesting a loan to purchase more commodities for her business. Her plan is to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more commodities for her business

loans.name: Zeneyda

texts.es:
La señora  Zeneyda, viaja desde las cinco de la mañana  un municipio de la ciudad de León hacia el mercado para realizar la venta de productos lácteos, ella realiza este tipo de trabajo para la mantención de dos hijos menores.

 Este crédito lo quiere utilizar  para compra de cerámica para su vivienda, la cual ha logrado a mejorar con créditos otorgados por Ceprodel es por ello espera le puedan ayudar, sin este apoyo le seria imposible tener un techo digno.
texts.en: Mrs. Zeneyda travels from 5:00 am from a municipality of León to the market to sell her dairy products. She does this work to support her two young sons. She will use the loan to buy ceramic tile for her house, that she has been able to improve with loans from Ceprodel. She hopes they can help her. Without this support it would be impossible for her to have a dignified home.

loans.use: buy ceramic tile

loans.name: Adoracion

texts.en:
This is Adoracion, 27, who is a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Regalado, her business partner, and the mother of four children. Together with her husband, Adoracion manages her household while operating her business. She works hard to continually provide an income for her family’s everyday expenses. Adoracion operates a vegetable farm in the highlands of Cavite where the climate is well-suited to growing vegetables and other fruits. She sells her product at the market and local fruit stores and she regularly supplies the local community. Adoracion earns a minimum of 1,000 PHP in sales every week.

Adoracion is requesting a 14,000 PHP loan to help continue her business operations and buy fertilizer and farm inputs. Part of her loan will go to maintain her farm. Adoracion expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  She dreams of using her hard work on her business to give her family a good future. She faithfully meets up weekly with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God.  

* All CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and farm inputs

loans.name: Goreth

texts.en:
Goreth is married and has three children, two of whom attend school. She also takes care of additional family members (mother and young sister). She lives in Kampala, Uganda.  

Goreth has a tailoring business, which she has run for three years. She works seven days a week. Goreth sells her products at the market. 

Goreth is requesting  for a loan for 100,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more rolls of clothing materials and threads. The main business challenges for Goreth include defaulters and thieves.  Her goals are to own a tailoring school and to educate her children up to university. 

Goreth lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and does not have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent, food, and school fees..

loans.use: to purchase more rolls of clothing materials and threads.

loans.name: Florentino

texts.es:
Florentino es un hombre de 42 años de edad, es  casado vive en casa propia y tiene 3 hijos mayores de edad. Vive en casa propia en Sialupe Huamantanga, en el distrito de Lambayeque. La calidad de vida en el caserío es de subsistencia la mayoría son trabajadores independientes en negocios de comercio y crianza de animales adicionalmente dedicados a la agricultura y a trabajar como dependientes.
La actividad que realiza Florentino es la crianza y comercialización de animales, los cuales cría en corrales ubicados en la parte posterior de su domicilio.
Corrales del cliente están hechos de adobe, caña y barro. Cliente cría ovejos, aves de corral, cerdos, palomas, etc., los cuales negocia quincenalmente.
Adicionalmente cliente se desempeña como transportista y agricultor, siembra menestra o arroz según campaña.
El monto del Crédito solicitado es de S/. 2,000 nuevos soles serán destinados a invertirlo en compra de alimento para animales y en  trabajos agrícolas de su sembrío de arroz.
texts.en:
Florentino is a 42 year old man who’s married and lives in his own house; he has three adult children.  He lives in his own house in Sialupe Huamantanga in Lambayeque District.  The settlement’s standard of living is at the subsistence level; most of the workers are independent workers in commerce and in raising animals.  They also work in agriculture and some work as employees.

The activity that Florentino does is raising animals to sell; he raises them in corrals located in his back yard.  The corrals area made of adobe, cane stalks and clay.  He raises sheep, barnyard fowl, pigs, pigeons, etc. that he sells biweekly.  He also works providing transportation and as a farmer; her grows vegetables or rice according to the season.

He’s asked for a 2000 new sol loan to buy animal feed and to use in his rice crops.

loans.use: to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Angel Estuardo

texts.es:
Angel Estuardo tiene 30 años de edad es soltero tiene dos hijos, vive con sus hijos en el Cantón Chillanes Provincia de  Bolívar. Es integrante de la ventanilla BALACELO  esta coinformado por 10 miembros y está ubicada en Chillanes.
Angel Estuardo se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y fréjol. 
Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, abonos, fertilizantes y urea necesarios para los sembríos como son urea 3qq, abono 2qq y fertilizantes.
Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los insumos requeridos para tener buenas cosechas y así obtener mayores ingresos.
Las compras de los productos necesarios las realiza frecuentemente en el Cantón Chillanes cada quince días.
El sueño es poder darles el estudio a sus hijos y comprar lo necesario para su familia e incrementar sus cosechas.
Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son a las vías en mal estado pérdida de las cosechas por muchas lluvias (mal clima).

En el tiempo libre le gusta descansar, ver programas de televisión además escuchar la música del Carnaval.

nota: Angel es el selñor de Chompa negra y gorra blanca
texts.en:
Angel Estuardo is 30 years old, single, and has two children. He lives with his children in the Chillanes region of Bolívar. He is a member of the BALACELO community bank, which is made up of 10 members and located in Chillanes. Angel Estuardo works in agriculture raising corn and beans. He is asking for a loan to buy the necessary seeds, fertilizers, and urea for planting. These include 135 kg urea and 90 kg fertilizers. With the help of the loan, he will be able to buy the supplies he needs to have good harvests and have a higher income. He frequently buys the products he needs in Chillanes (every other week). His dream is to provide an education for his children and buy them what they need, as well as to increase his harvests. The challenges he faces include the bad condition of the roads and losing crops because of a lot of rain (bad weather). In his free time he likes to rest, watch television, and also listen to carnival music.

Angel is the man in the black sweater and the white baseball cap.

loans.use: buy seeds, fertilizers, and urea

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama is a fish monger; she buys fresh fish from the market, smokes them, and resells them. Ama has been selling smoked fish for eight years. She is married and has three children. She uses her income to support her husband in the general up-keep of their family. Ama will use her loan to purchase fresh fish to smoke and sell. She will expand her business with the profit.

loans.use: to purchase fish to smoke and resell

loans.name: La Paix Group

texts.fr: LA PAIX est un groupe constitué de quatre personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) se nomme Rogatienne. Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de roulement, ce groupe sollicite pour la deuxième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Rogatienne est âgée de 28 ans et est mariée à un certain Joseph. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Rogatienne n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Rogatienne vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants et assure ensemble avec son mari les diverses charges de la maison. Pour satisfaire ses besoins et ceux de sa famille, Rogatienne vend des produits divers et de façon secondaire des condiments de sauce et de l’huile végétale depuis près de quatre ans à son domicile. Rogatienne s’approvisionne dans un marché du Benin. Ce deuxième prêt leur permettra de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu. Le premier crédit consenti antérieurement a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
"La Paix" is a group composed of 4 people who live in the same district. The group's representative (the one with her hand raised in the picture) is called Rogatienne. In order to increase their working capital, the group is requesting a loan from ALIDé for the 2nd time.

Rogatienne is 28 years old and married to Joseph. The couple have 3 dependent children who all go to school. Rogatienne never went to school. She lives together with her husband and children, and she and her husband handle together the various household responsibilities. So that she is able to meet her and her family's needs, Rogatienne has been selling various products and, as a sideline business, condiments for sauces and vegetable oil, from her home for nearly 4 years. She gets her supplies in one of Benin's markets.

This 2nd loan will enable the group members to increase their business activity and boost their customer base and revenue. The first loan previously agreed upon was properly repaid.

loans.use: to buy condiments and cans of vegetable oil.

loans.name: Cristituta

texts.en:
Cristituta is a 47-year-old married woman with seven children with ages ranging from five to 21 years. Her husband is a farmer. Cristituta sells herbal medicines in her community and her income is able to help provide for her family’s household needs. She also helps her husband grow rice on their farm. 

Cristituta is requesting a loan to more herbal medicine to sell. She will also buy rice seed. In the future, she hopes that her family will have a successful business.

loans.use: to buy herbal medicines and rice seed

loans.name: Lucrecia Miriam

texts.es:
La Señora Lucrecia Miriam inicia sus actividades a las 8:00 am ofertando lo que es electrodomésticos y finaliza sus labores a las 6:00 pm,  Ella realiza esta actividad para la mantención de su hija.

 Este crédito lo quiere para  utilizarlo  en la  compra de  abanicos, piscina y lentes ya que es una zona calurosa 
Con dichos productos quiere satisfacer a sus clientes. Más en esta época del año.
 
Lucrecia  está agradecida por que sus créditos con ceprodel le han ayudado a incrementar su capital de trabajo ya que compra más barato sus productos de contado  y no de crédito, así ha logrado a realizar mejora en su casa  donde tiene mejor nivel de vida familiar.
texts.en:
Lucrecia Miriam starts her activities at 8am selling home appliances and stops at 6pm.  She does this to support her daughter.  She needs this loan to buy fans, a swimming pool and glasses because this is a hot zone.  She wants to meet customer demand with these products, more so this time of year.

Lucrecia is grateful for Ceprodel loans that have helped her increase her working capital because it’s less expensive to pay cash for her products than on credit.  She’s managed this way to do some home improvements where she now has a better level of family life.

loans.use: to buy fans, a swimming pool and glasses.

loans.name: Rincon De La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El grupo Rincon de la Esperanza es un grupo de señoras  luchadoras, bien organizado de ahí el compromiso y la puntualidad en sus pagos. Está integrado por 17 mujeres, todas ellas personas con muchas ganas de salir adelante y por medio de su trabajo poder ayudarse las unas a las otras.
Genara vende bebidas, y comenta que tiene muy buena clientela, ya que siempre tiene muy buena variedad. Gracias a su buena atención y sumado a sus buenos precios ha podido ir creciendo y hacerse conocida. Su meta es poder seguir creciendo y tener mayores ingresos para poder ayudar a su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de vinos, cervezas, gaseosas, energizantes y demás tipos de bebidas, con lo que podrá seguir estando bien abastecida y darle la variedad a la que están acostumbrados sus clientes.
texts.en:
The “Rincón de la Esperanza” (Corner of Hope) group is a group of hardworking, well organized women who are committed and punctual with their payments.  It has 17 women all of which very much want to get ahead and through their work be able to help each other out.

Genara sells beverages.  She comments that she has a good clientele because she always has a good variety.  Thanks to her good service added to good prices she been able to gradually grow and become well-known.  Her goal is to be able to continue growing and earn higher income to be able to help her family.

The loan she’s requesting is to buy wine, beer, soft-drinks, energy drinks and other types of beverages to continue to be well-stocked and to give her customers the wide variety they are accustomed to.

loans.use: to buy beverages to sell.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
This is Marites, 46, who is a resident of Silang, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Vito, a local councilor. Together with her husband, Marites manages their household while operating her he business. She works hard to continually provide an income for her family’s everyday expenses.

Marites oversees operations of the family’s transportation business. They have a motorcycle that carries up to four passengers to destinations within the community. The driver remits a boundary (daily quota) each day to Marites. Her regular customers are her neighbors and local community members and she earns a minimum of 500 PHP every day.

Marites is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan to help continue to operate her business and buy spare parts and accessories to maintain her motorcycle. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands. In the future, she hopes to grow her business and she dreams of giving her family a good future with all of her hard work on her business. Marites faithfully meets up weekly with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from studying the word of God. 

* All CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance, spare parts, and accessories

loans.name: Leakey

texts.en:
Leakey is 31 years old and married and with two children. For the past two years, he has operated a motorbike transport business to earn a living. He is able to provide for his children with the income from his business. Leakey also opened a retail shop with a previous loan from Faulu Kenya.

Leakey is requesting a 30,000 KES loan to buy a motorbike.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Marcia Argentina

texts.es:
La señora  Marcia Argentina,  es madre soltera de seis  hijos, su negocio es venta de ropa usada y calzado en punto fijo en  uno  de los mercados de la ciudad de león, donde oferta sus productos  desde las siete de la mañana  y finaliza hasta las tres de la tarde. 

 Este crédito ella lo solicita  para compra de una paca de ropa y una de zapato 

 Marcia nos cuenta que gracias a los créditos que Ceprodel le ha bridado ha logrado  comprar  productos de  mayor calidad para ofertarles a sus clientes y público en general, y con esta ganancia ha logrado hacer mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Marcia Argentina is a single mother of six children.  Her business is selling used clothes and shoes at a fixed place in one of the markets in the city of León where she offers her wares from 7am until 3pm.  She requests the loan to buy a bundle of clothes and one of shoes.

Marcia tells us that thanks to Ceprodel loans she’s been able to buy better quality products to offer her customers and general public and with the profits has been able to make improvements to her house.

loans.use: to buy a bundle of used clothes and one of shoes.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is married with five children and lives in Kampala, Uganda. She doesn’t take care of any additional family members. For the past three years, Mercy has run a banana-selling business. She works seven days a week and sells her products at the market. Mercy’s major business challenges are a lack of capital and seasonality. She lives in a rented home with access to electricity and no running water and her major monthly expenses are rent, food, and school fees.

Mercy is requesting a 100,000 UGX loan from MCDT SACCO to buy more bunches of bananas. Her goals and aspirations are to become a wholesaler and to educate her children through university.

loans.use: to buy bananas

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres Unidas de la ciudad de Ybycui, empezó a trabajar con la Fundación Paraguaya desde el año 2011, está integrado por 12 mujeres de la misma zona, todas ellas amigas y vecinas de esa ciudad. Las señoras son muy unidas, responsables y solidarias, tienen muchas ganas de trabajar con entusiasmo para así salir adelante y ayudarse las unas a las otras.
Maris se dedica a la venta de comidas, y nos comenta que tiene muy buena clientela siempre, ya que las comidas que hacen son muy ricas. Ella se define como una persona con muchas ganas de trabajar y salir adelante por medio de su trabajo. Su meta es poder seguir trabajando y algún día poder tener un gran local de comidas.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos que necesita para poder seguir haciendo sus comidas, como ser carnes, verduras, hortalizas, condimentos y demás, lo cual le será de mucha ayuda. Ella y su grupo agradecen por esta oportunidad que está recibiendo, pues le será de gran ayuda a todas ellas.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres Unidas” (United Women) committee from the city of Ybycui started working with Fundación Paraguaya in 2011.  It has 12 women members from the same area; they are all friends and neighbors from that city.  They are very united, responsible and mutually supportive.  They very much want to work with enthusiasm to get ahead and help each other out.

Maris sells food.  She tells us that she has a very good clientele always because the dishes she prepares are very tasty.  She defines herself as a person who very much wants to work and get ahead by means of her work.  Her goal is to continue working and one day have a great place for food.

She’s asking for the loan to buy the ingredients she needs to continue making her meals like meat, vegetables, greens, condiments and others, which will be of great help to her.  She and her group are grateful for this opportunity they are getting because it will be of great help to all of them.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, greens, condiments and others.

loans.name: Twisungane 23 B/rsz Group

texts.fr:
Isaïe fait partie du groupe Twisungane 23 B/Rsz. Il a 31 ans, il est marie avec 3 enfants de 9mois ans à 5 ans, dont 1 scolarise. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.
Isaïe est agriculteur de riz. C’est son deuxième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimique et payer la main d’œuvre.
Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est augmentée le volume de crédit demande pour finance son agriculture. Dans les prochaines années, Isaïe voudrait être un meilleur producteur de riz dans sa région. Avec les profits, il prévoit de payer le frais scolaire et médicaux de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Isaïe is part of the "Twisungane 23 B/Rsz" group. He is 31 years old and married with 3 children aged between 9 months and 3 years, one of whom goes to school. He himself has 6 years of primary school education.

Isaïe is a rice farmer. This is his 2nd loan cycle with ACB. He will use his loan to buy chemical fertilizer and pay the manual labourers. His strategy for the growth of his business is to increase the amount of loan money requested to finance his farming operation.

In the years ahead, Isaïe would like to be a better producer of rice in his area. He plans to use his profits to pay for his children's educational and medical expenses.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizer and pay the manual labourers.

loans.name: Jony

texts.es:
Yony  es un hombre de 26 años de edad, es un hombre casado y tiene 2 hijos dependientes. Vive en casa propia con su esposa e hijos en el caserío San José, en el distrito de Mórrope. Yony vive en la zona rural de este distrito,  cuenta con servicios de  luz y agua, el lugar es una comunidad pequeña con un aproximado de 100  familias.
La actividad que desarrolla Yony es la venta, crianza y  comercialización  de animales; así mismo también es carpintero. Esta actividad la realiza desde hace 6 años. El negocio esta situado en su domicilio y aprendió esta actividad de sus padres, es decir conoce a la perfección el rubro.   
El monto del crédito solicitado es de 3000 nuevos soles, los cuales se emplearán para invertir en la compra de materiales (madera y otros) los cuales serán usados para la elaboración de muebles, rubro el cual también maneja y tiene experiencia.
texts.en:
Yony, 26, is married and has two dependent children.  He lives in his own house with his wife and children in the San José settlement in Mórrope District.  Yony lives in a rural part of this district but has electricity and water.  The place is a small community with approximately 100 families.

Yony’s activity is selling, raising and selling animals but he’s also a carpenter.  He’s been in this activity for six years.  The business is located at home and he learned it from his parents, that is to say, he knows this line of work to perfection.

The amount of the loan he’s asking for is 3000 new soles that he will use to buy supplies (lumber and others) that will be used to manufacture furniture, a line of work he also participates in and in which he has experience.

loans.use: to buy wood to make furniture.

loans.name: Cissy

texts.en:
Cissy is married and has four children, two of whom attend school.  She lives in Kampala, Uganda.  Cissy has a beauty salon business, which she has run for four years. She works six days a week. Cissy sells her products in her shop. 

Cissy is requesting a loan for 100,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more boxes of cream relaxers, braids, and weaves.  The main business challenges for Cissy include increasing prices of cream relaxers and the inconsistency of her electricity.  Her goals are to own a fully stocked salon and to build her own house.  

Cissy lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent, food, and school fees..

loans.use: to purchase more boxes of cream relaxers, braids, and weaves.

loans.name: Benito

texts.es: Benito  tiene 64 años de edad y habita en casa de su propiedad en zona rural junto con su familia.  Benito se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos como: maíz, frijoles y maicillo. Además se dedica al cultivo de jocotes. Este su principal fuente de ingresos. Ha realizado esta actividad por mucho tiempo y es así como se gana la vida honradamente. Él es un hombre muy responsable, honesto y dedicado en su trabajo. Es muy conocido por sus vecinos los cuales dan buenas referencias de su trabajo como de su persona. Cada año repite está actividad ya que es una persona muy humilde y de escasos recursos el cual no puede accesar a otro tipo de negocio o trabajo. Este año al igual que los anteriores ha decidido cultivar la tierra y ya que la temporada de siembra esta cerca el quiere estar preparado con los  insumos agrícolas necesarios  para cosechar los principales granos básicos. Esta es la razón por la cual solicita este crédito a esta institución, INTEGRAL, ya que no cuenta con los recursos económicos necesarios  para realizar la inversión. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de insumos agrícolas como: semillas, abonos, insecticidas,  etc. De esta forma espera lograr cultivar los principales granos básicos de este año para poder llevar el pan de cada día a su familia.
texts.en:
Benito, 64, lives in a house of his own in a rural zone with his family.  He farms basic grains like corn, beans and sorghum; he also raises jocotes [fruit also known as Red Mombin, Purple Mombin, Hog Plum, Sineguela, and Siriguela].  This is his main source of income.  He has been in this activity for a long time and this is how he earns his livelihood honestly.  He is a very responsible, honest man who is dedicated to his work.  He’s very well known by his neighbors who give him good work as well as personal references.

He repeats this work each year because he’s a very humble person with scarce resources which keeps him from accessing another type of business or work.  This year like in all previous ones he’s decided to cultivate the land and since planting season is approaching he wants to be prepared with farm supplies needed to grow basic grains.

This is the reason behind his loan request to INTEGRAL because he does not have the necessary economic resources to make this investment.  He will use the loan to buy farm supplies like seeds, manure, insecticide, etc.  She hopes this way to farm the main basic grains this year to provide his family with their daily bread.

loans.use: to buy seeds, manure, insecticides, etc.

loans.name: Cabrayil

texts.en:
Cabrayil is 52 years old, married, and has four children. He started his own business when he was near to his pension to maintain the high standard of living of his family. He raises fruits and vegetables in his garden, which he has been doing for eight years. He is a very experienced farmer and has a deep knowledge of land and how to operate it. 

Cabrayil usually raises seasonal fruits and vegetables and sells them for profit in the central bazaar. His monthly income from this business is 80 AZN. His son helps him to raise crops.  This is only one source of income in his family.

Cabrayil would like to invest more capital in his business. He is requesting his second loan for 1,000 AZN, which he will use to purchase seeds and fertilizers. He hopes this loan will improve the life of his family. 

Fresh fruits and vegetables are very popular and in high demand because people prefer to eat every day and consider them very healthy. Also one of the favorite national dishes Dolma made of fresh eggplants, peppers, and tomatoes.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous Group

texts.fr: La cliente, membre d’un groupement de crédit, jeune femme  ambitieuse, âgée de 33 ans. Cette cliente est une femme d’affaire  vivant seul, elle n’a jamais connu aucune forme de mariage.  Elle est mère de 4 enfants. Elle supporte seule ses enfants. Elle est  vendeuse de friperie. Elle commença le petit commerce par la vente petits objets (beignets, pains, biscuits, savon, sucre, etc.), au long de la rue. Plus tard, elle fut initiée dans le business de la friperie par ses proches. Elle bénéficie régulièrement  des crédits pour renforcer son activité. Les bénéfices de son travail servent d’épargne, d’alimentation, a la scolarité de ses  enfants et de payement de loyer. Cependant, elle vient d’obtenir  son  17eme  crédit. Malgré les contraintes de la vie et la charge de ses enfants,  cette cliente est courageusement sereine d’affronter la vie. Ainsi elle a  décidé d’augmenter son montant de crédit pour ce nouveau cycle. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  d’acheter  2 ballons de friperies.  En plus, elle souhaite  voir ses enfants grandir confortablement et acheter une parcelle dans le futur. La cliente remercie Hekima pour  les actions d’autonomisation de pauvres femmes à faible revenu.
texts.en:
The customer, is a member of a lending group. She is a young, ambitious woman of 33 years of age. This customer is a business woman who lives alone and has never been married. She is the mother of 4 children and supports them alone. She sells second hand clothing and started her small business selling small items (donuts, bread, biscuits, soap, sugar, etc.) along the side of the road. Later on, she was introduced to the business of selling second hand clothes by her family.

She regularly benefits from loans to strengthen her business. The profits from her business are used to build her savings, buy food and pay for her children's educational expenses and the household bills. She has just received her 17th loan. In spite of the demands of everyday life and the responsibility of taking care of her children, she faces life bravely and serenely, and has decided to increase her loan amount for this new cycle. This new loan should be used to buy 2 bales of second hand clothing. She would also like to watch her children grow up comfortably and buy a plot of land in the future.

The customer thanks Hekima for its actions to empower women with lower incomes.

loans.use: to buy 2 bales of second hand clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous Group

texts.fr: La cliente, trésorière du groupe de crédit  Ujamaa, Femme  courageuse, entrepreneur, veuve, âgée de 42 ans et mère de 10 enfants. Elle est Vendeuse d’arachides. Il  commença ses affaires avec  son fonds propre reçu de son mari après vente de leur voiture. La cliente bénéficie régulièrement des crédits de Hekima pour renforcer ses affaires. Les bénéfices de son activité servent d’épargne, d’alimentation et d’appui à la scolarité de ses  enfants. Cependant, elle vient d’obtenir  son  18eme  crédit. Au cours de la période, cette cliente a vu ses ventes augmentées. Ainsi elle a  décidé d’augmenter son montant de crédit pour ce nouveau cycle. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  d’acheter les 2 sacs d’arachides. Ses difficultés sont souvent la rupture de stock et la fluctuation de prix lors de semi. La cliente  souhaite  voir ses enfants grandir et construire une clôture dans le futur. La cliente remercie Hekima pour  les actions d’autonomisation de pauvres femmes à faible revenu.Il sied de signaler que certaines clientes portent leurs bébés.
texts.en:
This client is the treasurer of the loan group Ujamaa. A courageous woman, an entrepreneur, and a widow, she is 42 years old and the mother of ten children. She is a retailer of peanuts. She started her business with her own funds received from her husband having sold their car. 

This client regularly benefits from Hekima loans for bolstering her business. The profits from her business go toward savings, food, and supporting her children's education. However, she just obtained her eighteenth loan. During this time, this client saw her sales go up. Thus she decided to increase her loan amount for this new cycle. This new loan must serve to buy 2 sacks of peanuts. Her difficulties are often an inventory shortage and price fluctuations. 

She wishes to see her children grown up, and she would like to build a fence in the future. 

This client thanks Hekima for its actions helping poor, low-income women to become autonomous. It's appropriate to indicate that certain clients are holding their babies.

loans.use: to pay for 2 sacks of peanuts

loans.name: Carlos Armando

texts.es: Carlos Armando  tiene 33 años de edad y habita en casa de su propiedad junto con su esposa e hijos. Él se dedica   al cultivo de los principales granos básicos desde hace muchos años. Además de esta activada la cual realiza año con año para llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar,  también se dedica a la crianza de ganado de engorde el cual cuida con el fin de venderlos una vez se encuentren en las condiciones adecuadas para realizar una buena venta. Estas actividades son las que le permiten  cubrir las necesidades básicas de su hogar. El es un hombre trabajador,  honrado y responsable.  Vive en condiciones muy humildes junto a su familia. Todo esto lo motiva a trabajar duramente para dar lo mejor a su familia ya que es la única forma  de poder cambiar la realidad en la que se encuentran. No pierde las esperanzas que con la ayuda de Dios y su arduo trabajo logrará su objetivo. Todo esto lo ha motivado a acercarse a esta  institución, INTEGRAL, para solicitar este crédito el cual solicita para invertir en la compra de ganado de engorde ya que es uno de sus principales fuentes de ingresos y ha notado que de esta forma puede tener un poco mas de ingresos y poder suplir las principales necesidades de su familia. Espera tener resultados favorables y lograr su sueño.
texts.en:
Carlos Armando, 33, lives in his own house with his wife and children.  He has farmed basic grains for many years.  In order to bring home daily bread in addition to this activity he also raises cattle that he cares for to sell once they reach adequate conditions to be sold well.  These activities make it possible for him to cover his home’s basic needs.

He is a hardworking, honest, responsible man.  He and his family live in very humble conditions which motivate him to work hard to give his family the best since this is the only way to change the reality they find themselves in.  He does not lose hope that with God’s help and his hard work he will reach his goal.

All this motivated him to call on this institution, CEPRODEL, to request this loan that he’s requesting to buy cattle to raise because it’s one of his main sources of income and he’s noticed that this way he can have a bit more income to cover his family’s basic needs.  He hopes to have favorable results and attain his dream.

loans.use: to buy cattle to raise.

loans.name: Roberto Ernesto

texts.es: Roberto Ernesto de 28 años de edad, habita en casa familiar junto con su madre. Él se dedica al comercio de tienda desde hace dos años. La ubicación del negocio se encuentra en su hogar de habitación el cual ha sabido adecuar de tal manera que sea atractivo para los clientes. Es muy emprendedor y dedicado en su trabajo. Tiene mucha experiencia en el negocio,  lo cual le ha permitido ganarse la confianza de muchas personas en la zona los cuales cada día lo prefieren más. Además de su tienda también comercializa pan dulce lo cual le ayuda  a atraer a más clientes ya que en su negocio pueden encontrar todo en un mismo lugar. Su deseo es seguir recibiendo los frutos de su negocio por lo que ha decidido invertir  en la compra de mercadería al por mayor ya que desea ser el líder en tiendas de su zona y así poder accesar a una mejor calidad de vida. Esta es la razón por las cuales se acerco a esta institución ya que no cuenta con los recursos económicos necesarios que le permitan realizar la inversión. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería de tienda al por mayor (arroz, azúcar, pan dulce, frijoles, macarrones, salcitas, bebidas, golosinas, etc.)  con el fin de mantener surtido el negocio que le permita atraer a más clientes  que le generen mayores ganancias y  pueda  lograr su sueño.
texts.en:
Roberto Ernesto, 28, lives in the family home with his mother.  He has been a grocer for the last two years.  The store is located in his home; he’s set aside space to set it up in a way that’s attractive to his customers.  He is very enterprising and dedicated to his work.  He has much business experience which has led to his winning over the trust of many people in the zone who prefer him more each day.  Besides the store, he also sells sweet bread which helps him to attract more customers since they can find everything they need in the same place.  His wish is to continue enjoying the fruits of his business and this is why he’s decided to buy merchandise at wholesale so that he can become a leading store in his area and thus access a better quality of life.

This is the reason why he called on this institution because he does not have the economic resources that will permit him to make this investment.  He will use the loan to buy merchandise for the store at wholesale (rice, sugar, sweet bread, noodles, sauces, soft-drinks, snacks, etc.) with the goal of maintaining his store well-stocked to attract more customers that will generate higher profits so he can attain his dream.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock his store.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is married with two children, both of whom are in school. She lives in Kampala, Uganda, and also takes care of two additional family members, her parents. For the past 10 years, Irene has been running a restaurant. She works six days a week. Her main business challenges are the increasing prices of food and thieves. Irene lives in a rented house with electricity and running water and her major monthly expenses include rent, food for her family, and school fees.

Irene is requesting a 700,000 UGX loan from MCDT SACCO to buy bunches of bananas beef, rice, and sweet and Irish potatoes. In the future she hopes to own a fully stocked restaurant and build her own house.

loans.use: to buy bananas, beef, rice, and potatoes

loans.name: Matilde Argentina

texts.es:
La señora Matilde es soltera madre de ocho hijos  comerciante se dedica a venta de frutas y verduras  en el mercado la terminal donde inicia sus labores desde las 6 am y finalizando  hasta las 12 pm.  Además viaja dos veces por semana a la   Ciudad de Managua para realizar la  compra de su producto.   Ella realiza este tipo de trabajo para ayudar a su esposo a la mantención del  hogar. 
 
Este crédito lo solicito  para la compra de piña, melón, naranja, dulce, papaya, papa, cebolla.

Matilde  está agradecida por que sus créditos con ceprodel le han ayudado a incrementar su capital de trabajo ya que compra más barato  sus productos de contado  y no de crédito, así ha logrado a realizar mejora en su casa  donde tiene mejor nivel de vida familiar.
texts.en:
Matilde is the single mother of eight children.  She sells fruits and vegetables at the La Terminal market.  She starts her work there at 6:00 a.m., and she works until 12:00 p.m.  She also travels to the city of Managua two times a week to purchase the fruits and vegetables.  She does this type of work to help her husband with the household expenses.

She requested this loan to buy pineapple, melon, oranges, papayas, potatoes, and onions.

Matilde is grateful for her loans with Ceprodal.  They have helped her to increase her working capital in order to buy her products at lower prices by paying cash instead of paying by credit.  This way she has managed to make improvements to her house, where she have a better standard of living with her family.

loans.use: to buy pineapple, melon, oranges, papayas, potatoes, and onions.

loans.name: Moussa

texts.fr: Moussa est un jeune célibataire.Depuis quatre ans, il exerce le métier de caissier dans un établissement bancaire de sa localité .Après quelques années d'expérience, il a décidé de poursuivre ses études, en cours du soir. Il sollicite ainsi un pret de 200000f pour s'inscrire dans un institut de commerce de sa localité.Son ambition est d'obtenir un diplôme supérieur en commerce.
texts.en: Moussa is a young single man.  For the past four years he has been working as a cashier in a local bank.  After gaining experience for a few years, he has decided to go back to school and take evening classes.  He is therefore requesting a loan of 200,000 francs to enroll in a business institute in his locality.  His ambition is to obtain a higher education degree in business.

loans.use: to enroll in a business institute.

loans.name: Bertha Alicia

texts.es: Bertha Alicia de 56 años de edad, habita en casa de su propiedad junto con su hija, yerno y dos empleados. Ella se dedica a la producción y venta de pupusas desde hace 15 años, las hace de chicharron, frijoles y queso, sólo de queso y otras variedades pedidas por sus clientes. La ubicación del negocio se encuentra en su hogar de habitación el cual se encuentra en una zona accesible, sobre calle principal del lugar donde habita. Vale la pena destacar que es una mujer trabajadora,  responsable y muy valiente.  Gracias  a la gran experiencia con la que cuenta ha logrado ganarse la confianza de sus vecinos los cuales confían mucho en su trabajo y están muy satisfechos con el servicio que reciben. Además, ella tiene muy en cuenta la calidad y precios de las deliciosas pupusas ya que en este tipo de negocios es lo más importante para los clientes. Todos los días se levanta muy temprano para atender su hogar como a  su negocio dado que ella y su hija son las que se dedican a ambas actividades. A pesar de su avanzada edad no se cansa de trabajar ya que a ella el trabajo le da esperanzas y energía. Es por esta razón que su sueño es mantener activo su negocio por mucho más tiempo dado que es uno de sus principales fuentes de ingresos. Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en su pupuseria en la compra de los insumos necesarios como: frijoles, maíz, arroz, queso, chicharrón,  tomates, repollo, etc. para la elaboración de las deliciosas pupusas que con mucho amor prepara todo los días. Espera que esta decisión le permita aumentar sus ingresos y así poder mejorar su calidad  de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Bertha Alicia, age 56, lives with her daughter, her son-in-law, and two empoyees in her own house.  She has been making and selling “pupusas” (stuffed griddle corn cakes) for 15 years.  She makes “chicharron” (fried pork rinds), beans and cheese, only cheese, and other varieties of pupusas that her customers request.  Her business is located in her home.  It is in an accessible area on a main street in the area where she lives. 

It is worth pointing out that she is a hard-working, responsible, and very courageous woman.  Thanks to the great amount of experience that she has, she has managed to win the confidence of her neighbors.  They trust her work a lot, and they are very satisfied with the service they receive.  Also, she is very attentive to the quality and prices of the delicious pupusas.  That is the most important things to the customers in this business.

She gets up very early every day to tend to her house and her business.  She and her daughters are the ones who devote themselves to both activities.  In spite of her advanced age, she does not get tired of working.  The work gives her hope and energy.  That is the reason that her dream is to keep her business active for a long time, given that it is one of their main sources of income.

She has made the decision to request a loan from Integral in order to invest in her pupusa business.  She will buy the supplies she needs like beans, corn, rice, cheese, chicharrón, tomatoes, and cabbage, etc.  She will use the supplies to make the delicious pupusas that she prepares every day with a lot of love.  She hopes that this decision will allow her to increase her income.  That way she will be able to improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy beans, corn, rice, cheese, chicharrón, tomatoes, and cabbage, etc.

loans.name: Tahir

texts.en:
Tahir is 54 years old, married, and has five children. He breeds calves and cows, which he has been doing for 20 years. After several attempts to find a job, he gave up and decided to start his own business. With the help of his wife, they purchased their first cattle.

Tahir usually buys small calves, raises and fattens them for five to six months, and then resells them at a profit in the livestock bazaar. His monthly income is 200 AZN; this business is the only one source of income for the family. Tahir also keeps milk cows for personal use and for selling to neighbors. 
 
Tahir wants to expand his business and improve life conditions of his family. He is requesting his second loan from AqroInvest CU for 1,000 AZN, which he will use to purchase one calf and one milk cow.  

Beef is in very high demand in Azerbaijan; people use it in everyday dishes such as pilau and dolma.

loans.use: to purchase one calf and one milk cow

loans.name: Hawa Seydou

texts.fr:
Madame Hawa Seydou  est âgée de 54 ans et a 7 enfants dont l’ainé a 32 ans et le cadet 12 ans. Hawa Seydou est une matrone dans une case de santé de la place. Elle sert encore et profite de l’occasion en cas de rupture de stock, d’acheter des produits pharmaceutiques et de les revendre à la structure en cas de besoin. Elle a acquis une expérience de 21 ans dans ce domaine.
Hawa Seydou participe à la dépense quotidienne de la famille et veille au bien être des membres de cette dernière. Elle reçoit néanmoins l’appui financier de son fils ainé qui travaille.
Elle aimerait avec les bénéfices de son activité, construire une maison et être à l’abri des tracasseries de la location.
texts.en:
Madam Hawa Seydou is 54 years old. She has seven children, the eldest of whom is 32 and the youngest 12 years of age.

Hawa Seydou is a matron in a local health center. She is still active and when necessary she takes the opportunity to purchase out-of-stock pharmaceutical products and resell them to the center . She has an accumulated 21 years' experience in this field.

Hawa Seydou participates in the family's daily expenditures and ensures the welfare of family members. However she receives financial support from her eldest son, who is working.

She would like to use the the profits from her business activity to build a house and be free of lease-related problems.

loans.use: purchase pharmaceutical products for resale

loans.name: Mamadou Yoro

texts.fr: Mamadou est un homme marié. Il est père de trois enfants. Il a ouvert un cyber - café ou il offre des services de connexion internet et de reprographie à ses clients. Le cybercafé génère des revenus assez substantiels qui lui permettent de prendre en charge les dépenses d'entretien de sa famille. Afin d'améliorer l'équipement de ses locaux, il sollicite un pret de 130 000f pour des tables et des chaises. Son ambition est d'améliorer ses services.
texts.en: Mamadou is married and the father of 3 children. He has opened a cybercafé in which he provides his customers with access to the internet and offers reprographic services. The cybercafé generates pretty significant revenues which allow him to take care of his family's maintenance expenses. He is requesting a loan of 130 000 francs with which to buy tables and chairs. He strives to improve his services.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs.

loans.name: Paraiso De Los Claveles Group

texts.es: Las nuevas integrantes del grupo son la señora Florencia, va a comprar con su préstamo ropa nueva y de uso, la señora Manuela va a comprar azúcar, pintura, sabores, bolsas, popote, la señora Arcelia va a comprar una base, comal, gas, un bote de aluminio, un tanque de gas, para acondicionar sus negocio, la señora luz María va a comprar cosméticos y perfumes, la señora Epifanía va a comprar jabón, huevo, aceite, azúcar. El resto de las integrantes siguen en la actividad que vienen desarrollando. La señora Florencia tiene 55 años de edad, ella es soltera con 3 hijos varones mayores de edad, ya son casados, ella vende ropa nueva y Americana de basar en los tianguis, ella solicito su prestamo para comprar ropa nueva, blusas y vestidos para niña y ropa americana de basar blusas, faldas, camisas, short, ella inicio su negocio hace 3 años por necesidad, su negocio es importante porque de ahí tiene ingresos para la comida y obtiene ganancias que utiliza para volver a invertir en ropa, sus sueños y esperezas son seguir progresando en su negocio y que sus hijos le echen ganas y tengan su propio negocio. Las integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundacion Realida, "gracias por sus prestamos, nos ayudan a creser los negocio y ojala pudieran bajar el interes".
texts.en: The new members of this group are Florencia, who will use her loan to buy new and used clothes; Manuela, who will buy sugar, paint, flavors, bags and drinking straws; Arcelia, who will buy a "comal" (a griddle), a base for the comal, gas, an aluminum jar and a gas tank to fit out her shop; Luz María, who will buy cosmetics and perfumes; and Epifanía, who will buy soap, eggs, oil and sugar. The other members of the group keep on engaging in their respective activities. Florencia is 55 years old, she is a single mother of 3 adult sons who are all married. She sells new clothes and used American clothes that she will sell in the street markets. She is requesting a loan to buy new clothes such as blouses and dresses for girls, as well as used American clothes such as blouses, skirts, shirts and shorts. She started her activity 3 years ago out of necessity, and her activity is important for her because the income it generates helps her buying food and investing in the purchase of clothes for her activity. She hopes that her activity will keep on growing, and that also her children will be willing to run their own activities. This is what the members of the group want to say to Kiva and to Fundacion Realida: “thank you for your loans, they help us making our activities grow. If only the interest rates would lower”.

loans.use: To buy new clothes (blouses and dresses for girls) and used American clothes (blouses, skirts, shirts and shorts).

loans.name: Maina

texts.ru:
Майна – участник группы «Акмарал», замужем, воспитывает 3 детей.  Майна занимается выпечкой хлеба и продажей муки. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Майна обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 10,000 сом (KGS)  на закуп 10 мешков муки.  Доходы от кредита Майна планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение бизнеса.
texts.en: Maina is a participant of the "Akmaral" group, married and has three children.  She is involved in baking bread and selling flour.  In order to further develop her business, Maina requested a loan in the amount of 10,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy ten bags of flour.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into a continued expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase flour

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has five children, three of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (two grandchildren). Sarah has a business of selling charcoal.  She has been in this business for two years, and she works six days out of every week. Sarah sells her products in a shop, by means of retail. Sarah has requested for a loan of 500,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal. She also generates additional income through cleaning in Kampala Capital City Authority. The main business challenges for Sarah include the rainy season and thieves. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to become a wholesaler and also to start going to villages for charcoal. Sarah lives in a home that she owns; she doesn't have access to electricity and has access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include feeding the family and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Joaquín

texts.es: Joaquin de 49 años de edad, habita en casa de su propiedad junto con su familia. Él se dedica a la agricultura. Cada año  cultiva la tierra y cosecha los diferentes granos básicos que son los que le permiten llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar. Vale la pena mencionar que este es su principal fuente de ingresos  por lo que es muy importante para él y su familia tener una buena cosecha cada año.  Joaquín se caracteriza por ser un hombre trabajador, emprendedor y sobre todo responsable ya que cuando se traza una meta siempre trabaja muy duro para lograrla. Dado que el invierno es la época idónea para el cultivo de los diferentes granos básicos ha decidido invertir en la compra de los insumos agrícolas necesarios  ya que quiere estar preparado cuando la época adecuada para la siembra se haga presente. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a INTEGRAL para comprar semillas, abonos y venenos  para plagas, etc. con lo cual espera poder continuar realizando su trabajo que es lo que le permite cubrir  las necesidades de su hogar. Confía en Dios y en su trabajo que los resultados serán favorables.
texts.en:
Joaquin, age 49, lives with his family in his own house.  He is a farmer.  Every year he cultivates the land and harvests different basic grains, which are those that allow him to bring home the daily bread each day.

It is worthwhile to mention that this is his main source of income.  Therefore, it is very important to him and to his family to have a good harvest each year.  Juaquín is known for being a hard-working, enterprising, and above all, a responsible man.  When he sets a goal he always works very hard to reach it.
Given that the winter is the ideal time to cultivate the different basic grains, he has decided to buy the necessary agricultural supplies.  He wants to be prepared to plant when the right time comes. 

It is for that reason that he is requesting a loan from Integral to buy seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides, etc.  With these supplies he hopes to be able to continue doing his work, which allows him to cover the household necessities.  He trusts in God and in his work that the results will be favorable.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides, etc.

loans.name: Hellen's Group

texts.en:
Hellen's group is comprised of two hardworking women. Hellen is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in the Kampala south region of Uganda. She is married and has one child. For the past two years, Hellen has been working hard to manage her health clinic, which sells drugs. 

To help expand her business, Hellen has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more drugs for resale, and will help Hellen to generate greater profits and save her money for future use. Hellen hopes that in the future she will be able to rent all the shops for her own business. 

Hellen is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Hellen's future prospects by helping her to learn how to save money.

loans.use: to buy more drugs for resale

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Del Barrio San Pedro Group

texts.es:
Este grupo de la ciudad de Encarnación, surgió por promociones realizadas en la zona,  es un grupo antiguo y trabajan con la fundación desde el año 2008 se encuentran  en el 13º ciclo. Son personas con muchas habilidades y ganas de salir adelante.
Una de las integrantes del grupo es la Sra Lelia, ella trabaja como empleada doméstica y también  se dedica  a la venta de ropas en forma ambulante. Es una persona muy sacrificada y por sobre todo muy trabajadora, comenta que gracias a su trabajo puede ayudar en la casa con los gastos del día a día.
Cuenta la Sra. Lelia  solicitó el crédito para la compra de ropas en general para volver a vender. Ella se encuentra  muy agradecida ya que gracias a que está ayuda, le hará mejorar sus ingresos y el de su familia.
texts.en:
This group was formed in the city of Encarnación, which developed as a result of promotions in the area. It is a well established group, which has been working with the foundation since 2008. They are currently in their 13th loan cycle. They are a group with many abilities and a strong desire to get ahead.  

One of the group members is Lelia. She works as a maid and also earns income selling clothing by going door to door. She is someone who has made many sacrifices and who above all is a hard worker. She said that thanks to her work she is able to help with the day to day expenses of her household. 

Lelia has requested a loan to use to buy clothing which she will resell. She is very thankful because thanks to this help she has been able to increase her income and the income of her family.

loans.use: to buy clothing to resell.

loans.name: Ruth Joaquina

texts.es: Ruth Joaquina  de 45 años de edad, habita en casa de su propiedad junto con su esposo. Ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de deliciosas pupusas en variedad de sabores. Tiene muchos años de dedicarse a esta actividad por lo que ya cuenta con mucha experiencia y con muchos clientes fijos que cada día la prefieren más. Ella se caracteriza por ser una mujer emprendedora, responsable y muy trabajadora.  Cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales ya que para ella es muy importante que sus clientes estén satisfechos con el servicio que reciben  ya que solo de esta forma logrará mantenerlos contentos y  quedarán con ganas de regresar a su negocio.  Ha estado pensando en la forma de hacerlo crecer y ha llegado a la conclusión que la mejor forma es solicitando este crédito a INTEGRAL e invirtiendo en la compra de los insumos necesarios para la elaboración de pupusas como: frijoles, queso, arroz, maíz, chicharon, tomates, ayotes, repollo, etc. además poder mejorar las instalaciones del negocio dado que por el momento no cuenta con un lugar cerrado en el cual pueda tener el negocio más seguro.  Espera lograr una mayor preferencia y de esta forma aumentar sus ganancias y mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: Forty-five year old Ruth Joaquina lives in her own home along with her husband.  She makes and sells delicious pupusas in a variety of flavors and has been doing this for many years.  She has much experience and many steady customers who prefer to buy from her more each day.  She’s known for being a very hardworking, responsible, enterprising woman and has many personal references because it’s very important to her that her customers are satisfied with the service they get because this is the only way she can keep them happy and make them want to return to her business.  She’s been thinking about how she can grow the business and has decided that the best way is to request a loan through INTEGRAL and invest it in ingredients that she needs to make pupusas; things like beans, cheese, rice, dried corn, pork rinds, tomatoes, squash, cabbage, etc.  She also wants to improve the business’ facility, given that she currently doesn’t have an enclosed area so that the business will be more secure.  She hopes to increase her customers’ prefence and in this way increase her income and improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Manuel Gerardo

texts.es: Manuel Gerardo de 32 años de edad  habita en casa de su propiedad  junto con su grupo familiar. Él se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos y  yuca. Este ha sido su negocio desde hace muchos años, y es lo que le permite llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar. El señor Manuel es un hombre muy trabajador del cual muchas personas dan buenas referencias.  Por medio del cultivo de estos productos es como puede ir subsistiendo él y su familia ya que cada año al sacar la cosecha pone a la venta una parte para sacar los ingresos necesarios para cubrir otras necesidades del hogar. Su deseo es  invertir  un poco más en la agricultura con el fin de cosechar una mayor cantidad de granos básicos que le permitan mejorar su nivel de  ventas como sus ingresos. Esta es la razón por la  que tomo la decisión de acercarse  a esta institución, INTEGRAL,  para invertir en la compra de los insumos necesarios (abonos, semillas,  venenos para plagas, etc.) para invertir en la cosecha de una  mayor cantidad  de granos básicos y lograr el objetivo final de mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia. Confía en Dios y en su trabajo que logrará resultados favorables.
texts.en: Manuel Gerardo is 32 years old. He lives in his own home, along with his family. He makes a living farming basic grains and yucca. He has been working as a farmer for many years; it is what allows him to put bread on the table. He is a very hard worker, whom many people think highly of. By cultivating these products he is able to sustain himself and his family. Every year during harvest time he sells a part of the harvest to be able to have funds to cover the necessities of his home. He would like to invest a little more in his crops, with the goal of having a better harvest which will increase the amount of basic grains he has, allowing him to increase his sales and profits. This is the reason he has decided to join this institution (Integral), to invest in the purchase of necessary supplies (fertilizer, seeds, fungicide, etc.) which will allow him to improve his harvest of basic grains and succeed in the final goal of improving he and his family's living conditions. He has faith in God and in his work that he will succeed with favorable results.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds, fungicide, etc.

loans.name: Almaz

texts.en:
Almaz is 49 years old.  She is a widow who raises her three children on her own.  She is a vendor at the market and sells a variety of goods including flour, beverages, pasta, butter and candies.  She has 15 years of experience and has deep knowledge of the market and client demand. 

The food products Almaz sells are very popular and in high demand.  Her monthly profit from selling food is 300 AZN.  Her father helps by purchasing products and bringing them to her shop.  This is the sole source of financial income for her family.  She is a very successful entrepreneur due to her shop’s good location in the central bazaar of her home city.

Almaz has applied for a loan of 1,000 AZN loan in order to purchase more food products and diversify the range of goods she sells to meet customer demand.  This will be her second loan and she has positive loan history.

loans.use: to buy more food products and increase her turnover.

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en:
Winnie is a widowed woman. She has two children who are 11 and 14. She is aggressive and determined to her succeed in her daily activity of running a beauty salon. She works really hard in order to support her children. She has been in this business for 5 years and employs one staff member. Winnie provides hair services, such as plaiting and blow drying, and sells cosmetics near a busy hotel. Her primary customers are ladies.

The business challenge Winnie faces is insufficient funds to expand the beauty salon. Earlier, she requested for three loans of 20,000, 50,000, and 150,000 Kenya shillings (KES) and was able to pay them back well. She hopes that, with this loan of 100,000 KES, she will be able to improve her business by buying more cosmetics and paying for renovation of the beauty salon. In the future, she looks forward to owning a hair dressing school. In addition, she also plan to venture into running rental houses.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and pay for renovation of her salon.

loans.name: Janat

texts.en:
Janat is married and has five children, all of whom attend school. She also takes care of additional family members (her late sister's children). She lives in Kampala, Uganda.  Janat has a retail shop, which she has run for two years. She works seven days a week. Janat sells her products in her shop. She also generates additional income through working as a health worker. 

Janat is requesting a loan for 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy bags of sugar, maize flour, rice, cartons of salt, and boxes of soap. The main business challenges for Janat include seasonality and thieves.  Her goals are to become a wholesaler and to educate her children up to university. 

Janat lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, sugar, rice, salt, and soap.

loans.name: Jorge Wilfrido

texts.es:
Jorge tiene 39 años, se considera una persona alegre, sociable y sobre todo responsable con su familia. Jorge vive con su esposa y su hijo en la ciudad de Cotacachi que se encuentra a 25 minutos de Otavalo en la provincia de Otavalo.

Jorge trabaja solo en la confección de camisetas, blusas. Jorge empezó su negocio hace dos años, debido a que es su única fuente de ingresos y necesita cubrir sus necesidades. Es por eso que realiza un crédito en Fodemi, el mismo que va a utilizar en la compra de materia prima como tela por rollos, hilos por cajas, estampas, ligas para poder cubrir un pedido que tiene, proceso que permitirá obtener buenos ingresos y mejorará la calidad de vida de su familia.

Jorge sueña con tener un taller grande en el cual pueda generar empleo.
texts.en:
Jorge is 39 years old and considers himself to be a happy and sociable person, and above all, responsible toward his family. Jorge lives with his wife and their son in the city of Cotocachi that is 25 minutes from Otavalo in the province of Otavalo.

Jorge works alone making t-shirts and blouses. Jorge began his business 2 years ago, and it is his only source of income and he needs it to provide for his needs. For this reason he is asking for a loan from Fodemi to buy supplies like rolls of fabric, boxes of thread, stamps, and elastic to fill an order. This will allow him to obtain more earnings and improve his family's quality of life.

Jorge dreams of having a big workshop where he can hire employees.

loans.use: buy supplies like rolls of fabric, boxes of threads, stamps, and elastic to fill an order.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 41 years old. He is married and lives in Tskaltubo District, West Georgia, with his wife, Indira. David and Indira earn their living through agricultural business. They have two milk cows. Indira produces cheese and sells on average 30 kg of this product at the local market. Along with the dairy farm the family has two greenhouses, which is used for growing tomato and greens. David and Indira sell the harvested products at the local open market. The total average monthly income of the family is 900 Laris (GEL).

David requested credit for purchasing fertilizer. He will use it for the greenhouses. After properly done seasonal works the family will get a bigger and better-quality harvest than in previous years. They will sell it through existing distribution channels and get more income than in previous years. They will use the increase in income to purchase needed household goods to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Feibe

texts.en:
Feibe lives in Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has three children, two of whom attend school.  She does not take care of any additional family members. Feibe lives in a home that she rents.  She has access to electricity but does not have access to running water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent, food and school fees.

Feibe has a business operating a food stall.  She has been in this business for three years and she works seven days out of every week.  Feibe sells her products to retail customers at the market.  Feibe has requested a loan of 100,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy boxes of tomatoes, Irish potatoes, cassava and sweet potatoes.  The main business challenges that Feibe faces include seasonality and thieves.  

Her goal and aspiration for her business is to become a wholesaler.  Feibe also aims to educate her children through the university level.

loans.use: to buy boxes of tomatoes, Irish potatoes, cassava and sweet potatoes.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with three children and all her children are in school. She does not take care of additional family members. She sells cassava chips at the market on retail basis. She has been in this business for the last three years. She works seven days a week. She has requested for a loan of 100,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX) from MCDT SACCO to buy one bag of cassava and cooking oil. Her major business challenges are seasonality and transportation. Her goals and aspirations are to get a permanent business premise and also to employ one girl to assist in the business. She lives in a rented house and the family does not have access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more bags of cassava and cooking oil

loans.name: Víctor Eugenio

texts.es: Víctor Eugenio  de 59 años de edad,  habita en casa de su propiedad junto con su esposa e hijos.  Él se caracteriza por ser un hombre emprendedor, responsable y trabajador. Él se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos y a la comercialización de productos de tienda.  Cada año realiza esta actividad en la cual cultiva, frijoles y maíz que son los granos básicos más dados en su zona. . Su negocio es cultivar y vender la cosecha. De esta manera es como se gana la vida y lleva el pan de cada día a su hogar. Este negocio es su principal fuente de ingresos por lo que su deseo es continuar con su negocio por mucho más tiempo  ya que solo así puede ayudar a su familia a seguir adelante y tratar de dar cada día mejores condiciones de vida. Para él lo más importante es su familia  y es por ella que trabaja día con día desde tempranas horas de la mañana dado que él es el único que recibe ingresos por el trabajo que realiza.  Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en los insumos necesarios (semilla, venenos para plagas, abonos, etc.)  para el cultivo de los granos básicos que es la actividad que realiza una vez al año.  Tiene mucha confianza que de esta manera logrará su objetivo y le podrá dar a su familia diferentes condiciones de vida  a las que tiene.
texts.en:
Víctor Eugenio is 59 years old and lives in a house on his property with his wife and children. He describes himself as a being an entrepreneurial, responsible, and hard-working man. He works farming basic grains and selling products from a store. Each year he farms beans and corn which are the main crops in his area. His business is growing and selling his harvest. In this way he earns a living and brings home the daily bread every day. This business is his main source of income and his desire is to continue with his business for a long time, since this is the only way he can help his family get ahead and try to give them better conditions of life each day.

For him, the most important thing is his family, and it is for them that he works day by day starting very early in the morning since he is the only one who earns money doing his work. He decided to ask for a loan from INTEGRAL to invest in the purchase of the necessary products (seeds, pesticides, fertilizers, etc.) for the planting the crops as he does once a year. He has a lot of confidence that this will help him achieve his goal and he will be able to give his family different life conditions than those they currently have.

loans.use: buy seeds, pesticides, fertilizer, etc.

loans.name: Samalie

texts.en:
Samalie lives in Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has two children, both of whom attend school.  She also takes care of additional family members (sisters).  Samalie lives in a home that she rents.  She has access to electricity but does not have access to running water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent, feeding the family and school fees.

Samalie has a business, selling cereals in a shop to retail customers.  She has been in this business for two years and she works six days out of every week.  Samalie has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy bags of maize and beans.  She also generates additional income by renting rooms.  The main business challenges that Samalie faces include transportation and thieves. 

Her goals and aspirations for her business are to become a wholesaler and to own a delivery van to facilitate transportation.

loans.use: to buy bags of maize and beans.

loans.name: Espiga Y Luna Group

texts.es: Todas las integrantes siguen en la actividad que vienen desarrollando. La señora Graciela Silvia tiene 48 años de edad, ella vive en unión libre con su esposo que trabaja en el campo, ella tiene 1 hijo varón de 26 años de edad ya trabaja, ella vende ropa de dama, ella solicito su préstamo para comprar blusas, faldas, playeras, y ropa interior de dama, ella inicio su negocio hace un año para tener una distracción y porque le gustan las ventas y atender a sus clientes amablemente, su negocio es importante porque obtiene ingresos para el bienestar de la familia y se sente orgullona de tener su propio negocio, ella está muy contenta con el préstamo que le van a dar por la oportunidad de surtir su negocio y verlo bonito para darle buen servicio a sus clientas las jóvenes y señoras amas de casa. sus sueños y esperanzas son que toda la familia este contenta, unida y con buena salud. Las integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “gracias por sus préstamos nos ayudan a superarnos y lograr nuestras metas, y que sigan ayudando con sus préstamos a las personas que lo solicitan”.
texts.en: All of the members are still developing the same businesses. Señora Graciela Silvia is 48. She is in a common-law marriage and her husband works in the fields.
