She has one son, age 26, who works. Graciela sells women's clothing. She requested this loan for the purchase of blouses, t-shirts, and women's underwear. She started her business one year ago so that she would have something to do and because she enjoys sales and providing good customer service. Her business is important because it provides an income for her family's well-being. She is proud of having her own business, and very happy to be getting this loan because it will provide her with the opportunity to stock her business and make it pretty. She will be able to provide a good service to the young women and housewives. Her hopes and dreams are for her whole family to be happy, united, and healthy. The group members would like to tell Kiva and the Fundacion Realidad: "Thank you for these loans. You are helping us to get ahead and reach our goals. We hope you keep helping those who ask with their loans."

loans.use: to buy blouses, skirts, t-shirts, and women's underwear.

loans.name: Makvala

texts.en:
Makvala is 60 years old.  She lives in the Martvili District with her husband, Gelvas, her 40-year-old son, her daughter-in-law and two grandsons who are eight and five years of age. 

The family earns a living through an agricultural business.  They have three dairy cows and five calves.  Makvala produces cheese and sells it in the village.  In addition, the family has a small poultry farm with 2,500 hens.  Makvala sells chicken at the local open market.  Finally, the family has a cornfield, which is of 0.8 hectares in area.  Makvala uses the harvested maize mainly for feeding the cows and chickens.  The family’s total average monthly income is 800 Laris.

Makvala has requested a loan in order to purchase feed for her hens. With quality feed the hens will grow well and Makvala will be able to sell them for a convenient price.  As a result, Makvala will earn a good income.  She will use it to renovate the house, as it is old and needs some repair.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her hens.

loans.name: Khatuna

texts.en: Khatuna is from a village of Tskaltubo District. She is 44 years old and lives with her family: husband, Bessik, a 22-year-old daughter, and 15-year-old son. Bessik is a house painter. Khatuna runs a small trade business, a family-owned grocery store in the village. She purchases products from nearby wholesale markets and sells them in the store. The total average monthly income of the family is 1,000 Laris (GEL). Khatuna requested credit for increasing the stock to trade in the store. She will diversify the assortment and attract new customers. It will increase the sales and the profit of the store. Khatuna will reinvest the increased profit in the same business to expand it and make more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase grocery products for increasing the stock for trade in the grocery store

loans.name: Rahab

texts.en:
Rahab is 25 years old and married. To earn a living, she runs a retail shop where she mainly sells cereals. She has been in the business for three years.  She was previously operating a cafeteria to earn a living. She has improved her business because she has been trained in business management and has learned business record-keeping.

Rahab hopes to expand her business into wholesale in the future. She has requested for a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy cereals.

loans.use: To buy cereals

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es: Maria de los ángeles desde hace  diez años se dedica  a su actividad económica que es una pulpería venta de productos básicos para el hogar de consumo diario como: arroz, aceite, azúcar, fósforos, gaseosas, pan, tiste, refresco natural, verduras,  entre otros, está solicitando nuevamente para invertir en el negocio ya que ha sido su herramienta fundamental para su sustento diario y el de su familia.
texts.en: Maria de los Angeles has had her business for ten years. She runs a small general store where she sells basic staples for the home and daily consumption such as: rice, oil, sugar, matches, pop, bread, tiste [a drink], natural drinks, vegetables, and other items. She is requesting a new loan to invest in her business, since this business has been a critical tool for her family's sustenance.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, sugar, matches, pop, bread, tiste [a drink], natural drinks, vegetables, and other items.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 30 years old, married, and blessed with three children. To earn a living, she runs a retail shop. She started the business in 2009. She also does farming to supplement her income. Through Faulu Kenya, she has been trained in financial management. This has helped her to improve her business.

Esther hopes to expand her business in the future. She has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy milk, maize flour, and soap.

loans.use: To buy milk, maize flour, and soap

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah is 43 years old and married with five children. She runs a retail shop where she mainly sells household goods. She has been in the business since 2008.  She was previously farming before she started the business. She has improved her business since she joined Faulu Kenya because she has been trained in business management skills.

Hannah has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy jugs, mugs, cups, and plates.

loans.use: To buy jugs, mugs, cups, and plates

loans.name: Marthen

texts.en:
Marthen is a 26-year-old man who is married to Aksa, a 26-year-old lady. They have one child named Aldy who is four years old. Marthen owns a kiosk business selling household items such as sugar, coffee, detergent, cigarettes, bath soap, mosquito coils, snacks, soft drinks, etc. He initiated the business four years ago using his own capital. This business is very meaningful to Marthen and family as it enables him to cover his family's living expenses.

Marthen was thinking of adding more stock to his business such as instant noodles, snacks, cooking oil, etc as well as buying spare motorcycle parts. He met a TLM loan officer and got information on the individual lending program. He then was interested in joining the program and requested a loan of IDR 10,000,000.

loans.use: to purchase instant noodles, snacks, cooking oil, etc as well as motorcycle spare parts

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua lives together with the husband and four children at Esuskyire near Abura. Efua sells "gari" (a couscous-like grain made from grated cassava), cassava, and plantains, which she has done for 15 years now. She uses her income to assist the husband in paying their children’s school fees. Efua will use her loan to purchase bags of gari, to sell. With the new profit she will expand her business.

loans.use: purchase bags of "gari" to sell

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana de sesenta años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida, por una zona muy concurrida de personas; Ella posee una pupusería en el mercado municipal del lugar tiene muchos años de experiencia en la cocina, elabora las mejores pupusas de queso, revueltas, de frijol con queso, entre otras, se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues todo el que prueba las deliciosas pupusas sabe que están hechas con material de primera calidad y que las vende a precios accesibles, además el servicio es inigualable, Juana siempre es muy amable con todos sus clientes; es una mujer entregada a su trabajo, muy honrada y dispuesta a salir adelante, se levanta todos los días muy temprano a dar lo mejor de ella y su mas grande deseo es hacer crecer su negocio es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar maíz, queso, chicharrón, frijoles, verdura, etc. Juana tiene la esperanza que así podrá ofrecerle a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en: Juana is sixty years old. She lives together with her life partner, in an area where lots of people pass by. She has a pupusa stand at the municipal market in her town. She has many years of experience in cooking, and she makes the best pupusas filled with cheese, refried beans, and beans with cheese, among others. She has built up a strong customer base, since everyone who tries her delicious pupusas knows that they are made with the best quality ingredients, and she sells them at affordable prices. In addition, her service is unmatched; Juana is always very friendly with all of her customers. She is a woman who is very dedicated to her work, very honest and with a desire to get ahead. She gets up very early every day to give the best of herself. Her greatest desire is to see her business grow, and for this reason, she is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL which will allow her to buy corn, cheese, pork, beans, vegetables, etc. Juana has the hope that in this way she will be able to offer her family a full life.

loans.use: to buy corn, cheese, pork, beans and vegetables.

loans.name: Amos

texts.en:
Amos is 50-year-old man. He is married to a farmer and they are blessed with five children with ages ranging from 3 to 16 years. For his entire life and for the past six years he has been in the quarry mining business. In addition, he does dairy farming where he sells milk to local residents. Amos sells building stones to local residents and contractors. 

Initially, he had taken three loans of KES 20,000, 50,000, and 100,000, which he paid well. He is planning to use the loan of KES 100,000 to buy a drilling machine and pay for the casual laborers. He anticipates that his business will generate profits, which he will use to own his quarry and do away with leasing. Also, he has a plan of owning a lorry for delivering building blocks to customers. Amos describes himself as proactive, aggressive, and trustworthy.

loans.use: to pay for casual laborers and buy a drilling machine.

loans.name: Hendra

texts.en:
Hendra is a 31-year-old man and is married to Andriana, a 28-year-old lady. They have been blessed with a son named Andreas, a 2-year-old little boy. Hendra has been running a motorcycle repair shop business for five years. He started when he was still single. He was lucky since his parent was willing to provide capital for his business. Hendra has customers who regularly come to his repair shop as they like the good service that he provides. The income generated enables him to cover his family’s living expenses 

Recently, Hendra expanded his business by providing car repainting. Hendra said the new business is a good chance for him to generate more money. He would like to buy some materials and equipment such as paint, sandpaper, thinner and putty. Therefore, he is requesting a loan amounting to IDR 4,000,000 from TLM.

loans.use: to purchase materials and equipment such as paint, sandpaper, thinner and putty.

loans.name: Erika

texts.es:
La señora Erika ahora tiene 32 años de edad, nació en la provincia de Urubamba en Cusco – Perú, tiene una hija de 8 años que asiste a la escuela, Su actividad económica principal es la compra y venta de maíz, ella compra el grano y lo vende como semilla.

En esta oportunidad ella necesita un préstamo para comprar más maíz, hacerlo secar y posteriormente vender el grano como semilla.

Erika está convencida de que realizando esta actividad, en un futuro no muy lejano,  podrá tener su propio comercio y se proyecta que en 2 años va a adquirir un vehículo para facilitarle su trabajo y poder ampliar su negocio. 
Erika es integrante del banco comunal “Virgen Natividad” del distrito de Yucay - Urubamba.
texts.en:
Erika is 32 years old and was born in the Urubamba province in Cusco – Peru, and has an eight year old daughter who attends school.  [Erika] buys and sells corn.  She buys the grain and resells it as seed.

On this occasion she needs a loan to buy more corn, dry it, and then sell the grains as seed.

Erika believes that by doing this she will have her own business and projects that she will acquire a vehicle in two years to make her work easier and grow her business.

Erika is a member of the “Virgen Natividad” communal bank of the Yucay district – Urubamba.

loans.use: to buy corn.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en: Sofia lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with five children and all her children are in school. She takes care of additional family members (sister's children). She operates a stall selling fruits and vegetables at the market on retail basis. She has been in this business for four years. She works seven days a week. She has requested a loan of 100,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX) from MCDT SACCO to buy pineapple, watermelon, and passion fruits. Her major business challenges are seasonality and transportation. Her goals and aspirations are to expand her business into a wholesale one and also to buy land to start growing the fruits. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, feeding the family, and rent.

loans.use: To buy more pineapples, watermelon, and passion fruits

loans.name: Amigas Alegres Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “AMIGAS ALEGRES” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Claudia. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: licorería, servicios de comida, comerciante de productos por temporada y producción de artesanías.

La señora Claudia, indica que hace años que integra una asociación comunal en Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de licorería que viene trabajando hace años.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de licorería), mismo que adquiere de las comerciales de la ciudad de El Alto y posterior lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Este negocio le ayuda a apoyar a su familia pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.
  
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en salud y crédito.
texts.en:
“AMIGAS ALEGRES” (Happy Friends) is a community bank that will start its first cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the “Santiago II” office. It is composed of eight members, and it is managed by a board of directors led by Claudia. The members of this community bank engage in different activities, such as liquor store, services, retail and production.

Claudia says that a few years ago she was a member of another community bank working with Pro Mujer, where she had been invited by a friend. She is currently running the liquor store that she has opened many years ago.

The loan she is now requesting will be used to increase her working capital by purchasing liquors: she buys them from sellers in the town of El Alto, to then sell them in her stall. This activity helps her supporting her family, as she is married and has three children.

When one asks her what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the seminars about health as well as those about the loans.

loans.use: To buy liquors.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan nació en el distrito de Huayllabamba Provincia de Urubamba del departamento del Cusco - Perú, pero vive en el distrito de Yucay que perteneciente a la misma provincia.

Juan ahora tiene 43 años edad, está casado y tiene dos hijos. La actividad económica principal del socio Juan es la venta de choclo, pasto y otros productos como verduras, hortalizas y legumbres. 

En esta oportunidad Juan requiere el préstamo para comprar más maíz, hacerlo secar y venderlo como semilla. De esta manera el desea hacer crecer su comercio, ampliar el negocio y comprar un terreno para que pueda eventualmente construir en el.
Juan es integrante del banco comunal “Virgen Natividad” del distrito de Yucay de la Provincia de Urubamba.
texts.en:
Juan was born in the Huayllabamba district of Urubamba province in the department of Cusco, Peu, but he lives in the Yucay district in the same province.

Juan is 43 years old, married, and has 2 children.  His main business is selling corn, pasture grass and other products, including vegetables, beans and other produce.  

At this time, Juan needs a loan to buy more corn so that he can dry it and sell it as seeds.  In this way he hopes to grow his sales, expand his business and buy a plot of land that he can eventually build on.

Juan is a member of the communal bank “Virgen Natividad” in the Yucay district of the province of Urubamba.

loans.use: to buy corn, which he will dry and sell as seeds

loans.name: Cristino

texts.es: Cristino de treinta y cuatro años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus hijos; él se dedica al cultivo de maíz, tiene muchos años de dedicarse a la agricultura y eso le ha dado mucha experiencia para obtener buenas cosechas para la venta, últimamente se ha hecho de muy buena clientela pues el maíz que comercia es de muy buena calidad y todo lo vende a precios accesibles, siempre trata de satisfacer la necesidad de las personas con su trabajo; Cristino es un hombre muy trabajador y humilde que se esfuerza día con día para salir  adelante, superarse como persona es su más grande reto y está dispuesto a obtenerlo para llegar al éxito, con este pensamiento de motivación es que se decidió a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz por mayor y pagar parte del arrendamiento del terreno donde se cultiva. Cristino tiene la seguridad que de esta forma podrá darle a su familia una vida mejor.
texts.en:
Cristino is 34 years old and lives with his partner and children. He makes a living planting corn. He has worked in agriculture for many years and this has provided him with a lot of experience and the ability to produce good harvests for sale. Lately he has obtained a very good customer base as the corn he sells is of very good quality and he sells all of it at accessible prices. He always tries to satisfy people's needs with his work. 

Cristino is a very hardworking and humble man. Everyday he puts a lot of effort in to getting ahead and bettering himself as a person is his greatest challenge. He is ready to make that happen in order to gain success. With this motivation in mind he decided to request a loan from INTEGRAL, which will allow him to buy corn seeds at wholesale and pay part of the rent for the plot of land where he farms. Cristino is sure that in this way he will be able to give his family a better life.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds at wholesale and to rent a plot of land.

loans.name: Zanilaah

texts.en: Zanilaah  lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with 3 children and 2 of her children are in school. She takes care of additional family members (her mother). She sells bananas on a retail basis at the market. She has been in this business for 1 year. She works seven days a week. She has requested a loan of 100,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy bunches of bananas. Her major business challenges are seasonality and transportation. Her goals and aspirations are to build a house and also to own a delivery vehicle to ease transportation. She lives in  a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas

loans.name: Yolima

texts.es: Con su anterior credikiva, Yolima compró un hielero y cubetas al por mayor con el que continuó aumentando su produccion de bolis. Ahora planea un nuevo credikiva comprará un nuevo congelador para vender helados en su negocio, pues inició con uno prestado y esto se ha convertido en su éxito total. Ella envia el siguiente mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva: " Estoy muy agradecida por la ayuda recibida y la mejor forma de demostrarlo es pagando puntual y haciendo que mi negocio crezca cada dia mas."
texts.en: With her previous Kiva loan, Yolima bought a cooler and ice trays in bulk so that she could continue increasing her production of frozen treats.  Now she plans to use her new Kiva loan to buy a new freezer for selling ice cream in her business.  She started out with a loan and now has become a complete success.  Yolima would like to send the following message to Kiva lenders: "I am grateful for the help I have received.  The best way I can demonstrate this is to submit my payments on time and make my business grow each day."

loans.use: to buy a freezer for selling ice cream.

loans.name: Allen

texts.en: Allen lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with 5 children and all her children are in school. She takes care of additional family members (her sisters). She is a poultry farmer .She operates her business from home, selling on a retail basis. She has been in business for 4 years. She works seven days a week. She has requested a loan of 100,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy poultry feed and chicks. Her major business challenges are diseases and transportation of chicken feed. Her goals and aspirations are to educate her children to university level and also to own 1000 laying chickens. She lives in her own house and  the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of chicken  feed and chicks

loans.name: Halimah

texts.en:
Halimah is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in the Kampala south region of Uganda. She is married and has 2 children with one of them currently in school. For the past 2 years, Halimah has been working hard to manage her small business which sells charcoal. 

To help expand her business, Halimah has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more charcoal for resale and will help Halimah to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her kid. Halimah hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business. 

Halimah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Halimah's future prospects by helping her to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal for resale

loans.name: Madrine

texts.en:
Madrine  lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with 5 children and they are all in school. She takes care of additional family members. She sells dry fish at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for 3 years. She works six days a week. She has requested a loan of 100,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy boxes of fish. 

Madrine's major business challenges are seasonality and transportation. Her goals and aspirations are to expand her business into wholesale. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of fish

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence  lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with 4 children and all her children are   in school. She takes care of additional family members (her mother). She sells dry fish at the market on a retail basis. She has been in business for 2 years. She works six days a week. She has requested a loan of 100,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy boxes of fish. Her major business challenges are seasonality and transportation. Her goals and aspirations are to become a wholesaler and also to   buy a plot of land. She lives in her own house and  the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of fish

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is a  Kiva borrower. She has 3 children with ages ranging from 10 years to 20 years. She describes herself to be an aggressive businesswoman. She operates a dairy farm, grocery store, and a farm where she sells items such as milk, cabbages, tomatoes, peas, sugarcane, etc. She has been involved in this business for 7 years. Her business is located near a busy town  and her primary customers are local residents. 

Veronica describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient water for irrigation during the dry season and not enough fertilizer. She will use the Kes 15,000 loan to buy seeds and fertilizer. Her business goal is to run a grocery store fully stocked in the nearby town  within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Alhaji .s.

texts.en:
This is 35-year-old Alhaji. He is married and has 3 children aged 6yrs, 9yrs and 3yrs. In 2002, Alhaji established his Football Jersey and Jeans clothing business. Working 6 days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,500,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. 

Alhaji needs a loan to buy football jerseys and jeans. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 250,000.   He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy football jerseys and jeans

loans.name: Marìa Susana

texts.es:
María es una mujer  de 39 años de edad, conviviente y con 02 hijos. Vive en casa propia, la cual está ubicada en  el  Caserío San Eloy Distrito de Tambogrande - Piura. Cliente vive en la parte rural  de este distrito. Y solo cuenta con servicio básico de energía eléctrica.
La actividad que desarrolla María es la crianza de animales menores (como aves de corral, cerdos) los cuales los cría y engorda en la parte posterior de su domicilio, clienta cuenta con mas de 07 años de experiencia en su negocio, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura y lo apoya en sus actividades que realiza. 
El  monto solicitado es de 2,300 nuevos soles, crédito  será para la compra y  engorde de porcinos y  aves de corral, además de realizar mejoras en su vivienda (compra de calaminas para techo), esta inversión le permitirá seguir creciendo en su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María is a 39-year-old woman, with a live-in partner and two children. She lives in her own home, which is located in the small village of San Eloy in the Tambogrande district of Piura. She lives in the rural part of this district, and only has a basic electricity service.

María rears young animals for a living (such as poultry, pigs) which she rears and fatten in the back part of her home, the customer has more than seven years' experience in her business. Her husband works in agriculture and she supports him in his work. 

The amount requested is 2,300 Peruvian Nuevos Soles, a loan which will be for the purchase and fattening up of pigs and poultry, as well as make improvements to her home (purchase corrugated metal sheets for the roof). This investment will enable her to continue growing in her business and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy and fatten pigs and poultry, as well as make improvements to her home.

loans.name: Monicah

texts.en:
Monicah is a 31-year-old single woman. She has a daughter who is 3 years old. She describes herself to be determined, focused and sociable. She operates a retail stall  where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her business is located within a favourable residential area  and her primary customers are local residents. 

Monicah describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds for improving the business. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy clothes especially children's wear worth Kes 20,000. Her business goal is to expand her business, selling all sorts of clothes and employ more staff.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more vending machines to expand his business

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.en:
Leonardo has aspired to be an entrepreneur his entire life. Four years ago he discovered the perfect avenue to fund his own business on, pulling from his entrepreneurial spirit, extensive business experience, and personal connections in Venezuela, where he used to reside. While living in Venezuela, he realized that products, particularly electronics, had a steep up-sell on them, sometime more than 5 times the original cost of the product. 

Leonardo saw a great opportunity here to build a business that would create an alternative market for these products. In cooperation with his connections in Venezuela, Leonardo moved to Florida, where he now lives, and founded his own business. One of the largest hurdles that he has faced in this process has been securing the funds which will help him purchase the wholesale products that he will later ship internationally. Leonardo would like to use this loan to purchase these wholesale products.

loans.use: to purchase a new batch of wholesale products for resale

loans.name: Mchata Group

texts.en:
Oska, who is in his early 30s, is single.  He has been running a retail shop since 2006.  He works from 6.00 am to 7.00 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be his 4th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to buy a plot of land, started building his house, increased the missing items in his shop, covered household expenses and has paid back all his loans successfully.  He wants a loan to increase his shop inventory. His dream is to one day become an international businessman.

He will share this loan with his loan group "Mchata" which has a total of 20 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to increase his shop inventory.

loans.name: Gabriela Marlene

texts.es:
Gabriela es una mujer trabajadora, tranquila, con muchas ganas de salir adelante por su familia. Gabriela tiene 33 años, vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos en Atuntaqui que se encuentra a 15 minutos de Otavalo en la provincia de Imbabura.

Gabriela trabaja con su hermana en la confección de chompas térmicas y licras. este negocio ayuda a Gabriela a solventar algunas necesidades que tienen en su casa y le permite dar la alimentación diaria de sus hijos, es por eso que realiza un nuevo crédito en Fodemi, el mismo que va a ser utilizado en la compra de rollos de tela térmica para la confección de chomas térmicas, para incrementar su producción, que le permitirá generar mayores ventas con buenos ingresos económicos en el mes de Mayo, lo cual mejorará su calidad de vida.

Gabriela sueña en que sus hijos sean profesionales y que su negocio crezca y pueda tener un taller grande para emplear personal.
texts.en:
Gabriela is a tranquil, hardworking woman who very much wants to get ahead for her family.  Gabriela is 33 years old living with her husband and three children in Atuntaqui which is located 15 minutes from Otavalo in Imbabura Province.

Gabriela works with her sister making thermal and Lycra jackets.  This business helps Gabriela cover some of the household needs and provide daily food for her children.  This is why she needs a new loan from Fodemi to buy rolls of thermal fabric to increase production of thermal jackets which will lead to higher sales and good income for the month of May which will improve her quality of life.

Gabriela dreams with her children becoming professionals and that her business grows so she can have a big workshop and employ staff.

loans.use: to buy thermal fabric.

loans.name: Anonymous Group

texts.fr: La cliente, présidente du groupe de crédit  Mufariji, Femme  courageuse, entrepreneur,  âgée de 39 ans et mère de 3 enfants. Elle s’entraide avec son mari dans le business. Elle est Vendeuse d’articles divers (habillement, souliers, huile, lotion de beauté, sucres, etc.). Il ya 3 ans qu’elle  commença ses affaires avec  son fonds propre reçu de son mari. La cliente bénéficie régulièrement des crédits de Hekima pour renforcer ses affaires. Les bénéfices de son activité servent d’épargne, d’alimentation et d’appui à la scolarité de ses  enfants. Cependant, elle vient d’obtenir  son  16eme  crédit. Au cours de la période, cette cliente a vu ses ventes augmentées. Ainsi elle a  décidé d’augmenter son montant de crédit pour ce nouveau cycle. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  d’acheter les 5douzaines d’habits, 20 paires de souliers. Ses difficultés sont souvent les taxes de l’Etat. La cliente  souhaite  voir ses enfants grandir et acheter une parcelle dans le futur. La cliente remercie Hekima pour  les actions d’autonomisation de pauvres femmes à faible revenu.
texts.en: The client, president of the Mufariji credit group, is a courageous 39-year-old businesswoman and mother of three.   She and her husband are in business together.  She sells various items (clothing, shoes, oil, lotions, sugar, etc.).  She began her business three years ago with money given to her by her husband, and she regularly takes out loans from Hekima to strengthen her business.  Her profits go toward savings, food, and her children's schooling.  She just took out her 16th loan and has seen her sales increase, so she decided to increase her loan amount for this new cycle.  This new loan will allow her to buy five dozen pieces of clothing and 20 pairs of shoes.  Her difficulties in business are often state taxes.  She wants to see her children grow up, and would like to buy a piece of land in the future.  She thanks Hekima for helping increase independence for low-income women.

loans.use: to buy 5 dozen pieces of clothing and 20 pairs of shoes.

loans.name: Tomy Adan

texts.es:
Tomy es un hombre muy trabajador y sobre todo optimista, vive en la ciudad de Camana, es una ciudad que alberga playas hermosas y un clima cálido, tiene como actividades la pesca y la agricultura , en especial el cultivo de arroz el cual es considerado uno de los mejores del mundo. Cuando Tomy tiene un tiempo libre le gusta jugar futbol con sus vecinos y amigos de su barrio y también le gusta comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo Chupe de Camarones.

Día a día Tomy trabaja en su negocio como maestro constructor, le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 10 horas diarias, el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy trabajador y sobre todo porque es responsable y cumplido con los clientes y por ello siempre lo recomiendan.

Tomy está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar herramientas para construcción, como barreta, maderas, picos, lampas, entre otras herramientas, así el podrá realizar su trabajado de mejor manera y ya no tendrá que pedir prestado o alquilar estos implementos, así el mejorar sus ingresos y seguirá trabajando muy duro cada día para hacer realidad su más grande sueño: ”Formar una familia”.
texts.en:
Tomy is a very hardworking and really optimistic man. He lives in Camana, a town renowned for its beautiful beaches and its hot climate; its main activities are fishing and agriculture, especially the production of its rice, which is considered one of the best in the world. When Tomy has some free time he likes playing football with the neighbors and friends of his neighborhood; he also likes eating one of his favorite dishes, the delicious "Chupe de Camerones" (shrimp chowder).

Tomy works day by day as a master builder, engaging in his activity for about 10 hours a day. He believes things are going well with his activity because he is very hardworking, and above all because he is a responsible worker, he is correct with his customers, and for this he is always recommended by his customers.

Tomy is deeply grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to them he will be able to buy construction tools such as bars, timber, pickaxes and hoes. This will help him doing his job in a better way, as he will no longer need to borrow or rent these tools. He will thus succeed in improving his income and he will keep on working very hard every day to make his biggest dream come true: “to form a family”.

loans.use: To buy construction tools such as bars, timber, pickaxes and hoes.

loans.name: Emèrita

texts.es:
Emèrita es una mujer de 38  años de edad, vive junto a su esposo. Vive en casa propia, ubicada  en la zona de   Túcume  cuenta con servicios de  luz, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura trabajando como jornalero, el lugar es pequeño con aproximadamente 100 familias.
La actividad que desarrolla Emèrita es la compra y  venta de animales en el caserío Los Riojas, distrito de Túcume, su cónyuge se dedica a la agricultura y percibe ingresos como jornalero.
El Monto solicitado es de 3,000 nuevos soles, crédito  será para invertir en la compra de animales en especial lo que es chivos, ovejas y alimento para sus animales, también un poco lo va a invertir en compra de urea para su agricultura. Así mismo cuenta con 08 años de experiencia en el rubro.
texts.en:
Emèrita is a 38 year-old woman who lives with her husband.  They live in their own home, which is located in the Tucume area.  Their home has electricity.  Emèrita's husband works as a farmhand.  They live in a small settlement that is home to about 100 families.

Emèrita has a business buying and selling animals in the Los Riojas settlement in Tucume district.  Her husband works in agriculture and earns his pay as a farmhand.

She is requesting a loan of 3,000 Peruvian soles to invest in the purchase of animals, specifically goats and sheep, and animal feed.  In addition she will invest a small amount in the purchase of fertilizer for her crops.  She has 8 years of experience in this line of work.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and animals, such as: goats and sheep, and also to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Arabella Noemi

texts.es:
Arabella Noemí tiene 23 años de edad es soltera, vive con su madre en el Cantón Chillanes Provincia Bolívar. Pertenece a la ventanilla rural Balacelo conformado por 10 miembros.
Arabella Noemí se dedica a la agricultura siembra maíz frejol y arveja.
Solicita el crédito para comprar insumos necesarios para los sembríos como semillas urea 2qq, abono 3qq, y fertilizantes para la carencia de plagas. 
Con la ayuda del crédito puedo tener los insumos que necesito para proveerme de los insumos 
Las compras y ventas de los productos las realiza con frecuencia en el Cantón de Chillanes cada ocho días.
El sueño es sembrar frejol que le permita tener mayores ingresos y mejorar su estilo de vida.
Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son a las vías en mal estado y el temor de perder sus cosechas.
En el tiempo libre le gusta relajarse para poder dormir y le gusta escuchar el Carnaval.
texts.en:
Arabella Noemí, 23, is single living with her mother in Chillanes Canton, Bolívar Province.  She belongs to the Balacelo communal bank which has 10 members.  Arabella Noemí is a corn, broad bean and pea farmer.  She requests the loan to buy necessary supplies for her crops like seeds, 2 quintals of urea, 3 quintals of manure and fertilizer to control infestations.  With help from the loan she will be able to purchase the supplies she needs.

Her purchases and her sales take place frequently in Chillanes Canton weekly.  Her dream is to plant broad beans that will allow her to earn higher income and improve her lifestyle.  The challenges she faces are roads in poor condition and the fear of losing her crops.  In her free time she likes to relax to be able to sleep and to listen to Carnival.

loans.use: to buy seeds, urea, manure and fertilizer.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
This is 39-year-old Kadiatu from Lumley western area in Freetown. She is married with 2 children, 10 years and 18 years old. She also has 3 additional dependents that living with her at home.

Kadiatu runs a provisions store; she sells milk, sugar, Ovaltine, bread, and assorted drinks. She has been running this business for 7 years. She works at the business 7 days per week and 8 hours a day and has one employee working for her. She also works as a teacher to increase her savings. Her major business challenge is competition in the market and low purchasing power of her customers.

Kadiatu has requested a loan in order to buy items such as assorted drinks, milk, cheese, luncheon meat and bags of sugar. The extra income from this loan will allow her to pay her installments and take care of her family's welfare. In the future, she plans to open an outlet in town. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: To buy items such as assorted drinks, milk,  cheese, luncheon meat, and bags of sugar.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a 38-year-old married man. He has 3 children with ages ranging from 1 month to 13 years. He describes himself to be honest, determined and an independent man. He operates a retail stall  where he sells clothes. He has been involved in this business for 13 years. His business is located within a favourable residential area  and his primary customers are local residents. 

Paul is also a farmer selling coffee. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. He had earlier on taken loans of Kes 20,000, 50,000 and 60,000 which he managed to repay well. He will use the Kes 60,000 loan to buy more clothes. His business goal is to be supplying clothes wholesale and buy a car to help with transportation of clothes to customers.

loans.use: to buy more clothes.

loans.name: Baloon Group

texts.en:
Kassimu, who is in his early 30s, is married with three children who go to school.  He has been running a business selling chips with eggs, fish and chicken since 2000.  He works from 6.00 pm to midnight daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be his 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania which he wants to use for adding to his stock of Irish potatoes, fish, eggs, and cooking oil.  His dream is to one day be able to build his own house.

He will share this loan with his loan group "Baloon" which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to increase his stock of Irish potatoes, fish, eggs, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Anonymous Group

texts.fr: La cliente Furaha, membre d’une association de crédit Tupendane, femme  courageuse, entrepreneur, âgée de 31 ans. Son mari est un militaire, malheureusement, qui l'a abandonné depuis plus de 8 ans. Elle est vendeuse de biens d’occasion (second hand) dans un petit marché noir (informel) situé dans le camp militaire Munzenze. Elle fut initiée par ses pairs en 2009 dans cette affaire. Plus tard, elle fut informée de micro crédit qu’octroi l’IMF Hekima. Les bénéfices de son activité servent d’épargne, d’alimentation et d’appui à la scolarité de ses  enfants. Cependant, elle vient d’obtenir  son  8eme  crédit. Au cours de la période, cette cliente a vu ses affaires prospèrent positivement. Ainsi, elle a  décidé d’augmenter son montant de crédit pour ce nouveau cycle. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  d’acheter  de chaises, matelas, de télévision à revendre. En plus, elle souhaite  voir ses 4 enfants grandir confortablement et acheter une parcelle dans le futur. La cliente remercie Hekima pour  les actions d’autonomisation de pauvres femmes à faible revenu.Il sied de signaler qu’une cliente porte son bébé au dos.
texts.en: The client, a member of the Tupendane credit group, is a courageous 31-year-old businesswoman.  Her husband is a soldier who left her more than eight years ago.  She sells second-hand goods in a small informal market in the Muzenze military camp.  She was introduced to the business by acquaintances in 2009, and later learned about the micro-credit offered by Hekima.  Her business income goes toward savings, food, and her children's education.  She has just taken out her eighth loan, and has seen her business prosper, so she decided to increase her loan amount for this new cycle.  Her new loan will allow her to buy chairs, mattresses, and televisions to re-sell.  She wants to see her four children grow up comfortably, and she would like to buy a piece of land in the future.  She thanks Hekima for helping low-income women gain independence.  In the photo, she is carrying her baby on her back.

loans.use: to buy chairs, mattresses, televisions, etc.

loans.name: Maricela Eulogia

texts.es: Maricela Eulogia de cuarenta y seis años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus hijos en zona urbana. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa para dama, caballeros y niños, tiene en variedad, pantalones, faldas, vestidos, camisas, trajes entre otros todo es de excelente calidad y lo vende a precios muy accesibles, es por eso que se ha hecho de muy buena clientela,  vende en su misma casa el producto ya que es muy conocida por esta actividad y además vende por días de forma ambulante, visitando colonias cercanas, parques y calles principales; Maricela es una mujer muy activa, siempre dedicada al trabajo y sobre todo muy humilde, piensa que para llegar al éxito solo necesita voluntad y estar dispuesta a superarse, quiere hacer crecer su negocio y es así como se ha decidido a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar ropa por mayor. Maricela Eulogia está convencida que de esta forma podrá llevar seguridad económica a su hogar.
texts.en:
Maricela Eulogia is 46 years old and lives with her life partner and their children in an urban area.
She sells clothing for women, men, and children. She has a variety of pants, skirts, dresses, shirts, suits, and other articles. Everything is excellent quality and she offers very affordable prices.  That is why she has achieved a very good customer base. She sells her products right from her home, since she is very well known for her services, and she also sells on the street some days, visiting nearby neighborhoods, parks, and main roads.
Maricela is a very active woman, who is always devoted to her work and is above all very humble. She believes that to achieve success all she needs is her will and a desire to better herself. 
She wants to expand her business, and this is why she decided to request a loan from Integral, which will allow her to buy wholesale clothing. Maricela Eulogia is convinced that this way she will be able to bring financial security to her home.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale clothing.

loans.name: Morena Del Carmen

texts.es: Morena del Carmen de treinta y cuatro años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus hijos los cuales aún asisten a la escuela. Ella posee una tienda en el lugar donde vende productos de primera necesidad leche, frijoles, huevos, pan entre otros, ya tiene varios años con el negocio y siempre ha estado entusiasmada con hacerlo crecer para aumentar su clientela, su negocio se ha caracterizado por ser el más surtido del lugar y por tener los productos de primera calidad a precios realmente accesibles, además el servicio siempre está a la orden del día , los clientes se van de ahí con una sonrisa en el rostro; Morena es una mujer entregada a su labor, muy honesta y siempre dispuesta a superarse aprovechando cada oportunidad que se le presenta, triunfar para ella significa vivir cada día con felicidad, está dispuesta a llegar al éxito es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, golosinas, pan, bebidas, producto instantáneo, etc. Morena del Carmen tiene la confianza que así podrá darle a sus pequeños hijos una mejor oportunidad de vida.
texts.en:
Morena del Carmen, 34, lives with her spouse and children who are attending school still.  She has a store at home where she sells basic staple items like milk, beans, eggs and bread, among others.  She’s been in business several years and has always been enthusiastic about making it grow to increase her clientele.  Her business has been noted for being the best stocked in the place and for having top quality goods at really affordable prices; besides good service is the order of the day.  Customers leave there with a smile on their face.

Morena is a woman who is dedicated to her work.  She’s very honest and always ready to better herself taking advantage of every opportunity that presents itself to her.   Success to her means to live each day with happiness.  She’s willing to attain success and this is why she’s asked INTEGRAL for a loan to buy basic grains, snacks, bread, beverages, instant products, etc.  Morena del Carmen trusts that she will be able to give her little ones better life opportunities this way.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Changamkeni Group

texts.en:
Godson, who is in his mid-30s, is married with two children who are still going to school. He has been running a grocery store for two years now. He works from 7:00 a.m. to 11:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be his 3rd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to buy the missing items in his grocery, start building his house, and pay for household expenses, and he has paid back all his loans successfully. He wants a loan to increase the grocery store's stock. His dream is to build his own house.

He will share this loan with his loan group "Changamkeni," which has a total of 15 members whom will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to increase the stock in his grocery store.

loans.name: Luis Octavio

texts.es:
Luis Octavio tiene 53 años de edad es casado tiene dos hijos, vive con su esposa e hijos en el Cantón Chillanes Provincia de  Bolívar. Pertenece a la ventanilla rural Balacelo conformado por 10 miembros. 
Luis Octavio se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, fréjol ,arveja y palmitos. 
Solicita el crédito para comprar insumos necesarios para la agricultura como son urea 2qq, abono 1qq y fertilizantes.
Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los insumos requeridos para tener buenas cosechas y asi obtendra mayores ingresos.
Las compras de los productos necesarios las realiza frecuentemente en el Cantón Chillanes cada quince días.
El sueño es incrementar las cosechas de frejol lo cual le permitira tener mejores ingresos y dar la educación a sus hijos pequeños.
Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son a las vías en mal estado perdida de las cosechas por el mal clima y problemas de salud.
En el tiempo libre le gusta descansar, pasar más tiempo junto a sus hijos y le gusta escuchar la música del Carnaval.
texts.en:
Luis Octavio is 53 years old, he is married with two children, and he lives with his wife and children in Chillanes canton, Bolívar province. He belongs to the Balacelo communal bank, made up of 10 members. Luis Octavio works in farming, sowing corn, beans, peas and palm hearts. 

He is asking for a loan to buy the supplies needed for farming such as 2 quintals of urea, 1 quintal of manure, and fertilizers. With this loan, he will be able to buy the supplies needed to obtain good crops and therefore get better profits. He buys the required products in Chillanes canton every fortnight. 

His dream is to increase the bean crops, which would give him better profits and give his young children an education. The challenges which he faces are that the roads are in a bad condition, loss of crops due to poor weather and health problems. 

In his free time, he likes relaxing, spending time with his children and he likes listening to carnival music.

loans.use: to buy seeds, manure, urea and fertilizers

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel es un padre muy amoroso con sus 2 pequeños hijos de 2 y 5 años y también muy amoroso con su esposa la cual es su mano derecha y siempre lo apoya en todo, su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Camana, ciudad que se caracteriza por ser el hogar de los riquísimos camarones, los cuales acompañan diversos platillos a base de productos marinos, asimismo en Camana encontramos hermosas playas en las cuales uno se puede relajar mucho admirando su belleza, también en esta ciudad tiene como actividad principal la agricultura, en especial el cultivo del Arroz, considerado uno de los mejores del mundo y también se le conoce por la generosidad de sus pobladores.  Cuando miguel tiene un tiempito libre le gusta jugar futbol con sus amigos y vecinos de su barrio, asimismo le encanta comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Arroz Chaufa”.

Día a Día Miguel sale a trabajar en su negocio como maestro constructor, labora alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 9 clientes de manera mensual ya que depende del tamaño de las construcciones que realiza, el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque realiza buenos acabados en las construcciones que el realiza.

Miguel  está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar madera y tablas para realizar sus construcciones, así el podrá tener las herramientas para poder hacer bien sus trabajaos y mejorara sus ingresos, para así seguir luchando cada día para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:”  Comprar una mezcladora de Cemento”.
texts.en:
Miguel is a loving father to his 2 young children aged 2 and 5; he is also a loving husband to his wife, who is his right arm and who always supports him in everything. His house is located in Camana, a town renowned for being the homeland of delicious shrimps that go with many different seafood-based dishes; Camana is also famous for the beautiful beaches where one can relax in admiring their beauty, and its main economic activity is agriculture, especially the production of its rice, which is considered one of the best in the world. The town is also renowned for the generosity of its inhabitants. When Miguel has some free time, he likes playing football with the neighbors and friends of his neighborhood; he also loves eating one of his favorite dishes, the delicious “Arroz Chaufa” (fried rice with vegetables).

Miguel works every day as a master builder, working about 10 hours a day; he can work for up to 9 customers per month, depending on the size of the structures he makes. He believes things are going well with his activity because of the high finish he makes to his structures.

Miguel is deeply grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to their help he will be able to buy timber and planks for his structures. He will then own the tools he needs to work well and to increase his earnings, thus keeping on fighting fay by day to make his biggest dream come true: “to buy a cement mixer”.

loans.use: To buy timber and planks.

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
Irma nació y vive en el distrito de Huayllabamba Provincia de Urubamba del departamento del Cusco – Perú.
 
Irma tiene 25 años edad, es soltera y aun no tiene hijos, ella tiene varias actividades económicas principales que realiza durante el año tales como: En los meses de abril hasta octubre se dedica a trabajar de forma dependiente quiere decir en la empresa privada como un hotel, en un restaurante o en la municipalidad de Yucay. Durante los meses de Octubre a Marzo se dedica al negocio de venta de choclo y lleva sus productos a la ciudades de Juliaca en Puno, Cusco y los distribuye en diferentes mercados de esas ciudades. 

En esta oportunidad Irma requiere el préstamo para comprar más choclo. Su sueño de Irma es abrir una cabina de internet o abrir una empresa comercializadora de computadoras y suministros para computadoras. 
Irma ha estudiado la carrera técnica de computación e informática en uno de los institutos de la ciudad del Cusco, es por ello que ella desea desarrollar sus capacidades haciendo un negocio propio que le permita ejercer en sus habilidades y poner en práctica lo que estudió.  
    
Irma es integrante del banco comunal “Virgen Natividad” del distrito de Yucay, Provincia de Urubamba.
texts.en:
Irma was born and lives in the district of Huayllabamba, province of Urubamba, within the departamento of Cusco, Peru.
 
Irma is 25 years old, single, and has no children yet. She performs several main economic activities during the year. For example, during the months of April through October she works as an employee, meaning for a private company, such as in a hotel, a restaurant, or in the town of Yucay. During the months of October through March she works in the corn selling business and takes her products to the cities of Juliaca, Puno, and Cusco, and distributes them in different markets in those cities.

On this occasion, Irma needs the loan to buy more corn. Irma's dream is to open an Internet booth or a computer and computer supplies marketing company.

Irma has studied for a degree in computer science at one of the institutes in the city of Cusco, which is why she would like to develop her capabilities by opening her own business. That would allow her to exercise her skills and put what she studied into practice.
    
Irma belongs to the communal bank “Virgen Natividad” in the district of Yucay, province of Urubamba.

loans.use: to purchase more corn.

loans.name: Alberta

texts.en: Alberta sells secondhand ladies' and children's dresses. She has been selling secondhand dresses for four years now. Alberta is married. Her husband is a fire-service personnel. She uses her income to support her husband to pay their utility and accommodation bills. Alberta needs this loan to purchase more secondhand ladies' and children's dresses to sell. With the new profit, Alberta plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more secondhand ladies' and children's dresses to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group

texts.fr: La cliente, membre du groupe d’affaire, est  entrepreneur, âgée de 36 ans, mariée, mère de 5 jeunes enfants, qui étudient tous. Son mari est un chômeur. Elle est  vendeuse de bananes, shikwange, arachides, etc. dans le centre ville. Depuis les années 90, elle exerce ces petites activités génératrices de revenus de ce genre. Cependant, elle vient d’obtenir  son  16eme  crédit de Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner avec  2 paniers d’arachides, 5 régimes de bananes, les haricots, farine, etc. actuellement, cette cliente connait de difficulté dans son business suite aux maladies qui ravagent les bananiers et autres plantes dans la région. En plus, elle souhaite  voir ses enfants grandir confortablement  et acheter une parcelle dans le futur.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique.
texts.en: The client, a member of the business group, is a 36-year-old businesswoman.  She is married and the mother of five children, all of whom are in school.  Her husband is unemployed.  She sells bananas, shikwange (ground manioc cooked in a banana leaf), peanuts, etc. downtown.  She has been running similar small business since the 90s, and just obtained her 16th loan through Hekima.  This new loan will allow her to buy two baskets of peanuts, five bunches of bananas, beans, flour, etc.  She is currently experiencing difficulty in her business after diseases ravaged banana trees and other plants in the region.  She wants to see her children grow up comfortably, and she would like to buy a piece of land in the future.  She thanks Hekima for helping poor women who are excluded from traditional banks.

loans.use: to buy two baskets of peanuts, 5 bunches of bananas, beans, flour, etc.

loans.name: Agenes

texts.en: Agenes is a trader who sells hair extensions, wigs, and hair cream at Esuakkyrie near Abura. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a driver. She uses her income to assist her husband in covering the expenses for food and clothing for their children. She will use her loan to purchase more hair extensions, wigs, and hair cream to sell. With the new profit she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more hair extensions, wigs, and hair cream

loans.name: Sarah Mama

texts.en: Sarah Mama sells secondhand ladies' and children's dresses. She has been selling secondhand dresses for three years now. Sarah is single and uses her income to pay her utility and accommodation bills. Sarah needs this loan to purchase more secondhand ladies' and children's dresses to sell. With the new profit Sarah plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more secondhand ladies' and children's dresses

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua cooks kenkey, which she serves with vegetables and fish sauce, at Esuakyire near Abura. She is married and has two children. Efua has been in this business for five years now. She uses her income for the general up keep of her children. Efua will use her loan to purchase bags of maize and fish, which she uses in preparing her kenkey for sale. She hopes to use the new profit from her expanded business to build a better stall for the sale of her kenkey.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize and fish for preparing kenkey

loans.name: Auntie

texts.en:
Auntie is a petty trader. She sell beans, groundnuts, gari (cassava flakes), rice, tomatoes, pepper, and other food items. She lives together with her husband at Esuekyir, near Abura. Her husband works with a water company. 

Auntie uses her income to assist her husband to pay their accommodation bills. She will use her loan to purchase bags of rice, beans, gari, vegetables, and other food items to sell. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of rice, beans, gari, vegetables, and other food items to sell.

loans.name: Yublina

texts.en:
Yublina is a 45-year-old lady married to Fredrik, a 37-year-old fishmonger. She has five children between 13 and 2 years old. Four of them are attending Elementary school. 

Last year, Yublina joined TLM’s Group Lending Program. She spent the loan to initiate a business selling food, especially side dishes, and producing dried fish to sell. Yublina recognized that the loan enabled her to support her husband in covering their daily needs and the ducational expenses of her children as well.   

Yublina desires to operate a kiosk business. She wants to generate more income for her family. To make it happen, Yublina is seeking a loan of IDR 4,000,000 from TLM for her new business. She would like to buy basic needs to sell at her kiosk. 

Note: When the picture was taken, Yublina was holding her son

loans.use: to purchase basic needs to sell at her kiosk.

loans.name: Alcanzando Metas Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “Alcanzando Metas” está conformado por 18 emprendedores, quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran, peluquería, venta de ropa nueva, venta de ropa usada y venta de artículos de plástico, entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Chillán.
Marianela integrante del grupo del Banco comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra al costado izquierdo del grupo, usa su cabello corto el cual es de color negro. Además viste un chaleco color negro, jeans azules y mocasines color negro. Como referencia, está realizando el signo de la paz con su mano izquierda.
Ella se dedica a vender joyas de plata, desde hace 7 meses. Su horario de trabajo lo distribuye en 4 días a la semana. Actualmente ya cuenta con clientela fija, debido a la calidad de sus productos y buena atención por parte de Marianela.
Las joyas las compra en diferentes locales comerciales, ya que su objetivo es comprar joyas exclusivas.
Con el crédito comprará joyas al por mayor.
Una de sus metas a largo plazo, es instalarse con un local establecido, de manera de contar con una mayor comodidad y además entregar un mejor servicio.
Marianela vive junto a sus dos hijos de 26 y 22 años de edad, quienes trabajan de manera dependiente. Además vive con su nieta, quien tiene 8 años de edad.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo esperanza, ya que el crédito otorgado, le permitirá invertir en su negocio.
Además se siente muy cómoda con las reuniones impartidas en el Banco comunal, ya que disfruta de la compañía del grupo e incorpora aprendizajes de contabilidad a su negocio.
Chillán es una comuna de la zona centro sur de Chile. Su nombre significa “silla del sol” en mapudungun, idioma de nuestros indígenas mapuches. Chillán es conocida como “Cuna de la Patria” o “Tierra de Artistas”, debido a que en la ciudad han nacido destacados personajes de la historia de Chile, como por ejemplo el conocido pianista Claudio Arrau.
texts.en:
Introducing “Alcanzando Metas” (Reaching Goals), a Communal Bank composed of 18 resourceful people who engage in different activities, such as hairdresser, new clothes sale, used clothes sale and plastic items sale, among others. They all come from the town of Chillán.
Marianela is a member of this Communal Bank: in the picture she is on the left side of the group, the one with short black hair. She is wearing a black pullover, blue jeans and black moccasins. To better identify her, she is the one giving the peace V sign.
She has been selling silver jewels for 7 months. She works 4 days a week, and she can currently count on fixed customers thanks to the quality of her products and the good care she tends to her customers with.
She buys the jewels in difference shops because her aim is to buy exclusive jewels.
The loan she is requesting will be used to buy jewels at a wholesale price.
One of her long-term goals is to run a stable shop, in order to be more comfortable and also to offer a better service.
Marianela lives together with her two children aged 26 and 22, who work as employees, and with her 8-year-old niece.
She is very happy about and deeply grateful for the opportunity she has been offered by Fondo Esperanza, because the loan she has receive will help her invest in her activity.
On top of this, she feels very at ease with the meetings held by the Communal Bank, as she enjoys the company of her group and she uses what she learns about accounting in her job.
Chillán is a community located in the center south area of Chile. Its name means “chair of the sun” in mapudungun, the language of the Indians Mapuches. Chillán is also known as “the Fatherland’s cradle” or the “land of artists”, because some famous protagonists of Chilean history, like the famous pianist Claudio Arrau, were born here.

loans.use: To buy jewels at wholesale price.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma lives in Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has two children, both of whom are in school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. Fatuma has a business selling used shoes. She has been in this business for four years and she works seven days out of every week. Fatuma sells her products door-to-door, by means of retail. Fatuma has requested a loan of 100,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of used shoes. 
      
The main business challenge(s) for Fatuma include the rainy season and defaulters. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to become a wholesaler and to get a permanent business premise. She resides in a home that she rents; she has access to piped water and electricity. Her major monthly expenses include rent, food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used shoes

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys is 44 years old and a mother of two children. She runs a grocery store and sells potatoes and cabbages to earn a living. She has been in the business for 12 years and has employed three people. She earns extra income from her rental houses. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to grow her business and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for 40,000 Kenya Shillings to buy potatoes and cabbages.

loans.use: To buy potatoes and cabbages to sell

loans.name: Luchando Por La Vida Group

texts.es:
El grupo luchando por la vida lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas s Yara quien vende comida y ropa usada. Este negocio lo inicio hace 3 años con la compra de pequeñas cantidades de de ropa actualmente y por medio de los créditos ella compra las pacas de ropa e inicio su otro negocio.
Las otras dos integrantes son Magali quien vende ropa usada en Rivas y Candido vende Comida desde hace 1 años.
texts.en:
The Grupo Luchando por la vida (Fighting for Life Group) is composed of three hardworking and resourceful people. One of them is Yara, who sells food and used clothes. She started this activity 3 years ago by buying small amounts of clothes; at the moment, and thanks to the loans, she buys larger quantities of clothes, and she has been able to start her second activity.
The other two members of the group are Magali, who sells used clothes in Rivas, and Candido, who has been selling food for 1 years.

loans.use: To buy clothes.

loans.name: Fiina

texts.en: Fiina lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children and all her children are in school. She also takes care of two additional family members (sisters). She has a beauty saloon .She sells her products on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last four years. She works seven days a week. She has requested a loan of 100,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy cosmetics, treatments, and braids. Her major business challenges are seasonality and electricity. Her goals and aspirations are to buy two hair dryers in the future and to own a fully stocked salon. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, food and rent.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of cosmetics, treatments and  braids

loans.name: Mruu

texts.en: Mruu is a 41-year-old married man with six children, all of whom are enrolled in school. He lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His core business is to repair bicycles, mostly for the local residents. He has been in this business for the last 15 years. Mruu aspires to open a wholesale business and hire employees in the future. He describes rent and school fees to be his greatest monthly expense. He plans to use the loan of KSH 20,000 to purchase more spare parts for his business.

loans.use: to purchase more spare parts for his business.

loans.name: Aryee

texts.en:
Aryee sells waakye (rice and beans cooked together). She serves it with gari (cassava flakes), macaroni, meat and fish stew. Aryee has been selling waakye for three years now.  She is married. Her husband is a driver.  She uses her income to support her husband to pay her accommodation bill.  

Aryee needs this loan to purchase bags of rice, beans, and other ingredients for the preparation of her waakye for sale. With the new profit, Aryee will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of rice, beans, and other ingredients for the preparation of her waakye for sale.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has two children, both of whom are in school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. Christine has a business selling used clothes. She has been in this business for two years and she works seven days out of every week. Christine sells her products door-to-door, by means of retail. Christine has requested a loan of 100,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of used clothes.
     
The main business challenge(s) for Christine include the rainy season and the increasing price of used clothes. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to become a wholesaler and to get a permanent  business premise .Christine lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent, food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha es una madre de familia de 48 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo  y a sus 02 hijos en el caserío Las Juntas, una zona agrícola del distrito de Illimo, el cual de encuentra ubicado a más de 25 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace más de diez años a trabajar en la crianza y venta de animales, el cuenta con algunas ovejas, chivos y aves de corral los mismos que comercializa quincenalmente en el  Mercado de Lambayeque y, esto con ayuda de sus esposo. Adicionalmente también se dedica a la agricultura.

Martha desea adquirir animales en especial  pavos y  alimento balanceado para mejorar la producción de sus animales y percibir mayores ganancias, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Martha, 48, is a mother living with her husband and two children in the hamlet of Las Juntas, an agricultural zone in Illimo District located more than 25 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

For over ten years she’s been raising animals to sell.  She has some sheep, goats and barnyard fowl that she sells every two weeks in Lambayeque’s market and is able to help her husband with this; she also farms.

Martha wants to acquire more animals, especially turkeys, and nutritionally balanced feed to improve her animals’ growth and earn higher profits.  Because of this she’s deemed in convenient to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 new sol loan.

loans.use: to buy turkeys and animal feed.

loans.name: Maria Gladys

texts.es:
María Gladys tiene 20 años de edad es soltera, vive con sus padres en el Cantón Chillanes Provincia Bolívar. Pertenece a la ventanilla rural Balacelo conformado por 10 miembros.
María Gladys se dedica a la agricultura siembra de maíz, frejol.
Solicita el crédito para comprar insumos necesarios para los sembríos como son abono 2qq, urea 1qq, y líquidos para fumigar.
Con la ayuda del crédito puede incrementar sus siembras  y obtener buenas cosechas por lo cual  tendrá mayores ingresos.
Las compras y las ventas  de los productos lo realizan con frecuencia en el Cantón Chillanes cada quince días.
El sueño de ella es poder seguir estudiando y darle a sus padres un mejor estilo –nivel de vida tener buenos sembríos para obtener buenas cosechas por lo cual mejoraría beneficiosamente sus ingresos.
Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es el temor de perder las cosechas por el mal tiempo.
En el tiempo libre le gusta leer, escuchar música, el carnaval.
texts.en:
María Gladys is 20 years old and single. She lives with her parents in Chillanes canton, Bolívar province. She belongs to the communal bank Balacelo, which is made up of ten members. María Gladys makes a living in agriculture, farming corn and beans. 

She is requesting a loan to buy the necessary supplies for her plants, like two quintals of manure, one quintal of urea, and liquids to fumigate. With the help from this loan she will be able to increase her crops and have better harvests which will give her a better income. She frequently does her buying and selling of products in Chillanes canton every 15 days. 

Her dream is to continue studying and giver her parent a better style and quality of life. She also wants to have good crops so that she can have good harvests, which would greatly improve her income. The challenge she faces is the fear of losing her crops due to bad weather. 

In her free time she likes to read, listen to music and the carnaval.

loans.use: to buy seeds, manure, urea, and fertilizers.

loans.name: Bola 8 Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “BOLA 8” iniciará su trigésimo sexto ciclo  en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Odaliz. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de motores, venta de calzados, venta de autopartes, costura de cortinas, venta de mantillas y chalinas.

La señora Odaliz,  indica que hace quince años que integra una asociación comunal en Pro Mujer, ingresando por iniciativa propia. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de motores que viene trabajando hace años.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para la compra mercadería (compra de motores), que adquirirá del país de Chile y posteriormente lo comercializará por mayor a las personas de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto. Este negocio le ayuda a apoyar a su familia pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene dos hijos
  
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud.

En la fotografía no se encuentra la señora Aidee, ya que se encontraba en consultorio médico.
texts.en:
The Bola 8 will start their 16th cycle with Pro Mujer as part of Los Andes regional office.  It is comprised of eight members, and it is run by a board of directors, which Odaliz heads.  The businesses that the members of the communal bank carry out are varied.  Among them we have:  selling motors, selling shoes, selling auto parts, making curtains, and selling scarves and blankets.

Odaliz says that she has been a member of a communal bank in Pro Mujer for 15 years.  She joined on her own initiative.  She currently has a business selling motors, which she has been working at for years.

The loan that she is now taking out is to buy motors, which she will get in the country of Chile.  She will later sell them wholesale to the people at the fairs in the city of El Alto.  This business helps her support her family.  She is in a common-law marriage and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she answered that she enjoys the health services.

Aidee is not in the photograph because she was at the Dr.’s office.

loans.use: to buy motors.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
Mariama sells oranges and limes at Ensuekyir, near Abura. Mariama is married to a mason and has six dependents.  She has been selling oranges and limes for six years.  She uses her income to support her husband to pay utility bills. 

Mariama will use her loan to purchase more fruit and foodstuff for sale. With the new profit, Mariama will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fruit and foodstuff for sale.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en: Marie is 47 years old and married with two children. She runs a small business selling fast foods at a stall in her community and has been doing this for two years. Marie has requested a loan to pay for her kid's school fees and ingredients needed for making food to sell. She joined SPBD in 2009 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Marie will expand her business.

loans.use: to pay for ingredients to make food to sell

loans.name: Maria Concepcion

texts.es:
María tiene 30 años de edad, vive en su casa propia con su esposo e hijos, cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicada en el distrito de Mórrope que se encuentra a 40 minutos del departamento de Lambayeque.  Esta zona se dedica a la actividad agrícola, ganadería y turismo (tiene festividades  religiosas muy bonitas).

María es comerciante desde hace muchos años de ganado vacuno (vacas), su corral se encuentra en la parte externa de su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada y pastos naturales para que sus animales lleguen a tener un crecimiento óptimo para qué pueda ofrecerlos en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así obtenga muy buenas ganancias para solventar los gastos de su hogar. 

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 4000 nuevos soles para comprar más animales y arreglar sus corral, con la finalidad de que con los ingresos que obtenga pueda brindarlea su familia una mejor calidad de vida.  María es una mujer  muy responsable y trabajadora que se preocupa por tener mejoras para su negocio y seguir solventando sus necesidades familiares y brindarle a sus hijos otras oportunidades en la vida.
texts.en:
María is 30 years old and lives with her husband and children in her own house, which only has the service of electricity. It is located in the district of Mórrope, which can be found 40 minutes from the department of Lambayeque. This zone is dedicated to activities related to farming, livestock and tourism (they have beautiful religious festivals).
