María has been a livestock merchant for many years (cows). Her corral is located outside her house, and she gives them balanced feed and natural grasses so they will grow optimally. She offers them throughout the various markets in the zone, and that is how she generates good profits to meet the household expenses.

She has requested a loan of 4000 new Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternative to buy more animals and make repairs to her corral. The end result hopefully being that, with the earnings she obtains, she will be able to provide a higher standard of living for her family. María is a very responsible and hard-working woman who worries about improving her business and continuing to meet the family’s needs. She wants to give her children other opportunities in life.

loans.use: buy more animals and make repairs to her corral.

loans.name: Socorro Del Pilar

texts.es:
Socorro es una mujer de 23 años de edad, Conviviente y con 1  hijos como carga familiar, Vive en casa propia, la cual está ubicada en  el  Caserío San Eduardo en el Distrito de Tambogrande. Vive en la parte rural  de este distrito y solo cuenta con servicio básico de energía eléctrica.

La actividad que desarrolla Socorro es la ganadería como ovinos, aves de corral y porcinos, esta actividad  la desarrolla hace más de 5 años. Los animales que cría los engorda y luego los comercializa en el  mercado local, además su esposo se dedica a labores agrícolas en parcela heredada y también trabaja en un fundo agrícola donde gana semanalmente, generándole ingresos para cumplir con sus obligaciones crediticias y familiares. Existiendo buena relación para seguir creciendo en su negocio.

El monto del crédito es de 1500 nuevos soles, los cuales se destinarán para la compra de alimentos para su ganado y sus aves de corral y para el mejoramiento y remodelación de su corral.
texts.en:
Socorro is a 23 year old woman, is partnered, and has one dependent child.  She lives in her own house, which is located in the village of San Eduardo in the district of Tambogrande.   She lives in the rural part of this district and only has basic electrical service.

The industry that Socorro has is ranching, with sheep, poultry, and pigs.  She has been engaged in this business for more than 5 years.  The animals, she raises, fattens, and then sells in the local market.  In addition, her husband farms on an inherited piece of land and also works at a farm where he makes a weekly salary, generating income to cover his credit and family expenses, maintaining a good relationship to continue growing in his business.

The loan amount is for 1,500 more Soles, which are intended to buy feed for her cattle and poultry and for improvements and remodeling of the corral.

loans.use: to buy nutritionally balanced feed for her cattle.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria lives in West Point with her husband and children. For nine years now she has been running a grocery shop, where she sells fashion clothes, used clothes, and other items. Sometimes a problem she faced is that she has less income to maintain her customers, since she sells quality clothes and other items that are not found in other grocery shops. 

She is happy about her business because it sustains her family. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fashion clothes, used clothes, and other items for her business. In the future, she wants to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more fashion clothes, used clothes, and other items for her business.

loans.name: Maa

texts.en: Maa cooks rice, gari and beans stew for sale at Esuakyir near Abura. She is  married and has 3 children. She has been in this business for 5 years. Maa uses her income to support her husband and to feed, clothe and pay her children’s school fees. She will use her loan to purchase bags of rice, gari, beans and fish to cook for sale. With the new profits, she plans to build a better stall for the sale of her food.

loans.use: to purchase bags of rice, gari, beans and fish to cook for sale

loans.name: Fusi

texts.en: Fusi is a 65-year-old woman who is married with five children. She runs a business making and selling clothing in her community. She has three years of experience with this business. Fusi has requested a loan to buy more materials for making and sewing the clothes she wants to sell. She plans to use her profits to build a small house at her place for her business. She joined SPBD in 2009 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy more materials for making and sewing clothes to sell

loans.name: Sina

texts.en: Sina is 30 years old and single with one child. She owns and operates a business venture, providing clothing services. She has two years of experience in this line of business. Sina needs a loan to buy materials and paints for making her elei (Samoan printed cloth) clothing. She hopes to use her profits to expand her business. She joined SPBD in 2009.

loans.use: to purchase material and paints for making elei (Samoan printed cloth)

loans.name: Maria Sebastiana

texts.es:
María es una mujer de 35 años de edad,  es casada y tiene 3 hijos. Vive en casa propia, en el caserío Tranca Sasape de la zona rural del distrito de Túcume, cuenta con servicios de agua y luz y su comunidad es de aproximadamente 100 familias,
María se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales en su domicilio, actividad que realiza hace 6 años y que heredó de sus padres, es decir, conoce a la perfección el rubro. 
El crédito ascendiente a 2500 nuevos soles, se usará para la compra de un vehículo motorizado (mototaxi) valorizado en 4100 nuevos soles, para lo cual ya cuentan con 1600 nuevos soles, queriendo financiar con el préstamo la diferencia. La mototaxi se empleará para el transporte de personas, ganancias que serán empleadas para colaborar con los gastos del hogar.  Todo esto con la finalidad de mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María is a 35-year-old married woman with 3 children. She lives in her own home in the village of Tranca Sasape in the rural section of Túcume district. The area comprises 100 families and has potable water and electricity. María raises livestock and small animals like goats, sheep, and chicken on her property and later sells them. She learned this trade, which she has been doing since the age of 6, from her parents, so she knows every aspect of it.

The loan is 2500 nuevos soles, which will be used to buy a motorized vehicle (motor taxi) that costs 4100 nuevos soles. María already has 1600 nuevos soles and wishes to finance the difference with this loan. She will use the motor taxi to transport people, and her profits will be used to meet her household expenses.

loans.use: to buy a vehicle (motor taxi).

loans.name: David

texts.es:
David es un cliente de 30 años de edad; padre soltero que vive junto a su hijo en la casa de su madre; la cual está ubicada en el Distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.

David se dedica al transporte de pasajeros en una trimovil la cual es propia y  trabaja día y noche; esta actividad la desarrolla desde hace aproximadamente 5 años; además le ayuda a su madre en la repartición y venta de ropa en loso distintos caseríos.

El crédito que solicita es por el monto de 1.000 soles; que será para invertir en el mantenimiento de su unidad móvil (compra de llantas; cambio de aceite; etc.)
texts.en:
David is a client who is 30 years old.  He is a single father who lives with his child in his mother's home, which is located in Tambogrande, which belongs to the district of Piura.

David works transporting passengers in a motorcycle rickshaw which he owns.  He works day and night.  He has been doing this for about the last five years, and also helps his mother repairing and selling clothing in various villages.

The loan that he is requesting is for the sum of 1,000 soles, which is for investing in the maintenance of his vehicle (purchasing tires, changing the oil, etc.)

loans.use: to invest in maintenance for his vehicle (purchasing tires, changing oil, etc.)

loans.name: Ati

texts.en: Ati is a 53-year-old widow with eight children. She has a small plantation and grows taro to earn a living. She has been doing this for over two years. Ati has requested a loan to buy more taro crops. She has been a member of SBPD since 2011. With her profits, Ati hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, taro plants, and a wheel barrel.

loans.name: Fiapaipai

texts.en: Fiapaipai is 43 years old and married with six children. She makes and sells Elei printed material fabric) to earn a living and has been doing this for two years. Fiapaipai has requested a loan to expand her business. She plans to use her profits to pay her children's school fees. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy cloth, fabric paint, carved wood designs and paint rollers.

loans.name: Marleny

texts.es:
Marleny  es una mujer de 54 años de edad, es casada y tiene 3 hijos, de los cuales uno está a su cargo. Vive en casa propia con su familia en el caserìo de Pueblo Nuevo de Buenos Aires que pertenece al distrito de Morropón. La comunidad donde vive es pequeña,y cuenta con los servicios de Luz y agua.
Marleny se dedica a la venta de plásticos, de loza, tales como platos, ollas, entre otros, así mismo se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, todo esto lo viene realizando desde hace 4 años en el caserio pueblo Nuevo de Buenos Aires.
El monto del crédito solicitado es de 3000 nuevos soles, que utilizará para invertirlo en su negocio, específicamente para la compra de productos de vidrios, y plásticos, además de sillas, pues tiene pedidos por entregar, y de esa manera tenga mejores ingresos  y por ende una mejor condición de vida en la zona,  el crédito propuesto es de 3000 soles a un plazo de 12 meses con tasa Kiva.La inversión en este negocio la ayudará a captar mas clientes potenciales y esto será ventajoso, pues le permitirá tener mejores utilidades.
Tiene varios objetivos en mente, pero uno de los principales es captar más clientes potenciales, y vender su producto a un buen precio, para lograr esto la cliente se esfuerza al máximo y trabaja de sol a sol, además cuenta con clientes ya establecidos y muy fidelizados.
texts.en:
Marleny is a 54-year-old woman. She is married and has three children, one of whom is still in her care. She lives in her own house with her family in the Buenos Aires sector of the district of Morropón. The community where she lives is small, but its people have the reputation of being good and hard-working. 

Marleny works selling plastic items and dishes, including plates, pots and other items. She also sells beauty products. She has done all of this for 4 years, in the settlement of Pueblo Nuevo in Buenos Aires, in the district of Morropón.

The amount of the loan she is requesting is 3000 Peruvian new soles, which she will use to invest in her business, specifically to buy glass and plastic products, since she has orders to fill. In this way she will increase her income and ultimately have better living conditions in her area. The proposed loan is for 3000 soles over a term of 12 months with the Kiva rate. The investment in this business will help her greatly, since she will have the opportunity to attract more potential customers, and this will be advantageous since it will permit her to have better profits. 

She has various goals in mind, but one of the main ones is to capture more potential customers and sell her products at a good price. To achieve this, the borrower will put out her maximum effort and work from dawn to dusk. In addition, she already has an established base of customers who are very loyal.

loans.use: to buy glass and plastic items as well as chairs to fill customer orders.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro es un cliente de 55 años de edad; vive junto con su esposa y sus dos hijos; en el caserio La Matanza, esta comunidad cuenta con más de 10 mil habitantes en su totalidad.

Pedro se dedica a la producción y venta de plátanos desde hace 8 años; esta actividad la aprendió de sus padres; tiene una parcela la cual está ubicada en el sector Carrasco a 15 minutos de la Matanza.

El crédito que solicita es de 2.500 soles; que será para invertirlo en el sembrío de plátanos, específicamente para la compra de ùrea y sus complementos para darle mantenimiento a la producción de plátanos.

El cliente es recurrente para la entidad, viene trabajando un crédito y el monto  fue de 2.000 soles y los pagos son muy puntuales y con 0 días de atraso, ya que el préstamo otorgado fue con tasa Kiva.
texts.en:
Pedro is a 55-year-old client who lives with his wife and two children in La Matanza.  This community has more than 10,000 inhabitants overall.

Pedro has been working growing and selling plantains for the last 8 years; he learned this activity from his parents.  He has a parcel of land located in the Carrasco sector, 15 minutes from La Matanza.

The loan that he is requesting is for 2,500 soles, which will be invested in growing plantains.  It will specifically be used for purchasing urea and associated items to maintain his plantain production.

Pedro is a recurring client for the lending partner.  He has been working with one loan for the amount of 2,000 soles, and his payments have been punctual with no late payments, as the loan provided was with Kiva's rate.

loans.use: to invest in growing plantains.  It will specifically be used for purchasing urea and associated items to maintain his plantain production.

loans.name: Maria De Jesús

texts.es:
La señora Maria de Jesús es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora quien se dedica a la venta de pollo. Este negocio lo inicio aproximadamente 15 años  con lo cual saco adelante a sus 4 hijos. 
El crédito que solicita es crédito, mujer tengo derecho el cual está destinado para el uso personal de las clientas. Ella utilizara este préstamo para la realización de un chequeo médico el cual se realiza cada 9 meses.
texts.en:
Maria de Jesús is a hard-working and enterprising woman who sells chicken.  She started this business approximately 15 years ago.  It was through this business that she got her four children ahead.

She applied for a women’s loan, provided to female borrowers’ for personal use.  She will use this loan to get a medical checkup, which she does every nine months.

loans.use: to get a medical checkup.

loans.name: Dominga Antonia

texts.es:
La señora Dominga es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora quien se dedica al comercio de frutas y verduras negocio que conoce muy bien desde la edad de 12 años y con el cual ha sacado adelante a su familia. Ella tiene tres hijos pero a su cargo solo está el menor de 9 años.
El crédito lo invertirá en un chequeo médico .
texts.en:
Dominga is a hard-working and enterprising woman who sells fruits and vegetables.  She has been in this business since she was 12 years old.  Therefore, she knows it very well.  With her business she got her family ahead.  She has three children, but only the youngest, a nine year old, is under her care.

She will use the loan for a medical checkup.

loans.use: to get a medical checkup.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es:
Miriam es una mujer de 25 años de edad, es una mujer soltera y tiene un menor hijo a su cargo. Vive en casa propia junto a su bebé, la cual está ubicada en  el  Caserío El Porvenir Hualtaco III en el distrito de Tambogrande. Miriam vive en la parte rural  de este distrito y sólo cuenta con servicio básico de energía eléctrica en su domicilio.
La actividad a la que se dedica Miriam es la crianza de ganado porcino y aves de corral dentro de su domicilio, las cuales cría, engorda y comercializa en el mercado local una vez alcanzados su peso y talla ideal.Además se dedica a la venta de ropa la cual la realiza recorriendo caseríos cercanos y así ganando clientela fija.
El monto del crédito que solicita Miriam es de 2500 nuevos soles, los cuales se invertirán en la compra de alimentos para ganado y sus aves de corral y además realizar mejoras en los corrales de sus animales y mejoras en su vivienda. Esto le permitirá mejorar su nivel de vida y alcanzar sus metas como persona.
texts.en:
Miriam is a 25 year old woman who is a single mother with a minor son in her care.  She lives in her own house with her baby located in the El Porvenir Hualtaco III hamlet in Tambogrande District.  Miriam lives in the rural part of this district and the only basic utility she has in her house is electricity.

The activity that Miriam does is raising pigs and barnyard fowl at home.  She raises them, fattens them up and sells them in the local market when they reach ideal size and weight.  In addition, Miriam sells clothes in nearby hamlets winning over regular customers who see her items of clothing as novel things.

The loan Miriam is asking for is 2500 new soles that she will use to buy feed for her livestock and barnyard fowl.  She will also make improvements to the corrals where she keeps her animals and improvements to her house.  This will allow her to improve her standard of living and reach her personal goals.

loans.use: to buy nutritionally balanced feed for her livestock.

loans.name: Abajyamugambi Zone 2 Group

texts.fr:
Joël fait partie du groupe Abajyamugambi Zone 2. Il a 25 ans, il est célibataire. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.
Joël est agriculteur de riz. C’est son deuxième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimique et payer la main d’œuvre.
Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est augmentée le volume de crédit demande pour finance son agriculture. Dans les prochaines années, Joël voudrait être un meilleur producteur de riz dans sa région. Avec les profits, il prévoit de construire une belle maison.
texts.en:
Joël is a member of the group "Abajyamugambi Zone 2".  He is 25 years old and single.  His level of education is 6 years of elementary school.

Joël is a rice farmer.  This is his second loan cycle with ACB.  He will use his loan to buy chemical fertilizers and pay for labor.  To expand his business, his strategy is to increase the loan amount requested to finance his farming activity.  In the coming years, Joël would like to be one of the best rice farmers in his region.  With the profits, he is planning to build a nice house.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers and pay for labor.

loans.name: Jose Mercedes

texts.es:
José M. es un hombre de 62 años de edad, y tiene 2 hijos mayores de edad. Vive en casa propia en Barrio Nuevo, en el distrito de Mórrope. La calidad de vida en la comunidad es de subsistencia la mayoría son trabajadores independientes en negocios de comercio y crianza de animales adicionalmente dedicados a la agricultura y a trabajar como dependientes.
La actividad a la que se dedica José es a la crianza de animales de corral en su propio domicilio. Su cónyuge se encarga del cuidado de los animales. Negocio de animales ubicado en su propio domicilio  cuenta con clientela fija como comerciantes de mercados de Chiclayo.
El monto del crédito solicitado es de 2000 nuevos soles, los cuales se invertirán para inversión en negocio de animales y compra de aves pequeñas,  animales caprinos y ovinos  para la cría. Con el préstamo actual tiene pensado ampliar corrales para la crianza y comprar alimento para engorde de animales menores y ganado porcino. Actualmente  se ha propuesto ampliar su inventario en lo referente a  animales debido a que es una actividad muy rentable en la zona.
texts.en:
José M. is 62 years old.  He has two adult children.  He lives in his own house located in Barrio Nuevo in Mórrope District.  The community’s standard of living is at the subsistence level.  Most of the workers work independently in commerce and raising animals; some also farm and work as employees.

The activity that José does is raising animals in corrals located at home.  His spouse cares for the animals.  The animal business is located at home and he has a regular clientele made up of merchants in the markets in Chiclayo.

The loan he’s asking for is for 2000 new soles that he’ll use to invest in his animal business buying small fowl, goats and sheep to raise.    He plans to use this loan to expand the corrals and to buy feed to fatten up the small animals and the pigs.  He has currently set the goal of expanding his animal inventory because this is a very profitable activity in the zone.

loans.use: to buy small farm animals, to improve and expand his corrals and to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Elenoa

texts.en: Elenoa is a 27-year-old woman who is married with four children. She runs a business printing fabric in her community. She has four years of experience with this business. Elenoa has requested a loan to buy paint, fabrics and other printing tools. She plans to use her profits to expand the business. She joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, paint and other printing tools

loans.name: Ongeringufu Dukore/ Mshsh Group

texts.fr:
Drocelle fait partie du groupe Ongeringufu Dukore/MSHH. Elle a 42 ans, elle est marie avec 8 enfants de 2 ans à 23 ans, dont 6 scolarises. Elle a une personne en charge autre que ses enfants. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.
Drocelle est agriculteur de riz. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Elle va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimique et payer la main d’œuvre.
Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est augmentée le volume de crédit demande pour finance son agriculture. Dans les prochaines années, Drocelle voudrait être un meilleur producteur de riz dans sa région. Avec les profits, elle prévoit de payer les frais scolaire pour ses enfants.
texts.en:
Drocelle is a member of the group Ongeringufu Dukore/MSHH.  She is 42 years old, married, and has 8 children, whose ages range between 2 and 23 years.  Six of her children attend school. Besides her children, she has another person in her care.  Drocelle's education level is six years of elementary school.

Drocelle is a rice farmer.  This is her first loan cycle with ACB.  She will use her loan to buy chemical fertilizers and pay for labor.

In order to expand her business, her strategy is to increase the requested loan amount to finance her farming activity.  In the coming years, Drocelle would like to be an important rice producer in her region.  With the profits, she is planning to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers and pay for labor.

loans.name: Malia

texts.en: Malia is 29 years old and married with one child. She runs a small business selling vegetables in her community and has been doing this for four years. Malia has requested a loan to buy tools and seeds and to pay her children's school fees. She joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Malia will improve her home and the business, too.

loans.use: to buy more vegetable seeds, garden tools, etc and pay school fees.

loans.name: Fernanda

texts.es: Fernanda es socia del Bancomunal Virgen de Cocharcas, ella es dueña de una tienda de abarrotes, es casada, es socia de FINCA Perú hace más de 1 año, antes su tienda era pequeña pero desde que ingreso a Finca Perú su negocio creció y ella agradece a las capacitaciones de su Bancomunal donde le enseñaron a distribuir bien sus ganancias y ademas ahorra, a ella le gusta asistir a sus reuniones de su Bancomunal porque le dan charlas donde les enseñan a manejar mejor su negocio y también le ayuda en el ámbito familiar,el préstamo que solicita ahora lo invertirá en la compra de abarrotes para su negocio como arroz, azúcar, aceite y otros.
texts.en:
Fernanda is a member of the Communal Bank "Virgen de Cocharcas". She is the owner of a grocery store. Fernanda is married and has been a member of FINCA Peru for more than one year. Prior to joining FINCA Peru, her store was small and now her business has grown thanks to the training she received from her Communal Bank. Fernanda learned how to do a better job of allocating her earnings and saving. She enjoys attending her Communal Bank meetings because the discussions have taught her how to manage her business and her family life at home.

The loan she is requesting now will be invested in groceries for her business such as rice, sugar, oil, and other products.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, and other products.

loans.name: Luís Alfredo

texts.es:
Luis Alfredo tiene 22 años de edad es soltero, vive con su madre en el Cantón Chillanes Provincia de  Bolívar. Pertenece a la ventanilla rural Balacelo conformada por 10 miembros.
Luis Alfredo  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, fréjol y cebada. 
Solicita el crédito para comprar insumos necesarios para los sembríos de maíz ,frejol y arveja como son urea 2qq, abono 1qq y fertilizantes.
Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar la materia prima necesaria para la cosecha.
Las compras de los productos necesarios las realiza frecuentemente en el Cantón Chillanes cada quince días.
El sueño es que su hija pueda estudiar, aumentar la producción de frejol la cual le permita tener mayores ingresos.
Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son a las vías en mal estado perdida de las cosechas por el mal clima y problemas de salud.
En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar indor y volly en su comunidad además le gusta escuchar la música del Carnaval.
texts.en:
Luis Alfredo is 22 years old.  He is single and lives with his mother in the Cantón Chillanes, a subdivision of the province of Bolívar.  He belongs to the communal bank Balacelo, which is made up of ten members.  Luis Alfredo makes a living in agriculture, raising corn, beans and barley.

He has requested the loan to buy necessary nutrients for his corn, bean and pea crops.  These include two quintals of urea, one quintal of manure, and fertilizers.  With the help of this loan he will be able to purchase the raw materials that are needed for his harvest.  He makes purchases of the necessary products frequently in Cantón Chillanes every 15 days.  

His dream is that his daughter will be able to study and that he will increase the production of beans, which will allow him to increase his income.

The challenges he faces are the roads that are in disrepair, the loss of harvests due to poor climate, and health problems.

In his spare time, he likes to play indoor sports and volleyball in his community, and he enjoys listening to Carnival music.

loans.use: to buy seeds, manure and fertilizers.

loans.name: Satuala

texts.en: Satuala is 51 years old and married with six children. She runs a small business selling pork buns in her community and has been doing this for two years. Satuala has requested a loan to buy flour, sugar, yeast, meat, soya, etc. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Satuala will look forward to improving her business.

loans.use: to buy flour, yeast, sugar, meat, soya, etc

loans.name: Twongerumusaruro No 29/rsz / Rsz Group

texts.fr:
Marcel fait partie du groupe Twoneremusaruro No 29/Rsz. Il a 44 ans, il est marie avec 8 enfants de 2 ans à 20 ans, dont 6 scolarises. Il a 4 personnes en charge autre que ses enfants. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.
Marcel est agriculteur de riz. C’est son troisième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimique et payer la main d’œuvre.
Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est augmentée le volume de crédit demande pour finance son agriculture. Dans les prochaines années, Marcel voudrait être un meilleur producteur de riz dans sa région. Avec les profits, il prévoit de payer les frais scolaire pour ses enfants.
texts.en:
Marcel is a member of the group Twoneremusaruro No 29/Rsz.  He is 44 years old, married, and has 8 children, whose ages range between 2 and 20 years. Six of his children attend school. Besides his children, he has four other persons in his care.  Marcel's education level is six years of elementary school.

Marcel is a rice farmer. This is his third loan cycle with ACB. He will use his loan to buy chemical fertilizers and pay for labor.

In order to expand his business, his strategy is to increase the requested loan amount to finance his farming activity. In the coming years, Marcel would like to be an important rice producer in his region. With the profits, he is planning to pay his children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers and pay for labor.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es:
El señor Edgar tiene 32 años de edad, está acompañado con la señora María, tienen 2 hijos que aun son pequeños y que van a la escuela. El se dedican a la confección de trajes para particulares, para agentes de policías y militares hace más de 10 años.
Comenta que le va muy bien en su trabajo, ya que gracias a los años que lleva en esto ya tiene muy buena experiencia y el mismo se ha hecho de muy buena fama con sus clientes gracias al buen trabajo que hace.
El préstamo que solicita es para la compra de telas, hilos, agujas que precisa para entregar una gran cantidad de pedidos que tiene. El nos cuenta que gracias a su trabajo también da empleo a otras personas que lo ayudan en la terminación de las prendas. Agradece por la ayuda que está recibiendo, pues le será de gran ayuda en su microempresa.
texts.en:
Sr. Edgar is 32 years old and married to Sra. María. They have two young children who are attending school. Edgar has been making uniforms for individuals, such as police officers and military personnel, for more than 10 years. He says that he has done very well in his work. Edgar has gained good experience as a result of working all these years and has gained a reputation among his customers for doing fine work.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy fabrics, thread, and needles so that he can complete and deliver a large number of orders he has received. Edgar says that thanks to his work, he has been able to provide jobs to other people who help him complete these garments. The assistance he is receiving will be a great help to his micro-enterprise.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, thread, needles, and other supplies.

loans.name: Twitezimbere/rbr Group

texts.fr:
Jean Bosco fait partie du groupe Twitezimbere/Rbr. Il a 36 ans, il est marie avec 6 enfants de 1 an à 14 ans, dont 3 scolarises. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.
Jean Bosco est agriculteur de riz. C’est son troisième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimique et payer la main d’œuvre.
Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est augmentée le volume de crédit demande pour finance son agriculture. Dans les prochaines années, Jean Bosco voudrait être un meilleur producteur de riz dans sa région. Avec les profits, il prévoit de payer les frais scolaire pour ses enfants.
texts.en:
Jean Bosco is a member of the group Twitezimbere/Rbr.  He is 36 years old, married, and has 6 children, whose ages range between 1 and 14 years. Three of his children attend school.  Jean Bosco's education level is six years of elementary school.

Jean Bosco is a rice farmer. This is his third loan cycle with ACB. He will use his loan to buy chemical fertilizers and pay for labor.

In order to expand his business, his strategy is to increase the loan amount requested to finance his farming activity.  In the coming years, Jean Bosco would like to be an important rice producer in his region. With the profits, he is planning to pay his children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers and pay for labor.

loans.name: Lesina

texts.en: Lesina is 34 years old and married with four children. She owns and operates a business venture printing fabric (known as elei). She has two years of experience in this line of busines. Lesina needs a loan to pay her children's school fees. She hopes to use her profits to expand her business and pay the fees. She joined SPBD in 2011.

loans.use: to pay her children's school fees

loans.name: Vaiolupe

texts.en: Vaiolupe is 22 years old and married with four children. She would like to start a small business making elei (Samoan printed fabric). In order to do this, Vaiolupe needs a loan to purchase materials for elei. She will also use the loan to make improvements to her house. She hopes to use her profits to expand her business and improve her house. She has been a member of SPBD since 2011.

loans.use: to start a business making elei (Samoan printed cloth) and make improvements to her house

loans.name: Korpo

texts.en: Korpo lives in the Airport Community of Liberia. She is 36 years old, single, and lives with her two children, ages 11 and 13, who attend school. For the past fifteen years, she has been involved in local soap making. She is requesting a loan to purchase more caustic soda and palm oil  for her business. She plans to buy a piece of land and build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more caustic soda and palm oil for her soap making business.

loans.name: Winny

texts.en:
Winny is a resident of Changamwe, Kenya. She is married and has three children. Winny began a poultry business from her savings. The business has been running for two years and has been a constant source of income for her family.
Winny is requesting for a loan of 80,000 Kenya shillings to purchase chicks and poultry feed. During this cool weather the birds always do well. She also hopes to capitalize on high demand being experienced. Her ambition is to grow the business and open a branch at Mariakani.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feed.

loans.name: First Class Group

texts.en:
Zainabu is in her late 30s and married with two children who are still going to school. She has been running a grocery store for eight months. She works from 11.00 a.m. to 11.00 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This would be her third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy items missing from the grocery store and has paid back her loans successfully. She wants a loan to increase the grocery store stock. Her dream is to one day be able to buy a shamba (a field for growing crops).

She will share this loan with her loan group "First Class," which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to increase the grocery stock.

loans.name: Jacquelyn Nataly

texts.es: Jaquelin es socia del Bancomunal Dulzura, tiene 27 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de ropas para señoritas y a la venta de joyas. Es socia de FINCA Perú hace 2 años, es madre de 2 hijos, ella dice que su vida ha cambiado mucho tanto lo personal como en su negocio, ella aprende mucho de las capacitaciones que recibe en su Bancomunal, aprendió a ahorrar, y para ella eso es lo más importante porque antes no lo hacia, está muy feliz con su familia y su bebé, y lo único que desea es progresar y brindarle una buena vida a su familia. Ahora el préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de ropa para su negocio.
texts.en:
Jacquelyn is a member of the Communal Bank "Dulzura". She is 27 years old and has two children. Jacquelyn earns her living by selling clothes for young women and jewelry. She has been a member of FINCA Peru for two years and says that her her life has changed a great deal personally and in terms of her business. Jacquelyn has learned a lot from the training classes offered by her Communal Bank. She has learned how to save, which is very important to her because did not do this before.

Jacquelyn is very happy with her family and her baby. The only thing that she wishes for is to make progress and provide a good life for her family. The loan she is requesting now will be invested in the purchase of clothing for her business.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Imeleta

texts.en: Imeleta is a 38-year-old woman who is married with five children. She plans to start a small business providing lawn-mowing services. Imeleta needs a loan to buy a lawn mower, petrol, a wheelbarrow, etc. She will save profits and she looks forward to buying another new lawn mower instead of waiting until she applies for another loan to buy extra spare parts. Imeleta joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a new lawn mower, petrol, a wheelbarrow, etc

loans.name: Faapalagi

texts.en: Faapalagi is 53 years old and married with seven children. She would like to start a small business making elei (Samoan hand printed fabric). In order to do this, Faapalagi needs a loan to buy more materials. She hopes to use her profits to improve her business. She has been a member of SPBD since 2011.

loans.use: to buy more fabric, paints, etc

loans.name: Matalena

texts.en: Matalena is 50 years old and married with six children. She owns and operates a business venture, selling new clothes. She has one year of experience in this line of business. Matalena needs a loan to buy some items needed for her business. She hopes to use her profits to pay her children's school fees. She joined SPBD in 2012.

loans.use: to buy hangers, shopping bags, price tags, pins and rails

loans.name: Lamine

texts.fr: Lamine est un mécanicien qui gère un atelier de réparation de véhicules.Il est marié et père de 4 enfants. Son expérience de plus de dix ans dans son travail fait que son atelier est très fréquenté par les chauffeurs.Son activité génère ainsi des revenus assez importants qui lui permettent de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille mais aussi d'épargner dans son compte ouvert à l'UIMCEC.Afin d'améliorer son équipement, il sollicite un prêt de 250 000f pour acheter une bobine.Il ambitionne de renouveler tout son équipement devenu très vieux.
texts.en:
Lamine is a mechanic who manages an auto repair shop.  He is married and the father of four children.  He has more than ten years of experience working as a mechanic, and many drivers come to his shop.  

Thanks to this activity, Lamine is able to generate a good income, which allows him to take care of his family's needs and to build some savings in the account he opened with UIMCEC.  

In order to upgrade his equipment, he is requesting a loan of 250,000 francs for the purchase of a coil.  His ambition is to renew all of his equipment, which has become very old.

loans.use: to buy a coil.

loans.name: Sixto

texts.es:
El Sr. Sixto, vive en la ciudad de Villa Elisa, tiene 49 años, el se dedica a la Carpintería, está casado con la Sra Eleuteria, juntos tienen 8 hijos  de los cuales 3 son menores todavía y están en edad escolar los demás están estudiando y trabajando, el mayor de todos ellos trabaja en la carpintería con su papá.
Su local está ubicado en su propiedad, donde tiene con lo que necesita para poder hacer su trabajo. Comenta que hace ya 10 años que se dedica a esto, por lo que ya tiene clientela formada, y además trabaja sobre catálogos.
Comenta que solicita el crédito para la compra de madera, terciadas,clavos, pegamentos, lustres, y demás, los cuales le ayudarán a trabajar de una mejor manera. El y su familia agradecen la ayuda que está recibiendo, pues le será muy útil.
texts.en:
Sixto lives in the city of Villa Elisa. He is 49 years old. He works in carpentry. He is married to Eleuteria, and together they have 8 children, of whom 3 are still school-aged minors. The others are at the university and working. The oldest of all works in carpentry with his father.

His shop is located on his property, where he has what he needs to do his work. He comments that he has dedicated himself to this work for 10 years, and thus he has an established clientele, and he also works on a catalog basis. 

He comments that he is requesting the loan to buy wood, plywood, nails, glues, varnishes and other items, which will help him to do his work more effectively. He and his family are grateful for the help that they are receiving, since it will be very useful.

loans.use: to buy wood, plywood, nails, glues, varnishes and other supplies.

loans.name: Fou

texts.en: Fou is a 75-year-old woman who is married with 11 children. She runs a business selling general items like, rice, sugar, drinks, raw meat, canned food etc in her community. She has two years of experience with this business. Fou has requested a loan to refill her stock. She plans to use her profits to expand and enlarge her shop. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy herring, chicken, rice, sugar, washing soap, laundry powder, snacks and sweets.

loans.name: Noé De Jesús

texts.es: Noé de Jesús  de 54 años de edad, habita en casa de su propiedad. Él se dedica a la elaboración y venta de deliciosas pupusas. Su negocio está ubicado en su hogar de habitación, lugar que es muy transitado y visitado especialmente el puesto de Noé ya que gracias a su carisma y dedicación en el trabajo cada día los clientes lo prefieren más. Es muy conocido en la zona como un hombre trabajador, honesto y responsable.  Trabaja muy duro para poder mantener activo su negocio y convertirse en el líder de la zona en venta de pupusas. Éste negocio es su principal fuente de ingresos por lo que desea mantenerlo activo por mucho tiempo y seguir recibiendo los frutos que hasta el momento ha recibido con mucha satisfacción. Debido a lo anterior ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en su negocio en la compra de los insumos necesarios: frijoles, arroz, maíz, chicharon, queso, sal, tomates, repollo, bebidas, etc, además comprar nuevas mesas y sillas a fin de ampliar su negocio. de tal forma que los clientes reciban un mejor servicio y siempre estén motivados a regresar. Considera que esta es la mejor manera para hacer  crecer su negocio y poder cumplir su sueño de aumentar sus ganancias y mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia.
texts.en: Noé de Jesús is 54 years old. He lives in his own house. He prepares and sells delicious pupusas (thick corn tortillas with filling, a typical Salvadoran dish). His business is located in his home in a well-traveled area; his stand is especially well visited, since thanks to his charm and dedication to his work, the customers prefer him more every day. He is well known in the area as a hard-working, honest, and responsible man. He works very hard to be able to keep his business active and become the leading seller of pupusas in his zone. This business is his principal source of income, so he wants to keep it active for a long time and continue receiving its fruits, which so far he has received with great satisfaction. As a result, he has decided to apply to INTEGRAL for a loan to invest in his business by purchasing the necessary ingredients: beans, rice, corn, pork rinds, cheese, salt, tomatoes, cabbage, beverages, etc., in addition to buying new tables and chairs with the goal of expanding his business in such a way that the customers receive better service and are always motivated to come back. He feels that this is the best way to make his business grow and be able to accomplish his dream of increasing his earnings and improving his living conditions and those of his family.

loans.use: to buy beans, rice, corn, pork rinds, cheese, salt, tomatoes, cabbage, and beverages, as well as tables and chairs

loans.name: Urpis De Confraternidad Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “URPIS DE CONFATRERNIDAD”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Dolores ; ella es conviviente y tiene 37 años y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de repuestos de bicicletas como aros, timones, llantas, cascos entre otros,la socia lleva años en este negocio,a la vez la socia se dedica a la venta de ferreteria ,la socia trabaja conjuntamente con su pareja,siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicito el prestamo para la compra de mercaderia para la vente repuestos de bicicletas como en la compra de llantas.


Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio de tienda de abarrotes,venta de comida,venta de jugos,venta de productos de ferreteria,costurera.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the "URPIS DE CONFATERNIDAD" communal bank.  This bank is located in the district of Cusco, which belongs to the province and department of Cusco.  

The member is Señora Dolores.  She is 37 years old, lives with her husband, and has one child.  She alternates her daily activities with the business of buying and selling bicycle parts like rims, handlebars, tires, and helmets, among others.  This member has been in this business for years; at the same time she also makes a living selling hardware.  She works together with her partner, and in this way she helps her family to get ahead.  She asked for this loan to buy merchandise for the sale of bicycle parts like tires.

The other members make a living in the grocery business, selling food, selling juices, selling hardware, and as a seamstress.

She is thankful to those who share this dream and promises to complete her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for the sale of bicycle parts like tires.

loans.name: Margarita Liliana

texts.es:
Margarita se describe como una persona responsable y muy trabajadora. Margarita tiene 34 años, vive con su esposo y su hijo en San Gabriel que se encuentra en la Provincia del Carchi.

Margarita trabaja en la crianza y venta de cerdos, negocio que viene realizando desde hace unos veinte años y que le ha ayudado a solventar algunos gastos de su casa. Margarita decide realizar un nuevo crédito para la compra de crías de cerdos para seguir incrementando su negocio, que ayudará a obtener buenos ingresos que a su vez permitirá mejorar la calidad de vida de los suyos.

Margarita sueña en tener un terreno para tener a sus chancho ya que necesita un lugar más amplio.
texts.en:
Margarita describes herself as a responsible and very hard-working person. She is 34 years old and lives with her husband and her son in San Gabriel, which is in the province of Carchi.

Margarita raises and sells pigs, a business she has had for some twenty years and which has helped her pay some of the household expenses. Margarita decided to take out a new loan to purchase piglets to continue expanding her business, which will help her to obtain good income, which at the same time will allow her to improve the quality of life of her family.

Margarita dreams of having some land where she can have her pigs, since she needs a bigger space.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise, fatten, and sell

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en: Sakina sells cloth and sandals in Esuakyire near Abura. Sakina is married with two children. She uses her income to help her husband clothe and feed their children. Sakina will use her loan to purchase cloth and sandals for sale. With her new profits, Sakina will acquire a shop for the sale of her goods.

loans.use: to purchase cloth and sandals to sell.

loans.name: Néstor Iván

texts.es: Néstor Iván de 22 años de edad habita en casa de su propiedad, localizada en zona rural, junto con su familia.  Él se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos y de caña de azúcar. Ha realizado esta actividad por muchos años y es lo que le permite llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar.  Néstor Iván es un hombre muy trabajador, dinámico y responsable del cual muchas personas dan buenas referencias.  Por medio del cultivo de estos productos es como puede ganarse la vida y suplir las necesidades de su familia. Esta actividad la re repite cada año, la cual consiste en realizar la siembra, sacar la cosecha y luego pone a la venta una parte de esta para poder pagar los créditos y cubrir otras necesidades del  hogar.  Desea poder  invertir  un poco más en la agricultura con el fin de cosechar una mayor cantidad de granos básicos que le permitan mejorar sus ventas como sus ingresos. Es por esta razón que ha decidido solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en la compra de los insumos necesarios (semilla, abonos, venenos para plagas, etc.) para cosechar una mayor cantidad  de granos básicos y lograr el objetivo final de mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia.
texts.en: Néstor Iván is 22 years old. He lives with his family in his own house, which is located in a rural area. He grows basic grains and sugar cane. He has done this work for many years, and it is what permits him to provide the daily bread for his household. Néstor Iván is a very hard-working man, dynamic and responsible, and for this reason many people give him good references. Cultivating these products is how he is able to earn a living and provide the necessities for his family. His work, which he repeats every year, consists of planting, collecting the harvest, and then selling part of it to be able to pay for his loans and cover the other household necessities. He wants to be able to invest a little more in his agriculture with the goal of harvesting a larger quantity of basic grains, which will allow him to improve his sales as well as his income. It is for this reason that he has decided to apply to INTEGRAL for this loan, to invest in the purchase of the necessary supplies (seeds, compost, pesticides, etc.) in order to harvest a larger quantity of basic grains and to achieve his objective of improving living conditions for himself and his family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, compost, pesticides, etc.

loans.name: Fati

texts.en: Fati sells soap and cosmetics in Esuekyir near Abura. She is married. Fati has been selling cosmetics for 5 years. She helps her husband with the upkeep of the family. Fati will use her loan to purchase more soaps and cosmetics for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her expanded business to acquire a shop for the sale of her cosmetics.

loans.use: to purchase more soaps and cosmetics for sale.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en: Halima is single and sells waakye (rice and beans cooked together). She serves it with gari, macaroni, meat and fish stew. Halima has been selling waakye for three years now. She uses her income to pay for her accommodations. Halima needs this loan to purchase bags of rice, beans and other ingredients for the preparation of her waakye for sale. With the new profit, Halima will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of rice, beans and other ingredients for the preparation of her waakye for sale.

loans.name: Makam

texts.fr: Makam est un homme marié.Il est père de sept enfants. Il pratique l'agriculture et l'élevage. Après les récoltes, il achète des bœufs qu'il engraisse et revend sur les marchés de sa région. Cette activité d'embouche bovine lui permet de générer des revenus durant la saison non pluvieuse et d' entretenir ainsi sa famille.Après avoir constituer une épargne pendant deux mois à l'UIMCEC, il sollicite un pret de 250000 francs pour acheter deux bœufs et de la paille d'arachide pour leur alimentation. Son ambition est de construire un grand enclos pour améliorer la pratique de cette activité d'élevage.
texts.en: Makam is married, and has seven children. He is a farmer, and he rears animals. After the harvest, he buys cattle that he fattens, and then re-sells at the local markets. This cattle-fattening business allows him to earn income during the dry season, and therefore to support his family. After having saved with UIMCEC for two months, he is asking for a loan of 250,000 francs to buy two cattle and groundnut straw for them to eat. His goal is to build a large enclosure to improve his business of rearing animals.

loans.use: to buy two cattle and groundnut straw.

loans.name: Barkisu

texts.en: Barkisu sells cloth and shoes in Esuakyire near Abura. Barkisu is a single parent and has one child. As a single parent, she uses her income to clothe and feed her child and pay for school fees. Barkisu will use her loan to purchase cloth and shoes for sale. With the new profit, Barkisu will acquire a shop for the sale of her goods.

loans.use: to purchase cloth and shoes for sale.

loans.name: Sena 2 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe SENA 2 est composé de six personnes qui s'approvisionnent au même endroit et appartiennent à un même groupe de tontine. C'est la quatrième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Micheline est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Micheline est âgée de 37 ans. Micheline ne vit plus avec son mari, mais a cinq enfants dont trois sont à sa charge. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés. Micheline n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Micheline vit seule avec ses trois enfants et assure seule ses différentes charges. Pour contribuer aux différents besoins de ses enfants, Micheline fait la transformation de noix de palme depuis quinze ans dans sa région. Cette activité lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté à ses besoins. Micheline s’approvisionne au Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Micheline sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe SENA 2, un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits précédents ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The SENA 2 group consists of six members who get their supplies from the same place and belong to the same savings group.  It is the fourth time that this group is requesting financial assistance from ALIDé, in order to increase its level of activity.

Micheline, age 37 and raising her hand in the photo, is the group's representative.  She no longer lives with her husband, but she has five children, three of whom are her dependents.  All her children attend school.  Micheline herself never went to school.  She lives alone with her three children and takes care of expenses by herself.  In order to provide for her children's various needs, Micheline has been processing palm nuts, locally, for fifteen years.  Thanks to this activity, she is able to meet her needs without much difficulty.  She gets her supplies in Benin.

Eager to satisfy her customers, and in order to increase her turnover and income, Micheline is requesting a fourth loan from ALIDé, along with the other members of the SENA 2 group.  Previous loans have been well repaid.

loans.use: to buy palm nuts and palm kernels.

loans.name: Shalom Group

texts.en: The nine women in the Shalom Trust Bank are very excited to start their fifth loan cycle. The capital from the new loan cycle will be used by the Trust Bank members to boost the productivity of their businesses – benefiting not only them but also their families. Having named their group "Shalom" (Peace) for a reason, the members hope every loan cycle brings their families closer to contentment. Most group members are from the municipality of Olintepeque in Quetzaltenango, Guatemala. Olintepeque has paved roads that connect its villages, with farms scattered among the villages. Residents of the area are primarily engaged in growing corn, wheat, beans, green beans, peas, oats, potatoes, and fruits. Some residents make crafts, including jewelry, leather, wax and wood. The languages spoken in Olintepeque are Spanish and K'iche. Olivia, who is one of the youngest members of the Shalom Trust Bank, is 24 years old and is a single mother of two boys (an eight-year-old who is already in school and a two-year-old). Olivia is a street vendor who sells fruits and pupusas (a type of traditional food), which she has been doing for about eight years. She sells in eight different villages and works six days a week. Some days, Olivia leaves home at 6:30 a.m. and does not return until 8 p.m. Having never completed her education, Olivia decided to go back to school and is now in the fifth grade. She hopes to continue learning and, one day, become a teacher. For Olivia, being part of Friendship Bridge and having access to small loans is really helpful because she can now earn an income to support herself and her two children, give her children an education and continue her own education. With a new loan through Kiva lenders, Olivia will buy a variety of fruits so that she can continue to expand her business—her clientele is growing and she needs to keep up! Besides completing her education, Olivia dreams of one day owning a proper storefront to sell her fruit. She struggles with her business during the rainy season because it is difficult to travel. With a storefront, her clients would know where she is at all times and be able to come to her. Olivia and her fellow Shalom Trust Bank members are thrilled that people from other countries want to help them. They are grateful for the support of Kiva lenders because they are not only gaining financial assistance but also they are building success. The Shalom Trust Bank sends their blessings.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fruits and chickens.

loans.name: Tenisi

texts.en:
Tenisi is a 42-year-old married woman with five children.
 
She has a small plantation and grows taro to earn a living. She has been doing this for four years. Tenisi has requested a loan to buy farming tools. 

She has been a member of SPBD since 2009. With her profits, Tenisi hopes to improve her home and expand the business.
"

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, taro crops, and other farming tools

loans.name: Nerisa

texts.en: Nerisa is 20 years old and married with one child. She makes and sells elei printed fabric to earn a living and has been doing this for two years. Nerisa has requested a loan to buy new equipment such as brushes, fabric paint, and plain fabric. She plans to use her profits to enlarge her business. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy fabric, fabric paint, carved wooden designs and a brush.

loans.name: Laina

texts.en:
Laina is a 28-year old married woman with three children.
 
She would like to start growing fruits and vegetables to earn a living. Laina has requested a loan to buy vegetables and fruits to grow.

She has been a member of SPBD for two years. Laina will spend her profits to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy pawpaw, ripe bananas, oranges, mangoes, etc

loans.name: Tepora

texts.en: Tepora is 35 years old and married with four children. She runs a small business selling pancakes and cordial mixed drinks in her community and has been doing this for one year. Tepora has requested a loan to buy ingredients and supplies. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Tepora will use her profits to enlarge her business and renew her house.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, oil, cordial and plastic cups

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en: Luisa is 36 years old and married with four children. She owns and operates a small store, selling items such as drinks, cooking oil, bread, matches, beer and a variety of other items. She has been doing this for two years. Luisa needs a loan to refill her stock. She hopes to use her profits to pay for her children's education. She became a member of SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, beer, sugar, onions, and cigarettes

loans.name: Taofi

texts.en: Taofi is a 38-year-old woman who is married with two children. She runs a business selling a variety of items such as, rice, salt, flour, snacks and drinks in her community. She has two years of experience with this business. Taofi has requested a loan to expand her business. She plans to use her profits to open another branch at the market. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, flour, salt, corned beef, drinks, and snacks to sell

loans.name: Maria Madgalena

texts.es: María es socia del Bancomunal Virgen de Cocharcas,ella vende cosméticos y en ocasiones compra cereales enteros y los vende ya molidos, es socia de FINCA Perú hace más de 2 años, en las capacitaciones de su Bancomunal le enseñan a ahorrar y a administrar mejor su negocio, también le dan consejos que utiliza en su familia, logró comprarse muebles para su hogar,ahora el préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de cereales para su negocio.
texts.en:
María is a member of the Communal Bank "Virgen de Cocharcas". She sells cosmetics, but occasionally she sells whole-kernel and ground grains. María has been with FINCA Peru for more than two years. The training classes offered by her Communal Bank have taught her how to save and do a better job of managing her business. She also received advice that she could use with her family and has been able to buy furniture for her home.

The loan she is requesting now will be invested in the purchase of grain for her business.

loans.use: to buy grains.

loans.name: Anarosa

texts.en: Anarosa is 20 years old and married with no children. She owns and operates a business venture, making elei (Samoan hand painted fabric). She has two years of experience in this line of business. Anarosa needs a loan to buy supplies to improve her business. She hopes to use her profits to expand her business. She joined SPBD in 2011.

loans.use: to buy paint, brushes, and fabric for making elei

loans.name: Lualuama

texts.en: Lualuama is a 39-year-old woman who is married with seven children. She has a small business sewing clothes. She has one year of experience with this business. Lualuama needs a loan to buy a new sewing machine, needles, thread and material. She will use her profits to pay for her children's school fees. Lualuama joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine, needles, thread, buttons and rolls of new fabric

loans.name: Palasi

texts.en: Palasi is 42 years old and married with two kids. She runs a small business selling fried and grilled food in her community and has been doing this for two years. Palasi has requested a loan to enlarge her business. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Palasi will use her profits to pay for her childrens school fees.

loans.use: to buy sausages, chicken, mutton, rice, bananas and taro

loans.name: María Ysabel

texts.es:
María es una mujer de 24 años de edad, casada, con 02  hijos, Vive en casa propia, la cual está ubicada en  el  Caserío San Martín CP-3 Distrito de Tambogrande. Y solo cuenta con servicio básico de energía eléctrica.
La actividad que desarrolla María es la venta de productos de primera necesidad y además la crianza de aves de corral, cuenta con más de 06 años de experiencia en el manejo de su negocio  ambos negocios bien conducidos, su conviviente se dedica a la agricultura y lo apoya en sus actividades que realiza.
El monto solicitado es de 4,500 nuevos soles, que  invertirá en la compra de una mototaxi, para transporte de mercadería y además para transporte de pasajeros, clienta cuenta con una parte de dinero para la compra.
texts.en:
Maria, 24, is married and has two children. She lives in her own home in the village of San Martin CP-3 in the district of Tambogrande. The only utility that she has is electricity.

Maria sells basic goods and also raises chickens. She's been managing her business for more than 6 years and both are well run. Her husband is a farmer and she supports him in his work.

The 4500 nuevos soles will be invested in the purchase of a mototaxi to transport merchandise and passengers. She already has some money set aside for the purchase.

loans.use: to buy a mototaxi that she will use to transport her merchandise. She has some money set aside for this.

loans.name: Arcoiris Group

texts.en:
The Arcoiris Trust Bank was formed by 14 enthusiastic and hard-working women. The group named their trust bank Arcoiris (rainbow) because the rainbow resembles the spectrum of colors used in their traditional clothing. 

This group is located in the village of Juchanep, which is a rural community about 30 minutes away from downtown Totonicapán in southwestern Guatemala. The languages spoken in Juchanep are Spanish and K'iche.

The Arcoiris Trust Bank will be starting their sixth loan cycle with Friendship Bridge. The women are anxiously waiting for their new loans, which will help fund their various businesses and enable them to prepare for the village fair, which is set for June 2012. The fair is one of their biggest selling events of the year. Nine of the Trust Bank members are weavers and the others are involved in commerce activities of some sort.
 
Paulina is one of the founders of the Trust Bank. Named after her grandmother, she only has a second-grade education but is a very proactive and dynamic woman. Paulina is 36 years old, has four children and is currently the president of the Arcoiris Trust Bank. 

Paulina has worked in the textiles industry for 15 years. Her business has grown considerably over the years, and she currently has two full-time employees. Paulina and her employees are able to make nine cortes (typical skirts) a week, but in high demand seasons, they work longer hours and can produce enough cortes to keep up with demand. 

In addition to her textile business, Paulina recently started raising chickens. With this new loan from Kiva, Paulina plans to buy a variety of threads to make several cortes that clients have ordered, and she plans to buy more chickens to raise. Paulina's dreams are to employ at least two more people and to continue to support her children's education.

The Arcoiris Trust Bank members appreciate the support Kiva lenders provide and the trust Kiva lenders put in their businesses, which helps the Trust Bank members' families and improves their lives.

loans.use: To buy a variety of threads, and more chickens to raise.

loans.name: Ana Lucía

texts.es:
Ana se describe como una persona humilde, responsable, carismática, solidaria de carácter fuerte en algunas ocasiones. Ana tiene 37 años, vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos en San Gabriel que se encuentra en la Provincia del Carchi.

Ana se dedica al sembrar y cultivar tomate de árbol y tomate riñón, negocio que le ayuda mucho ya que es una fuente importante de ingresos económicos para su familia, pero en la actualidad los cultivos se estan dañando por los malos climas y ocacionan pérdidas, es por eso que Ana realiza un crédito para comprar materiales como plástico, tubos y madera para la construcción de un pequeño invernadero que ayudará a que su producción sea de acalidad.

Ana sueña con tener invernaderos grandes para que su producción sea mayor y de buena calidad, para que logren mejorar la calidad de vida.

En la fotografía Ana es la señora de gorra blanca.
texts.en:
Ana describes herself as humble, responsible, charismatic and occasionally of strong character. Ana is 37 and lives with her husband and three children in San Gabriel in the province of Carchi.

Ana plants and grows tree tomatoes and tomatoes, a business that has been an important source of income for her family. Currently her crops are damaged from the bad weather and this has caused losses. That's why Ana needs a loan to buy materials like plastic, tubes and wood to build a small greenhouse that will help her to have a better quality production.

Ana dreams of having large greenhouses so that she can have a larger and better quality crop, so that she can improve her quality of life.

In this photo Ana is the woman in the white cap.

loans.use: to buy materials like plastic, tubes, and wood to build a greenhouse.

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
Emelita is 39 years old and lives in Libertad Bajo, Sinacaban. She is married with 3 children.

Emelita has a general store that sells a variety of products. She has been running this business for 2 years. Emelita requested a loan of PHP 5000 to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages and detergents.

Emelita has been a member of PMPC for a month. In the future, Emelita hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages and detergents.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is married with 2 children. She is 57 years old and lives in Cabol-anonan, Tudela.

Virginia is a farmer and grows rice crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for 20 years. Virginia has requested a loan of PHP 25,000 to purchase additional fertilizers such as inorganic fertilizers.

Virginia has been a member of PMPC for 5 years. In the future, Virginia hopes to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizers such as inorganic fertilizers.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is a 43-year old resident of Yahong, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. For the past 8 years, she has been supporting the needs of her 3 children with the small amount (PHP 8,000) she earns monthly from her own piggery business, helping her husband who makes money from laboring. In 2007, Susan became a member of GDMPC, and she is currently applying for a loan  of 15,873 at GDMPC micro finance to buy feeding supplies. Susan wants to expand her business one day.

loans.use: to buy feeding supplies

loans.name: Sheka

texts.en: This is 32 year-old Sheka. In 2001, Sheka established his tailoring business. He began his business after completing his training. This business is now Sheka’s only source of livelihood. Working 6 days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,000,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,500,000. Sheka has already received and successfully repaid one, and now requires a new loan in order to buy another sewing machine at Le3, 000,000 and an over-lock head at le.500.000. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. In the future, Sheka plans to grow his business into a training school. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy another sewing machine and an over-lock head

loans.name: El Progreso Del Bosque Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Isabel, tiene 45 años de edad, tiene 3 hijos quienes la apoyan en todos los proyectos que ella emprende y además son su razon y motivo para salir adelante ya que aún tiene que apoyarlos en cuanto a los estudios.
la Sra. Isabel forma parte del grupo "El Progreso del Bosque", formado por 7 socios, todos pequeños comerciantes con un sólo fin lograr el progreso mediante mucho trabajo.
Desde hace un año la Sra. Isabel se dedica a la venta de gas, negocio que ha implementado en su domicilio, donde sus principales clientes son sus vecinos, empezó con pocos balones de gas, y poco a poco ha ido aumentando su stock asi como también aumentaron sus ingresos y clientela.
El préstamo recibido lo invertirá en la compra de balones de gas y así aumentar su stock.
texts.en:
Sra. Isabel is 45 years old. She has three children who support all of the projects that she undertakes. In addition, they are the reason and motivation behind her drive to succeed since she wants to help them with their studies.

Sra. Isabel is a part of the group "El Progreso del Bosque" (The Progress of the Forest), which consists of seven members. All of them are small business people whose only goal is to make progress through hard work. For the past year, Sra. Isabel has been selling gas. She established this business out of her home and her main customers are her neighbors. Isabel started out with a few tanks of gas and over time she has gradually increased her inventory. As a result, her income and her customer base have grown. The loan she is receiving will be invested in the purchase of tanks of gas so that she can increase her stock.

loans.use: to purchase tanks of gas.

loans.name: Felicitas Susana

texts.es: Felicitas es socia del Bancomunal Diamantes, tiene 64 años de edad, es madre de 5 hijos, se dedica a la venta de ropa para señoras en las ferias,  es socia de FINCA Perú hace 5 años y todo este tiempo ella pudo aprender muchas cosas como los consejos para tener un negocio próspero y rentable, ella trajo a sus hijas a Finca Perú para que también sean socias porque quiere que sus hijas también aprendan todo lo que ella aprende en las capacitaciones de Bancomunal,ahora el préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de ropa para su negocio.
texts.en:
Felicitas is a member of the Communal Bank "Diamantes" (Diamonds). She is 64 years old and the mother of five children. Felicitas sells women's clothing at the fairs. She has been a member of FINCA Peru for five years and throughout that time she was able to learn many things. The advice she received included how to have a prosperous and profitable business. She introduced her daughters, who are also members, to FINCA Peru because she wanted them to learn the same things that she discovered from her Communal Bank training classes.

The loan she is requesting now will be invested in the purchase of clothing for her business.

loans.use: to purchase women's clothing.

loans.name: Melania Ana

texts.es:
Melania Ana tiene 22 años de edad es soltera, vive con sus padres en el Cantón Chillanes Provincia Bolívar. Pertenece a la ventanilla rural Balacelo conformado por 10 miembros.
Melania Ana se dedica a la agricultura siembra maíz, arveja, frejol además a la crianza, compra y venta de cerdos.
Solicita el crédito para comprar criar y vender cerdos además para comprar insumos necesarios para sus sembríos como abono 1qq, urea 2qq.
Con la ayuda del crédito ahora puedo comprarlos ,criarlos para luego venderlos.
Las compras y ventas de los productos las realiza con frecuencia en el Cantón Chillanes cada semana.
El sueño es comprar cerdos criarlos para luego venderlos para tener ingresos mas altos y que su negocio prospere junto a su familia.
Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son vías en mal estado y malestar en los animales.
En el tiempo libre le gusta preparar alimentos (cocinar) y escuchar el Carnaval.
texts.en:
Melania Ana is 22 years old, single, and lives with her parents in the canton of Chillanes in Bolivar Province. She is a member of the Communal Bank "Balacelo", which consists of 10 members.

Melania Ana is a farmer who grow corn, peas, and beans. She also raises and sells pigs. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy pigs to raise and sell. In addition, she will purchase necessary supplies for her crops, such as one quintal of compost (1 quintal = 46 kg) and two quintals of urea. With the help of this loan, she will be able to buy what she needs for producing the goods that she will sell. Her purchases and sales are conducted frequently in the canton of Chillanes each week. Her dream is to buy pigs to raise so that she can sell them later to earn more income and operate a prosperous business with her family. The challenges she faces include having to travel on roads that are in bad condition and dealing with the distress that it causes in the animals.

In her free time, Melania Ana enjoys preparing food (cooking) and listening to the Carnival festivities.

loans.use: to buy seeds, compost, urea, and pigs.

loans.name: Mónica

texts.es: Mónica es socia del Bancomunal Dulzura, tiene 28 años de edad, es dueña de dos Combis que trabajan en el transporte urbano y ella también trabaja en la recepción del hotel de su tía. Es socia de FINCA Perú hace 10 años, es madre de 2 hijos, ella dice que ha cambiado mucho con ella misma y con su familia,está muy agradecida por el apoyo que le brindaron en Finca Perú y dice que puede lograr mas aún, las capacitaciones de su Bancomunal son muy importantes ya que le ayudaron a ser mas responsable, y tener siempre en su mente que nunca debe caer. Ahora el préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de llantas para sus combis.
texts.en:
Mónica is a member of the Communal Bank "Dulzura". She is 28 years old and the mother of two children. Mónica owns two minibuses used for urban transportation, but she also works as a receptionist at her aunt's hotel. She has been member of FINCA Peru for 10 years and says that many things have changed for her and her family. Mónica is very grateful for the support that FINCA Peru has provided and says that she can accomplish even more. The training classes offered by her Communal Bank are very important because they have helped her to become more responsible and to never be scared of failure.

The loan she is requesting now will be invested in the purchase of tires for her minibuses.

loans.use: to buy tires for her minibuses.

loans.name: Takku Ligguey Tabangoye Group

texts.fr: Le groupe "Takku Liggey Tabangoye" est composée de 5 femmes qui se sont regroupées pour s'appuyer mutuellement dans le commerce  de tissus et de produits divers qu'elles pratiquent. Les quatre sont mariées et l'une est célibataire.Elles achètent en gros les tissus dans un pays limitrophe et se partagent le produit en fonction de l'apport de chacune. Elles revendent en détail et souvent à crédit à des clientes qu'elles connaissent bien. Cette activité leur rapporte des bénéfices non négligeables qui leur permettent de subvenir à leurs besoins et de soutenir leurs familles. Le chef du groupe ( qui a la main levée) est mère de trois enfants. Elle tient une boutique alimentaire dans laquelle elle a aménagé un espace où elle expose ses tissus.Elle participe fortement à la prise en charge des dépenses d'entretien de ses enfants avec ses bénéfices. Afin de renforcer leur fonds de commerce, le groupe sollicite un pret de 250000f pour acheter des tissus et des articles de mercerie.Leur ambition est de se lancer dans le commerce d'ustensiles de cuisine.
texts.en:
The Takku Liggey Tabangoye group consists of five women who have come together to support each other as they are involved in the trade of fabrics and other various goods.  Four members of the group are married, one is single.  They buy fabrics in bulk in a neighboring country and share the earnings based on each member's contribution.  They sell retail, often on credit, to a customer base made up of women whom they know well.  Thanks to this activity, they generate rather good profits, which allow them to meet their own needs and support their families.

The group's coordinator (raising her hand in the photo) is the mother of three children.  She has a shop where she primarily sells food products, but where she has also created a space to display her fabrics.  With her profits she greatly contributes to the expenses related to the care of her children.

In order to strengthen their business, the group is requesting a loan of 250,000 francs for the purchase of fabrics and dressmaking supplies.  Their ambition is to become involved in the trade of kitchen utensils.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and dressmaking supplies.

loans.name: Maximiliana

texts.es: Maximiliana es socia del Bancomunal Dulzura, tiene 50 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de pollo frito. Es socia de FINCA Perú hace 2 años, es madre de 2 hijos, ella aprendió a ser mas responsable,puntual y solidaria,ella dice que FINCA Perú no solo te brinda un préstamo sino que también te enseña como invertir y administrar su negocio, algo que otras instituciones no brindan, ella valora mucho eso porque le ayuda a progresar. Ahora el préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de bebidas como refrescos y gaseosas para venderlas en su negocio.
texts.en:
Maximiliana is a member of the Communal Bank "Dulzura". She is 50 years old and the mother of two children. She sells fried chicken. Maximiliana has been a member of FINCA Peru for two years and has learned how to be more responsible, punctual, and supportive. In addition to providing loans, Maximiliana says that FINCA has taught her how to invest and manage her business. Other institutions do not provide such training, so she values the assistance that has helped her to make progress.
