The loan she is requesting now will be invested in beverages, such as soft drinks and sodas, to sell in her business.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks and sodas to sell.

loans.name: María Elvidia

texts.es: María Elvidia de sesenta y uno  años de edad es una mujer dedicada al trabajo, tiene una venta de ropa y sandalias en el mercado cercano a la localidad donde reside, vende ropa en variedad para damas, caballeros y niños como faldas, pantalones, vestidos, trajes entre otros, es muy conocida pues tiene el puesto más surtido, la gente siempre encuentra ahí lo que necesita, todo lo que comercia es de muy buena calidad y lo vende a precios realmente accesibles además el servicio no deja nada que desear, los clientes siempre quedan satisfechos; María es una mujer emprendedora, dispuesta a salir adelante con esfuerzo y dedicación, piensa que su mayor arma es la perseverancia y el amor que le pone a su labor, está muy motivada a hacer crecer su negocio, nunca desiste de sus aspiraciones. es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar ropa por mayor. María Elvidia tiene fe que así podrá regalar una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María Elvidia is a 71-year-old woman who is dedicated to her work. She sells clothing and sandals at a market near the town where she lives. María sells a variety of clothing for women, men, and children such as skirts, trousers, dresses, suits, and other items. She is widely recognized because she keep her stand well-stocked and people are always able to find what they need. All of her merchandise is of good quality and sells at an affordable price. In addition, her service leaves nothing for granted and her customers are always satisfied.

María is an enterprising woman who is willing to move forward with effort and dedication. She believes her greatest strength is her perseverance and her love for what she does. María is very motivated to grow her business and is not willing to give up her dreams. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from Apoyo Integral so that she can buy clothing in bulk. She has faith that she will be able to achieve a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy clothing in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy potatoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, beans, oil, gelatin, detergents, soap, bread, and other household products.

loans.name: Dukoreneza Group

texts.fr:
Pierre fait partie du groupe Dukoreneza. Il a 31 ans, il est marie avec 4 enfants de 3 ans à 13 ans, dont 3 scolarises. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.

Pierre est agriculteur de riz. C’est son deuxième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimique et payer la main d’œuvre.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est augmentée le volume de crédit demande pour finance son agriculture. Dans les prochaines années, Pierre voudrait être un meilleur producteur de riz dans sa région. Avec les profits, il prévoit de payer les frais scolaire et médicaux pour ses enfants.
texts.en:
Pierre is a member of the Dukoreneza group. He is 31 years old, married, and has 4 children, ages 3 to 13. Three of his children attend school. Pierre's education level is six years of elementary school.

Pierre is a rice farmer. This is his second loan cycle with ACB. He will use his loan to buy chemical fertilizers and pay for the cost of labor.

In order to expand his business, his strategy is to increase the loan amount requested to finance his farming activity. In the coming years, Pierre would like to be an important rice producer in his region. With the profits, he is planning to pay for his children's school fees and medical expenses.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers and pay for the cost of labor.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
For 11 years in Lapasan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Evelyn, a 35-year-old married mother of four children, has made a living through the operation of a general store selling a variety of food and home-use products. She earns 8,605 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Evelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She is now requesting a loan of 12,132 PHP to purchase new items such as candy, Milo, shampoo, soap, etc. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items such as candy, Milo, shampoo, soap, etc.

loans.name: Alpha

texts.en:
This is 38-year-old Alpha. He is married and has 4 children, aged 14, 10, 8 and 5. In 2004, Alpha established his oil paint, paint brush, door lock, nail, staple, roller brush etc. business.  Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,300,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. 

Alpha has already received and successfully repaid 2 loans, and now requires a new loan in order to buy 25 gallons of oil paint at Le 68,000 and 15 roller brushes at Le 100,000. In the future, Alpha plans to build a house, educate his children up to university, acquire a shop and send his children abroad. His major challenge is limited capital. He is a hardworking businessman. The previous loan helped him to have more profit. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy 25 gallons of oil paint at Le 68,000 and 15 roller brushes at Le 100,000.

loans.name: Walodagbe Group

texts.fr: WALODAGBE est un groupe composé de quatre personnes qui habitent le même village et exercent les activités similaires. La représentante du groupe du nom de Madeleine (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 59 ans. Madeleine est mariée à un marchand du nom de Bertin. Le couple a quatre enfants dont un seul enfant est à leur charge. Madeleine vit ensemble avec son enfant et son mari et assure ensemble avec son mari les charges de la maison. Madeleine n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Madeleine mène comme activité la transformation de noix de palme à son domicile. Madeleine s’approvisionne dans une région du Bénin. Dans le but de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle de plus en plus nombreuses et de se faire plus de profit, Madeleine sollicite, ensemble avec les autres  membres du groupe WALODAGBE, un autre crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
WALODAGBE is a group which consists of four members who live in the same village and are involved in similar activities.

The group's representative (raising her hand in the photo) is named Madeleine.  She is 59 years old and married to a seller named Bertin.  The couple has four children, only one of whom is their dependent.  Madeleine lives with her child and husband and takes care of the household expenses with her husband.  She has never attended school.  In order to cover her various expenses, Madeleine processes palm nuts at home.  She buys her supplies in a town in Benin.

In order to better meet the needs of an increasingly large number of customers, and also to increase her profits, Madeleine is requesting a new loan from ALIDé, along with the other members of the WALODAGBE group.  The previous loans have been well repaid.

loans.use: to buy palm nuts.

loans.name: Tranquilino

texts.en:
Tranquilino is 64 years old and lives in Lower Lamac, Oroquieta City, in the province of Misamis Occidental in the Philippines. He is a widower and has two children. 

Tranquilino has a general store that sells a variety of products such as soft drinks and canned goods. He has had this business for two years. He has requested a loan of 14,000 PHP to purchase stocks for his general store.

Tranquilino has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, he hopes to own a house and lot.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of products like soft drinks and canned goods for his general store.

location.town: Oroquieta-Lower Lamac, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occ

loans.name: Anicita

texts.en:
Anicita is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. 

Anicita provides motorela or motorcycle services with her husband as the driver. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of 17,000 PHP to buy tools for maintenance, like a T-wrench, air compressor and screwdriver, and to pay for gasoline for the services.

Anicita has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Anicita hopes to improve her services to provide for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy tools for the maintenance of the motorcycle, like a T-wrench, air compressor and screwdriver, and to pay for gasoline

loans.name: Desideria

texts.en:
Desideria is a farmer from Trinidad, Bohol, in the Philippines. She is 46 years old and married with 9 children between the ages of 1 and 17. Desideria's husband is also a farmer.

Desideria has been growing and selling rice for 10 years. She earns about 10,000 PHP per month doing this type of farming. She has applied for a loan to purchase fertilizer and other farm inputs. Desideria hopes for this loan to help her achieve an abundant harvest.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Rio Rita

texts.en:
Rio Rita is widowed with three children. She is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Rio Rita sells native delicacies like biko, suman, fruit cake, cassava cake, banana cake and hot cake to earn a living and has had this business for 10 years. Each month,she earns PHP 6,000 doing this type of work. 

She has requested a loan for PHP 17,000 to buy the raw ingredients for making snacks, such as sugar, flour, rice, cheese, cassava chips, banana chips and food coloring.

Rio Rita has been a member of HSPFI for one year. In the future, she hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy the raw ingredients for making snacks or native delicacies like biko, suman, rice cake, hot cake, fruit cake, banana cake and cassava cake

loans.name: Amgalan

texts.en:
Amgalan is 48 years old and lives with her husband and six-year-old granddaughter in a ‘ger’ (Mongolian traditional felt tent) in a suburb of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her husband, Altangadas, helps her to run the business and her granddaughter attends a local primary school.  

She started to run her own business at Narantuul in 2000, the largest outdoor market of Mongolia. Amgalan makes curtains, felt covers (for Mongolian gers) and kids’ shoes at home and sells them at Narantuul. The business profitability is relatively high during the spring and summer seasons. Today, she has working capital of 5,000,000 MNT (Mongolian Tugriks) and hopes to increase it in the future. 

She is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to purchase more materials to make curtains and felt covers. By doing so, she can increase the number of products she has available to sell, which will later help to develop the business. Her aim is to have her own large capacity workshop, where she can manufacture more products.

loans.use: to purchase more materials to make curtains and felt covers.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Lilibeth has a shop that sells fish or sea foods, such as dalagang bukid, sap-sap, flying fish and milkfish. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 16,000 to buy stocks of fish to sell, such as dalagang bukid, tamban, lapu-lapu, milkfish and flying fish.

Lilibeth has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Lilibeth hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of fish to sell, such as dalagang bukid, tamban, sap-sap, milkfish, flying fish and lapu-lapu

loans.name: Ganchimeg

texts.en:
Ganchimeg is a 29-year-old widow who lives with her son and parents in a small apartment in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Although she specialized in accounting, she supports her family by operating an office clothing business at a local indoor market. 

Her long term aim is to create a great and comfortable opportunity to study and live with her son, so she is requesting a 3,500,000 Mongolian Tugrik (MNT) loan to purchase more office clothes to sell.

loans.use: to purchase office clothes to sell.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 55 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is a widow and has five children. 

Rebecca has a food/retail shop, or sari-sari store, that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan of 14,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, soap, shampoo, detergent and beverages.

Rebecca has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, she hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of canned goods, snacks, soft drinks, detergent and soap.

loans.name: Allen

texts.en:
Allen is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Allen has a shop that sells personal care products, such as food supplements, skin care items and home and car care items. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan for PHP 15,000 to to purchase additional products to sell, such as food supplements, skin care items and car and home care products.

Allen has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Allen hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell, such as skin care items, food supplements and car and home care products

loans.name: Edralen

texts.en:
This is Edralen. She is 42 years old and a resident of Dasmarinas, Cavite, Philippines. Her husband is Romy, who is a driver and she is a mother to her five children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Edralen operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php 5 worth of cooking oil or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 15,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Edralen hopes her business will grow in the coming years and dreams to be able to give her children a good future and a high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Mira

texts.en:
This is Mira, 46, resident of Dasmarinas, Cavite, Philippines. Her husband is Benjamin, a driver, and father to her two children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Mira operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which sells groceries, toiletries and beverages in small amounts to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy a small amount of shampoo, 5 PHP worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns a profit by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. They also operate one jeepney unit for added income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a 16,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Mira hopes her business will grow into a grocery store in the coming years and dreams of being able to give her children a good future and high quality education through all the hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Edralin

texts.en:
Edralin farms for a living. She is a 36-year-old married mother of 4 school-aged children. Edralin primarily grows rice crops to sell. She has been doing this for 11 years now. Edralin earns 3,000 PHP per month from farming. 

She has requested a loan to purchase fertilizer and rice seeds. She hopes for her business to grow and for her family to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and rice seeds.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 76 years old. She is a widow and lives in the Philippines. 

Lucia has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, bath soap, shampoo, detergents, floor wax and beverages.

Lucia has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Lucia hopes to improve her business for the education of her niece and nephew.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, bath soap, shampoo and beverages

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 56 years old and married with five children. 

She does tailoring to earn a living and has been in this business for five years. She employs five people. Elizabeth describes her business environment as competitive because many people do the same thing. To earn extra income she does dairy farming. 

Since she joined Faulu Kenya,she has been able to grow her business and hopes to expand her it further in the future. She has applied for 30,000 Kenya Shillings to buy a tailoring machine.

loans.use: To buy a tailoring machine

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 27 years old. He sells electronics to earn a living. He has been in this business for three years and employs one person. To earn extra income he runs a barber shop. 

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save his income and hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for 50,000 Kenya Shillings to buy electronics to sell.

loans.use: To buy electronics to sell

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
This is Jesusa, 50, resident of Dasmarinas, Cavite, Philippines. Her husband is Domingo, her business partner. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Jesusa operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which sells groceries, toiletries and beverages in small amounts to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy a small amount of shampoo, 5 PHP worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns a profit by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a 19,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Jesusa hopes her business will grow in the coming years and dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Ma.elena

texts.en:
Ma.Elena is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Ma.Elena has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, soap, shampoo, detergents and beverages.

Ma.Elena has been a member of HSPFI since 2006. In the future, she hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, soap, shampoo, detergents, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Florife

texts.en:
This is Florife, age 52, a resident of Dasmarinas in Cavite Province in the Philippines. Her husband, Melchor, is also her business partner. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Florife operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 PHP worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns an income by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling them by the unit. Her store is located adjacent to her house. She also does direct selling for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 600 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a loan of 32,000 PHP. She will utilize the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business. 

Florife hopes that her business will grow in the coming years and dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is 41 years old and married with two children. He runs a taxi transport business to earn a living and has been in this business for four years. He describes his business environment as competitive because many people do the same thing. 

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to improve his living standards and hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for 30,000 Kenya Shillings to buy new tires for his car.

loans.use: To buy new tires for his car

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Gloria has a food/retail shop, or sari-sari store, that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan of 19,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, bath soap, detergent, shampoo and beverages.

Gloria has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, she hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, soap, shampoo and beverages.

loans.name: Tita

texts.en:
Tita is 59 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. 

Tita has a food/retail shop, or sari-sari store, that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She has had this business for ten years. She has requested a loan of 16,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, bath soap, shampoo, detergent, vinegar, soy sauce, matches, ketchup and beverages.

Tita has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, she hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of canned goods, shampoo, bath soap, detergent and beverages.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta is forty-four years old and married with three children. She sells charcoal to earn a living and has been in the business for ten years. She describes her business environment as good, because she has many regular customers. 

Since joining Faulu Kenya, she has been able to expand her business. She hopes to be financially stable in the future. Jacinta has applied for a loan of 20,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy charcoal for resale.

loans.use: to buy charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Elose

texts.en:
Elose is forty years old and married with four children. She runs a Kindergarten to earn a living. She has been in the business for two years and has employed six people. She farms to earn extra income. 

Since joining Faulu Kenya, she has been able to grow her business. Elose hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for a loan of 20,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy books and desks for resale.

loans.use: to buy books and desks for resale.

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Victor is thirty-four years old, married, with two children. He sells bananas to earn a living. He has been in the business for four years and employs one person. He describes his business environment as competitive because many people do the same business. 

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save his income and hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for a loan of 30,000 Kenya Shillings to buy bananas to sell.

loans.use: To buy bananas to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is thirty-six years old and a mother of two children. She sells cosmetics to earn a living. She has been in the business for ten years and employs one person. She does farming to earn extra income. 

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to save her income and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for a loan of 30,000 Kenya Shillings to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is thirty-six years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Teresita has a shop that sells accessories and ready-to-wear. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 14,000 to buy stocks of hats, bracelets, anklets, belts, stickers, mirrored head bands and wallets to sell.

Teresita has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Teresita hopes to improve her business to support for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of accesories such as bracelets, anklets, stickers, belts and hats to sell.

loans.name: Genia

texts.en:
Genia is thirty-seven years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Genia has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She had this business for three years. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, soap, detergents, shampoo and beverages.

Genia has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Genia hopes to improve her business for the sake of her children's education.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, shampoo, soap, detergents and beverages.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is forty-seven years old. She runs a beauty salon to earn a living. She has been in the business for eight years and describes her business environment as good because there is limited competition. 

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to improve her living standards and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for a loan of 80,000 Kenya Shillings to buy a hair blow dry machine and hair chemicals.

loans.use: To buy a hair blow dry machine and hair chemicals.

loans.name: Roselyne

texts.en:
Roselyne is thirty-four years old, and a mother of one child. She runs a retail shop to earn a living. She she has been in the business for three years and describes her business environment as favorable because there is limited competition. To earn extra income she does money transfer services (m-pesa). 

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to grow her business and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for a loan of 50,000 Kenya Shillings to buy sodas, sugar and cooking oil to sell.

loans.use: To buy sodas, sugar and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is thirty years old, married, with two children. She sells clothes to earn a living. She has been in the business for four years and describes her business as good because there is limited competition.  

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to grow her business and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for a loan of  70,000 Kenya Shillings to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is twenty-seven years old, married, with one child. She runs a kindergarten to earn a living. She has been in the business for three years and employs six people. 

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to expand her business and hopes to be financially stable in the future. She has applied for a loan of 20,000 Kenya Shillings to buy books, chairs and tables.

loans.use: To buy books, chairs and tables.

loans.name: Marie An

texts.en:
Marie An is twenty-five years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Marie An has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She had this business for three years. She requested a loan of PHP 13,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Marie An has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Marie An hopes to improve her business for the sake of her children's education.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, shampoo, soap, detergents, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en:
Hadija is a thirty-six-year-old married woman. She has three children and all are enrolled in school. Her husband's name is Juma and he works as a businessman. Hadija operates a business selling charcoal and sells her goods at the market. She's worked in this business for three years. Her primary customers are passersby. She describes her greatest business challenge to be transportation and seasonality and her highest monthly expense is food. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Hadija will use the KES 40,000 loan to purchase sacks of charcoal. Hadija aspires to open a wholesale shop and hire people in the future. She joined Yehu to access capital.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is thirty-nine years old and a mother of one child. She runs a grocery store to earn a living. She has been in the business for five years and and describes her business environment as good because there is limited competition. 

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to grow her business and hopes to be financially stable in the future. She has applied for a loan of 80,000 Kenya Shillings to buy oranges, vegetables, potatoes and onions to sell.

loans.use: To buy oranges, vegetables, potatoes and onions to sell.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is thirty years old, married, with two children. He sells spare automobile parts to earn a living. He has been in the business for one year and employs three people. He describes his business environment as favorable because there is limited competition. 

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save his income and hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for a loan of 50,000 Kenya Shillings to buy spare auto parts to sell.

loans.use: To buy spare auto parts to sell.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en: Faith is 38 years old and married with 3 children. She sells clothes and beads to earn a living. She has been in the business for 12 years and describes her business environment as good because there is limited competition. Since she joined  Faulu Kenya she has been able to improve her living standards and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for 100,000 Kenya Shillings to buy clothes and beads to sell.

loans.use: To buy clothes and beads to sell.

loans.name: Girishaka Group

texts.fr:
Berchmans  fait partie du groupe Girishaka et  il habite à Bujumbura .Il est âgé de 24 ans .il est célibataire. 
Il a sous sa charge 4 petits frères, l’un étudie  à l’école secondaire et les autres sont au primaire.

Il fait le commerce de la bière locale. 

Il est à son premier  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il  obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup de bananes pour préparer une grande quantité de litres de bière de banane à vendre. Il va aussi acheter un champ de manioc  dans le but  d’introduire aussi le commerce de manioc. Les deux activités lui permettront de gagner plus.

Dans les prochaines  années il  voudrait acheter une parcelle, y construire une maison. En plus il voudrait acheter un vélo.
texts.en:
Mr. Berchmans is part of the Girishaka group and lives in Bujumbura. He is 24 years old and single.
He has four little brothers under his care, one of whom is studying in high school and the others are in primary school.

He retails local beer.

This is his first loan with Turame. With the credit received from KIVA, he will increase his operating capital and buy a lot of bananas to prepare a large quantity of liters of banana beer for sale. He will also buy a field of cassava to begin trading in cassava roots. Both activities will enable him to earn more.

In coming years he would like to buy a plot of land and build a house. Additionally he would like to buy a bicycle.

loans.use: increase his operating capital, buy a lot of bananas, and prepare large quantities of banana beer for sale

loans.name: Marve

texts.en:
Marve is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. She has a souvenir shop that sells printed T-shirts in their local community. She has had this business for 10 years. 

She requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy different colors of paints and different sizes of T-shirts. Marve has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of T-shirts and a variety of colors of paints.

loans.name: Jenife

texts.en:
Jenife is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. Jenife has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She had this business for 5 years. 

She requested a loan of 18,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, bath soap, shampoo, detergents & beverages. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2012.  In the future, Jenife hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, shampoo, bath soap, detergents, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Kasije

texts.en:
Kasije is a 45-year-old widowed woman. Kasije operates a charcoal selling business and sells her goods at the market. She's worked in this business for 4 years. Her primary customers are locals and passersby. She describes her greatest business challenge to be transportation, and her highest monthly expense is food. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more bags of charcoal. Kasije aspires to open a kiosk in the future. She joined Yehu because they have affordable policies and requirements.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina is 57 years old and married with 5 children. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell.

She has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap and other groceries. In the future Divina would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is a 43-year-old married woman with 3 children. She owns and manages a sari-sari (variety) store business in Trinidad, Bohol. She sells items like canned goods, shampoo and soap. She also helps her husband grow rice on their farm.

She is requesting a loan to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, sugar and toiletries. Alicia hopes to have a stable income. She also hopes for her family's standard of living to improve.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, sugar and toiletries.

loans.name: Alona

texts.en:
Alona is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. She has pigpen and sells grown & matured pigs. She has had this business for 9 years. 

She requested a loan of 21,000 PHP to buy animal feeds for the pigs like Purina, pigolac and unifeeds products such as hog grower, hog starter and hog finisher. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2009.  In the future, Alona hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy animal feeds for pigs like hog grower, hog starter and hog finisher.

loans.name: Álvaro Alfredo

texts.es: Álvaro Alfredo de 47 años de edad, habita en casa de su propiedad en zona rural, junto con su esposa e hijos.  Él se caracteriza por ser un hombre emprendedor, responsable y trabajador. Dedicado al cultivo de granos básicos  y caña de azúcar desde hace mucho tiempo. Cada año realiza esta actividad en la cual consiste en cosechar y vender una aparte de esta. Es así como se gana la vida y lleva el pan de cada día a su hogar. Este negocio es su principal fuente de ingresos por lo que su deseo es continuar con esta actividad por mucho más tiempo  ya que solo así puede ayudar a su familia a seguir adelante y tratar de dar cada día mejores condiciones de vida. Es por esta razón que cada día se levanta muy temprano para cultivar la tierra y poder dar a su familia lo que se merece, es ésta su principal fuente de inspiración.  De acuerdo a lo anterior ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en los insumos necesarios (semilla, venenos para plagas, abonos, etc.)  Para incrementar el cultivo de los granos básicos y de caña de azúcar. Ya que es la única forma que conoce de cómo ganarse la vida y quiere hacer todo lo posible para que este año la cosecha sea muy provechosa.  Tiene mucha confianza que de esta manera logrará su objetivo y le podrá dar a su familia diferentes condiciones de vida  a las que tiene.
texts.en: Álvaro Alfredo is 47 years old. He lives in his own home in a rural area with his wife and children. He is characterized as an enterprising , responsible and hardworking man. He has grown basic grains and sugar cane for a long time. Every year he harvests and sells these products. That is how he makes a living and brings home the daily bread to his home every day. This business is his main source of income and he wants to continue with this activity for more time since this is the only way to help the family and get ahead and try to give them a better quality of life every day. That is why every day he gets up very early to farm the land and give his family what it deserves, as they are his main source of inspiration. To do this he has decided to take out a loan from INTEGRAL to invest in the necessary materials (seeds, poison for the pests, fertilizer, etc.) to increase the crop of basic grains and sugar cane. This is the only way he knows how to earn a living and he wants to do everything possible so that the crop this year will be very productive. He is very confident that this way he will achieve his goal and give his family a better quality of life than the one they have.

loans.use: to buy seeds, poison for pests, fertilizer, etc.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna works hard to support her family. She is married and has a dry goods business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 4 years.

She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items like umbrellas, slippers and other dry goods products. In the future, Edna would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like umbrellas, slippers and other dry goods products.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a 42-year-old married man. He has 3 children and all are enrolled in school. Moses operates a water selling business, and sells his goods at the market. He's worked in this business for 3 years. His primary customers are locals and passersby. He describes his greatest business challenge to be transportation and his highest monthly expense is food. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Moses will use the Kes 30,000 loan to establish a food stall business, purchasing sacks of rice, beans and sugar. He aspires to open a kiosk in the future. He joined Yehu to have affordable policies and requirements.

loans.use: To establish another business, purchasing sacks of rice, beans and sugar.

loans.name: Rose Marie

texts.en:
Rose Marie is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 1 child. She has a shop that sells vegetables and fruits. She has had this business for 5 years. 

She requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy squash, eggs, potatoes, bread and bananas to sell. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Rose Marie hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of vegetables, bread, and fruits to sell.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 66 years old and single. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

She has borrowed and paid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 14 years and also earns an additional income from her rice retailing business. Evelyn aspires to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Grace's Group

texts.en:
Grace's group is comprised of 2 hardworking women. Grace is 19 years old and lives in the town of Wobulenzi in the Luweero region of Uganda. For the past 3 years, she has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar and soap. 

To help expand her business, she has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential commodities like sugar for resale, and that will help Grace generate greater profits and pay for her own school fees. Grace hopes that in the future she will be able to to study up to the university. 

Grace is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to micro-finance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Grace 's future prospects by helping her expand her business that helped her go back to school.

loans.use: to buy more essential commodities like sugar for resale,

loans.name: Zaitun

texts.en:
Zaitun is a 30-year-old single woman. She has 4 children and all are enrolled in school. Zaitun operates a tea selling business and sells her goods in a shop. She's worked in this business for 2 years. Her primary customers are villagers and passersby. She describes her greatest business challenge to be competition, and her highest monthly expenses are food, school fees, and health. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. 

She will use the Kes 25,000 loan to repair the business premises and purchase food stuff. Zaitun aspires to open a big hotel in the future. She joined Yehu to access capital and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to repair the business premises and purchase food stuff.

loans.name: Heide

texts.en:
Heide is 50 years old and married with five children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like shampoo, canned goods and other groceries.

Heide has borrowed and paid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns an income from food vending and tailoring. She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: buy more items like shampoo, canned goods and other groceries.

loans.name: Sant Yalla Kahone Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe "Sant Yalla Kahone" est un groupe de solidarité com^posée de cinq femmes qui se cotisent pour s'appuyer mutuellement dans leur activité. Elles vendent des tissus et pratiquent également  la teinture.
Elles ont loué une maison qui leur sert d'atelier et de salle d'exposition - vente.Les revenus tirés de cette activités leur permettent de subvenir à leurs besoins et de soutenir leurs familles . La présidente du groupe est une femme mariée , mère de trois enfants. Elle pratique la teinture depuis plus de 10 ans et est l'encadreur du groupe.Elle fait aussi de la broderie et du perlage. Afin de renforcer leur fonds de commerce, les femmes sollicitent un pret de 500000f pour acheter des tissus et des colorants.Elles ambitionnent d'ouvrir un grand magasin en centre ville pour mieux écouler leur production.
texts.en:
The "Sant Yalla Kahone" group is a solidarity group consisting of five women who support each other's business activities. They sell fabrics and also engage in dying fabrics.

They rented a house which serves as a workshop, showroom and point of sales. The revenue generated from these activities enables them to both support themselves and their families.

The group's president is a married woman, mother of three. She practiced dyeing for over 10 years and is the supervisor of the group. She also engages in embroidery and beading.

To bolster their working capital, the women are requesting a loan of 500,000 francs to buy fabrics and dyes. Their ambition is to open a large store in the center of town to better sell their products.

loans.use: buy fabrics and dyes

loans.name: Eva's Group

texts.en:
Eva's group is comprised of 3 hardworking women. Eva is 22 years old and lives in the town of Wobulenzi in the Luweero region of Uganda. For the past 4 years, she has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells snacks. 

To help expand her business, Eva has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase cooking oil and will help Eva to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her siblings. She hopes that in the future she will be able to study hairdressing. 

Eva is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to micro-finance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased her future prospects by helping her to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil.

loans.name: San Isidro De Yanahuara Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SAN ISIDRO DE YANAHUARA”; Este banco se ubicado en la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La  socia es la Sra. Jovita; ella tiene 52 años de edad y es casada y tiene 01 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes ella vende diferentes tipos de productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche, golosinas, gaseosas entre otros, la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual mediante este la socia saca adelante a su familia, la socia a la vez se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas, la socia es una persona alegre y responsable con muchas ganas de salir adelante por su familia.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de gaseosas para su tienda de abarrotes.

Los otros socios  se dedican a la elaboración de tejidos, crianza de animales menores, brindando servicio urbano, tienda de abarrotes, compra y venta de artesania, compra y venta de maíz.

La socia agradece  el préstamo  y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
These members belong to the “SAN ISIDRO DE YANAHUARA” communal bank. This bank is located in the province of Urubamba and the department of Cuzco.

This member's name is Jovita. She is 52 years old, married and has one son. She alternates her activities between her daily tasks and her grocery store selling basic necessity items such as rice, sugar, milk, candies and soft drinks, among others. She has had this business for years and with it she gets her family ahead. She also raises small animals such as guinea pigs and chickens. She is a cheerful and responsible woman who really wants to get ahead for her family. 

She is asking for the loan to buy soft drinks for her store. 

The other members make weavings, raise small animals, offer transportation service, have stores, buy and sell artisan crafts, and buy and sell corn.

She is thankful for the loan and committed to making her payments.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks for her small grocery store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sugar, oil, salt and rice.

loans.name: El Malick

texts.fr: El Malick est un jeune marié sans enfants.Il tient un magasin de vente de téléphones portables et d'accessoires. Il entretien sa famille avec les revenus tirés de ce commerce.Afin de diversifier ses produits et articles, il sollicite un pret de 500000f pour acheter 20 ventilateurs. Ceux ci se vendent très bien en cette  période de forte chaleur. Son ambition est d'ouvrir un second magasin.
texts.en:
El Malick is a young married man without children. He manages a shop selling mobile phones and accessories. He supports his family with the revenue generated by this commercial activity.

To diversify his products and articles, he is requesting a 500,000 francs loan to buy 20 fans. These sell very well in this period of high heat. His ambition is to open a second store.

loans.use: buy 20 fans

loans.name: Gbemissoke Group

texts.fr: Le groupe GBEMISSOKE est composé de trois personnes qui sont des amies et qui vivent dans le même village. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Adétoutou Abolore est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Adétoutou Abolore est âgée de 36 ans et est mariée à un commerçant nommé Toidi. Adétoutou Abolore a arrêté l'école au niveau secondaire. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Le couple se partage les différentes charges de la maison. Pour contribuer aux différents besoins de la famille, Adétoutou Abolore vend depuis quatorze ans, des produits de quincaillerie dans sa boutique au Bénin. Cette activité lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté à ses besoins. Adétoutou Abolore s’approvisionne au Bénin et au Nigeria. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Adétoutou Abolore sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe GBEMISSOKE, un crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The Gbemissoke group is made up of 3 people who are friends and live in the same village. The group's representative, who is called Adétoutou Abolore, is the woman with her hand raised in the picture. Adétoutou Abolore is 36 years old and married to a shopkeeper called Toidi. She left school at the secondary level. The couple have 3 dependent children who all attend school, and both adults share the household responsibilities.

Adétoutou Abolore has been selling hardware products in her shop in Benin for 14 years, so that she is able to contribute to the family's various needs. Her business allows her to meet her needs without much difficulty. She gets her supplies in Benin and Nigeria.

In the pursuit of customer satisfaction, increased business turnover and revenue, Adétoutou Abolore and the other members of the Gbemissoke group are requesting a loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy hardware products.

loans.name: Duterimbere/muganza Group

texts.fr:
Jean fait partie du groupe Duterimbere/Mgnz. Il a 54 ans, il est marie avec 8 enfants de 9 ans à 22 ans, dont 5 scolarises.il a une personne en charge autre que ses enfants. Son niveau d’éducation est de 5 ans de primaire.
Jean est agriculteur de riz. C’est son deuxième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimique et payer la main d’œuvre.
Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est sollicitée d’autres crédits pour finance son agriculture. Dans les prochaines années, Jean voudrait être un meilleur producteur de riz dans sa région. Avec les profits, il prévoit de payer les frais scolaire pour ses enfants.
texts.en:
Jean is a member of the Duterimbere/Mgnz group. He is 54 years old, married and has 8 children aged between 9 and 22 years old, 5 of whom go to school. He also has one other dependent.

Jean had 5 years of primary school education and is a rice farmer. This is his 2nd loan cycle with ACB. He will use his loan to buy chemical fertilizer and to pay the manual labourers.

Jean's strategy for the growth of his business is to request more loans with which to finance his agricultural operation. In the coming years, he would like to be one of the best rice producers in his region. He plans to use his profits to pay for his children's education.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizer and pay the manual labourers.

loans.name: Yoro

texts.fr: Yoro est un homme marié et père de deux enfants qui vont tous à l'école. Il tient depuis un an, un magasin de vente de pièces détachées pour automobiles et motocyclettes. Son magasin lui rapporte des revenus assez consistants qui lui permettent de subvenir aux besoins de sa faille. Afin de renforcer son fond de commerce, il sollicite auprès de UIMCEC un pret de 500000f pour acheter des pièces détachées. Son ambition est d'agrandir son magasin et de le remplir de marchandises.
texts.en:
Yoro is a married man and the father of 2 children who both attend school. He been running a shop selling spare parts for cars and motorbikes for a year. His shop generates pretty consistent revenues which allow him to take care of his family's needs.

In order to strengthen his business, Yoro is requesting a loan of 500 000 francs from UIMCEC to buy spare parts. His aim is to expand his shop and to fill it with goods.

loans.use: to buy spare parts.

loans.name: Abishyizehamwe A Group

texts.fr:
Emmanuel fait partie du groupe Duterimbere/Mgnz. Il a 28 ans, il est marie avec 2 enfants de 2ans à 5 ans, . Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.

Emmanuel est agriculteur de riz. C’est son deuxième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimique et payer la main d’œuvre.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est sollicitée d’autres crédits pour finance son agriculture. Dans les prochaines années, Emmanuel voudrait être un meilleur producteur de riz dans sa région. Avec les profits, il prévoit de payer les frais scolaire pour ses enfants.
texts.en:
Emmanuel is a member of the Duterimbere/Mgnz group. He is 28 years old, married and has 2 children aged 2 and 5.

Emmanuel has 6 years of primary school education and is a rice farmer. This is his 2nd loan cycle with ACB. He will use his loan to buy chemical fertilizer and to pay the manual labourers.

Emmanuel's strategy for the growth of his business is to request other loans with which to finance his agricultural operation. In the years ahead, he would like to be one of the best rice producers in his area. He plans to use his profits to pay for his children's education.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizer and pay the manual labourers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wood and secondary products.

loans.name: Aly

texts.fr: Aly est un commerçant qui tient une quincaillerie dans sa localité.Il est marié et père de quatre enfants dont les trois vont à l'école. Son commerce lui permet de subvenir à leur besoins. Il épargne une partie de ses bénéfices à l'UIMCEC afin de pouvoir bénéficier de crédits. Pour renforcer son fonds de commerce, il sollicite un pret de 400000f afin d'acheter des produits de maçonnerie et de menuiserie.Il ambitionne de se lancer dans le commerce en gros.
texts.en:
Aly is a shopkeeper who runs a hardware store in his community. He is married and the father of 4 children, 3 of whom go to school. His business allows him to meet their needs. He saves part of his profits with UIMCEC so that he can receive loans.

In order to reinforce his business, Aly is requesting a loan of 400 000 francs with which to buy masonry and carpentry products. He aims to get involved in the wholesale business.

loans.use: to buy masonry and carpentry products.

loans.name: Kibibi

texts.en:
Kibibi is 31 years old, married, and  has four children, all of whom attend school. Her husband is an electrician. Kibibi operates a clothing boutique and sells her goods at the market. She has been in this business for four years. Her primary customers are residents and passersby. Kibibi's other source of income comes from farming. 

Kibibi is requesting a loan for 20,000 KES, which she will use to purchase more clothes. She joined Yehu to access capital. She describes her greatest business challenges to be seasonality and transportation; her highest monthly expenses are food and clothing. She owns a house that has both electricity and piped water. Kibibi aspires to expand her business and open another business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy is 20 years old and single. He lives in the Philippines. (Joy is a male contrary to his name.)
 
Joy has a sari-sari (convenience) store that sells canned goods, snacks, personal-care products, home-use products and beverages. He has had this business for two years. 

Joy has requested a loan for 15,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks, detergents, bath soap, shampoo and beverages.

Joy has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Joy hopes to improve his business as well as achieve his goal of continuing to study to become an engineer.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, shampoo, bath soap, detergents, snacks and beverages for his store.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn, age 37, is married and has four children who are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Jocelyn has a general store business in the Philippines. Jocelyn has requested a PHP 50000 loan through NWTF to purchase more goods such as bread, soft drinks and other miscellaneous items.

Jocelyn has been in this business for 13 years. In the future, Jocelyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more goods such as bread, soft drinks and other miscellaneous items.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is a 50-year-old, single woman. Leah operates a food cafeteria and sells her goods from home. She's worked in this business for four years. Her primary customers are residents and passersby. 

Leah's other source of income is derived through a tailoring business. She describes her greatest business challenge as the high cost of commodities and transportation. Her highest monthly expenses are food and transport. 

Leah rents a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Leah will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy flour, cooking fat, maize, beans, rice and sugar. Leah aspires to expand her business and open another business in the future. She joined Yehu to access capital.

loans.use: to buy flour, cooking fat, maize, beans, rice and sugar for her cafe.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 25 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Mary Jane runs a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell.

Mary Jane has been in this business for two years. She sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future, Mary Jane would like to establish another business at the public market.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell.

loans.name: Marifel

texts.en:
Marifel is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has four children. 

Marifel has a sari-sari (convenience) store that sells canned goods, snacks, personal-care products, home-use products and beverages. Aside from this,  she also sells snacks. She had this business for three years. 

She requests a loan for 12,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks, eggs, bread, shampoo, detergent and beverages to sell in her sari-sari store.

Marifel has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Marifel hopes to improve her business and educate her children.

loans.use: to buy bread, canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell in her store.

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr: Adama est un homme marié.Il conduit depuis 10 mois une motocyclette qui appartient à un de ses amis.Chaque soir, à la descente, il verse deux tiers de la recette au propriétaire de la moto et garde le dernier tiers pour lui. Il épargne une partie de cette argent dans son compte ouvert à l'UIMCEC.Aujourd'hui, il sollicite un pret de 400000f pour acheter sa propre motocyclette afin de maximiser ses bénéfices. Son ambition est de constituer plus tard un parc de motocyclette.
texts.en:
Adama is a married man. For the past 10 months, he has been driving a motorbike belonging to one of his friends. Each evening, when he gets off the bike, he gives two thirds of his receipts to the owner of the motorbike, and keeps the last third for himself. He saves a portion of that money in his bank account with UIMCEC.

Today, Adama is requesting a loan of 400 000 francs with which to buy his own motorbike, so that he is able to maximise his profits. In time, he aims to build a fleet of motorcycles.

loans.use: to buy his own motorbike.

loans.name: Yohanis

texts.en:
Yohanis is a 51-year-old man who is married to Alinda, 38 years old. They have three children: Isai, 13, is attending the first grade of secondary school; Malkia, 9, is attending the second grade of elementary school, and Hizkia, 8, is attending the first grade of elementary school. 

Yohanis owns a business selling coconut oil. He has a rasping machine to facilitate the production of oil. He has been involved in this business for 14 years. Since he has a plot of land cultivated with coconut trees, he can produce 80 to 100 bottles of coconut oil every week and sell them at the market. 

At the moment, Yohanis plans to buy a new rasping machine as the old one does not work well anymore. Therefore, Yohanis is seeking a loan amounting to IDR 10,000,000. He would like to buy a new rasping machine with the loan.

loans.use: to purchase a new rasping machine.

loans.name: Suzette

texts.en:
Suzette works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business selling frozen foods in the Philippines.

Suzette requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for the frozen foods that she sells. 

She has been in this business for five years.

In the future, Suzette would like to save enough money to expand her business and send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her frozen foods business.

loans.name: Renea

texts.en:
Renea is thirty-seven years old and married with three children. With two children in school, Renea works very hard to provide for them.

Renea runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Renea has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as rice, bread, shampoo and other groceries. 

In the future, Renea would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Ramaz

texts.en:
Ramaz is thirty-five years old. He lives in a small village of Tetritskaro District with his family: his wife – Nona and two sons who are eleven and six. The children go to school. Nona runs a small dairy farm with two milk cows, owned by the family. She produces cheese and sells it on the local open market. Ramaz is a taxi driver. He provides a transportation service to the population of his and nearby villages. He works hard, starting at 9 am and until 9 pm. The total average monthly income of the family is 600 Laris. 

Ramaz requested credit to repair and renovate his car. After the renovation, Ramaz will be able to provide better quality service to his passengers and become more competitive. Also after the renovation his fuel expenses will decrease and profits will go up. Ramaz will use the increased profit for the well-being of his family.

loans.use: to repair his taxi.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more rice to sell to customers for her rice retailing business.

Tessie has been in this business for 5 years. Tessie earns more income from frozen foods.

Tessie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more rice to sell to customers.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 49 years old and married with one child. Ruth works very hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Ruth has been in this business for 2 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, noodles, snack foods, etc. 

In the future Ruth would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Sari Mertha Group

texts.en:
To grow their businesses, the Sari Mertha group continues to borrow from MUK. They feel comfortable to take a new loan, because they also have been trained by the MUK staff. 

Ni Luh, the head of the group, besides having pig-raising business also has a small kiosk in front of her house. Her husband works as a farmer on his own land. 

After the success of the last loan, Ni Luh is taking her share of a new loan to purchase two superior piglets and feed for fattening the pigs. Now the price for one superior piglet is Rp 500.000.

All the profit from this business will be used to develop her pig-raising business. She hopes the business will grow and she will become a successful pig breeder.

loans.use: To purchase two superior piglets and feed.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 39 years old, married and lives in the Philippines.

Arlene is providing motorela or motorcycle transport services with her husband as the driver. Aside from that, she is also operating a shop that buys and sells rice. She has had this business for two years. 

She requested a loan for 11,000 to buy tools like a T-wrench, a screw driver and an air compressor and to pay for the gasoline for the services.

Arlene has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Arlene hopes to improve her services to better support their coming child.

loans.use: to buy tools for the maintenance of the motorcycle.

loans.name: Analin

texts.en:
Analin is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 6 children. 

Analin is providing "motorela" or motorcycle services with her husband as the driver. Aside from that she also has a shop selling canned goods, shampoo, bath soap, detergent and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 10,000 PHP to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for the services.

Analin has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, Analin hopes to improve her services for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy tools for the maintenance of her motorcycle like a T-wrench, a screw driver, and an air compressor and pay for gasoline

loans.name: Akouegnon 4 Group

texts.fr: AKOUEGNON 4 est un groupe composé de quatre personnes qui résident dans la même localité et appartiennent à un même groupe de tontine. La représentante du groupe du nom de Dassi (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 42 ans. Dassi est mariée à un certain Fanda et est mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés, dont seulement un reste à sa charge. Dassi vit avec son mari et son enfant à charge et assure ensemble avec son mari les différentes charges du ménage. Dassi n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Dassi mène comme activité la production et la vente de l'huile de palme à son domicile. De façon secondaire, Dassi vend des assiettes et des bijoux de façon ambulante. Dassi exerce cette activité depuis dix ans et s’approvisionne au Bénin. Dans le but de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle de plus en plus nombreuses et de se faire plus de profit, Dassi sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe AKOUEGNON 4, un cinquième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Akouegnon 4 is a group made up of 4 people who live in the same community and belong to the same mutual funds group. The group's representative, Dassi (whose hand is raised in the picture), is 42 years old. She is married to Fanda and is the mother of 4 children, who have all been to school, and of whom only one is still dependent on her. Dassi lives with her husband and dependent child, and takes care of the household responsibilities together with her spouse.

Dassi did not go to school. To be able to meet her different responsibilities, Dassi produces and sells palm oil in her home. As a sideline business, she also sells plates and jewellery on the street. She has been doing this work for 10 years and she gets her supplies in Benin.

With the aim of being better be able to respond to the demands of a growing customer base and to make more profits, Dassi is requesting a 5th loan from ALIDé, together with the other members of the Akouegnon 4 group. The loans previously received have all been correctly repaid.

loans.use: to buy palm oil, plates and jewellery.

loans.name: Sumber Usaha Group

texts.en:
To further improve the results of the pig breeding business, the group is taking another loan from MUK. They each want to develop their business into a major business that generates profits for the family. They all receive the full support of their husbands in their zeal to grow.

Ni Luh will use this loan to purchase local piglets for pig roll. Currently, she already has a sow. While waiting for the sows to give birth again, she can sell the pigs for pig roll. With the profits from this venture, she plans to set up a stall in front of her house.

loans.use: To purchase local piglets.

loans.name: Cherelyn

texts.en:
Cherelyn is 33 years old and is a married woman with three children, ages 2, 6 and 13. 

She runs a sari-sari store business in Bien Unido, Bohol. Cherelyn sells bread, canned goods, instant noodles and other items in her store. She works hard to help provide for their household needs and send her children to school.

Cherelyn is requesting a loan to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, soft drinks and snacks. She hopes for this loan to help improve her income so she can improve their house and pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, soft drinks and snacks.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam is taking out another Kiva loan of KES 50,000 to expand her existing business. With the loan, she wants to purchase bales of clothing materials for her tailoring business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With the previous loan, she was able to expand her business and purchased household property for her business. She dreams of owning a plot of land for her family in the future. The loan has enabled her to pay school fees for her children who attend school.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothing materials for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Rhodora

texts.en:
Rhodora is married and has five children of whom two are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Rhodora is 47 years old.

Rhodora has an egg retail business in the Philippines. Rhodora has been in this business for five years. She requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

In the future, Rhodora would like to save money to expand her business and send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Tariel

texts.en:
Tariel is 42 years old. He lives in Gardabani District with his family: his wife – Leila, two sons (14 and 12 years old) and his brother. The children go to school. Tariel and Leila have a small dairy farm with 2 milk cows. Leila produces cheese. Tariel is busy running a small grocery store in the village. Tariel purchases grocery products at a  nearby wholesale market and sells them in the store. Also, cheese produced by Leila is sold in the same store. Total average monthly income of the family is 1000 Laris. 

Tariel requested credit for the start-up of a small poultry farm. He will purchase chickens and feed for them. After 3-4 months Tariel will start selling eggs and later he will sell chickens as well. The new business initiative will give additional income to the family, which will allow them to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase chickens and feed for them

loans.name: Kwekwe

texts.en:
Kwekwe is a 31-year-old married woman. She has 4 children and 3 are enrolled in school. Her husband's name is Nyawa. Kwekwe operates a business selling meat goats and she sells them at the market. She's worked in this business for one year. Her primary customers are residents and passersby. She describes her greatest business challenge to be competition and her highest monthly expenses are food, school fees, and clothing. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Kwekwe will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase more goats to raise and resale at a profit. Kwekwe aspires to venture into a new business in the future. She joined Yehu to access capital.

loans.use: to purchase more goats to raise and resell at a profit.

loans.name: El Hadji Alioune

texts.fr: El Hadji est un jeune célibataire qui exerce un commerce d'articles divers de quincaillerie depuis près de 3 ans. C'est un marchand ambulant qui achète ses articles en gros et les revend à domicile en parcourant les quartiers de sa ville.Il soutient ses deux parents et ses frères et sœurs avec les revenus tirés de son commerce.Afin de renforcer son fonds de commerce, il sollicite un pret de 500000f pour acheter de s serrures, des marteaux, des pinces et d'autres articles divers. Son ambition est d'ouvrir un magasin et d'y embaucher son frère, tout en continuant son commerce ambulant.
texts.en:
El Hadji is a young, single man who has been selling various hardware products for nearly 3 years. He is a street vendor who buys his items wholesale and resells them door to door whilst walking around the districts of his town. He supports both of his parents and his brothers and sisters with the income derived from his business.

In order to strengthen his business, El Hadji is requesting a loan of 500 000 francs with which to buy locks, hammers, pliers and various other articles. His ambition is to open a shop and to hire his brother, whilst continuing to sell on the street.

loans.use: to buy locks, hammers, pliers and various other items.

loans.name: Avil

texts.en:
Avil is married with 10 children. Avil is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Avil sells rice cake to earn a living and has had this business for 10 years. She has requested a loan of 9,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients used in making rice cake like rice, coconut oil, sugar and cheese.

Avil has been a member of HSPFI for 2 years. In the future, Avil hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients used in making snacks like "rice cake"

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. 

Evelyn has a shop that sells green and yellow bananas. Aside from that, she also sells canned goods, shampoo, soap and beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of 9,000 PHP to buy green and yellow bananas.

Evelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Evelyn hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy bananas to sell

loans.name: Amani

texts.en:
Amani is a 30-year-old married woman. She has 5 children and all are enrolled in school. Her husband's name is Hussein and he works as a mason. Amani operates a food kiosk and sells her goods in her shop. She's worked in this business for 3 years. Her primary customers are residents and passersby. 

Amani's other source of income includes farming. She describes her greatest business challenge to be inconsistent prices of products and her highest monthly expenses are food, transport, and clothing. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Amani will use the Kes 20,000 loan to add to her inventory by purchasing  flour, cooking fat, bags of maize, beans, rice and sugar. Amani aspires to expand  the business in the future. She joined Yehu to access capital.
