loans.use: to add to her inventory by purchasing  flour, cooking fat, bags of maize, beans, rice and sugar.

loans.name: Maira Yecenia

texts.es:
La señora Maira tiene 35 años de edad y vive en el municipio de La Lopez. Ella es casada y su esposo Rafael es comerciante. La pareja tiene dos hijos de 6 y 11/2 años de edad. Los dos adultos aportan económicamente a los gastos familiares. 

Doña Maira especializa en la venta de cosméticos. Ella toma pedidos de catalogo y proporciona los productos a su clientela. Vende desde su casa y de forma ambulante. Empezó este negocio hace 7 años. En aquellos tiempos ella experimentó con varios negocios buscando uno que era rentable. Realizó que vender cosméticos era muy rentable y decidió poner el negocio. Pero con la inversión que hizo del préstamo anterior logro diversificar el inventario agregando otros productos para la venta como alhajas de plata, achineria, venta de Ropa para Damas y venta de manualidades. Con la venta de estos productos ha logrado superarse en clientes y sus ingresos han crecido favorablemente.

Actualmente solicito su segundo préstamo de 15,000 lempiras para abastecerse de productos  que no tiene para la venta como lociones, cremas, shampoo y  achineria nueva. Ella espera ofrecer a sus clientes un buen servicio en los productos que demandan.

Su meta es obtener su propio Local para darle una mejor apariencia a su negocio y la comodidad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Señora Maira is 35 years old, and lives in the municipality of La Lopez. She is married, and her husband Rafael is a retailers.   The couple has two children aged 6 and 1 1/2 years old.  The two adults share in the family's expenses.

Doña Maira specializes in selling cosmetics.  She takes orders from a catalog, and provides the products to her customers.  She sells from her house and as a street-vendor.  She began this business seven years ago.  At that time, she experimented with various businesses, looking for one that was profitable.  She realized that selling cosmetics was very profitable, and decided to go into this business.  With the investment from her previous loan, she was able to diversify her inventory, adding additional products for sale such as silver jewelry, low-cost consumer goods, women's clothing and handicrafts.  By selling these products, she has been able to succeed with her customers, and her income has grown favorably.

She is currently requesting a second loan of 15,000 lempiras to stock up on products that she doesn't have for sale, such as lotions, creams, shampoo, and new low-cost goods.  She hopes to offer her customers good service with products that they want.

Her goal is to have her own premises to provide a better appearance for her business and comfort for her customers.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products such as creams, shampoo, lotions, and merchandise such as women's clothing and a variety of low-cost consumer products for sale.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia is 18 years old and lives in the town of Bulenga in the Kampala west region of Uganda. For the past 2 years, Sylvia has been working hard to manage her small business which sells charcoal. 

To help expand her business, Sylvia has requested a loan of 700,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more charcoal for resale, and will help Sylvia to generate greater profits and save money for future use. Sylvia hopes that in the future she will be able to own a retail shop. 

Sylvia is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Sylvia's future prospects by helping her to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal for resale

loans.name: Titiko

texts.en:
Titiko is 59 years old. He lives in Tetritskaro District with his family: his wife – Tamar, his 35-year-old son and his daughter-in-law. Tamar works as an accountant in a local school. His daughter-in-law works as teacher and his son works as architect-measurer in a local company. Titiko runs the dairy farm of the family. They have milk cows and calves and sell milk to local milk-processing companies. Total average monthly income of the family is 1000 Laris.

Titiko requested credit for purchasing feed for cows. He will use the feed until June, when fresh grass is available. When the cows are well-fed they will have good milking capacity and Titiko will be able to get the planned amount of milk, which will be sold through existing distribution channels. The profit earned will be used for financing family daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase feed for cows

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en:
Ruby is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. 

Ruby is providing "motorela" or motorcycle services with her husband as the driver. Aside from that she also sells cosmetics. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan of 9,000 PHP to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for the services.

Ruby has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Ruby hopes to improve her services for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy tools for the maintenance of their motorcycle like a T-wrench, an air compressor, and a screw driver and pay for gasoline

loans.name: Gorret

texts.en:
Gorret is 22 years old and lives in the town of Bulenga in the Kampala west region of Uganda. She is married and has 2 children who are both currently in school. For the past 2 years, Gorret has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells school materials like school stockings, books, and shoe polish. 

To help expand her business, Gorret has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more goods for resale, and will help Gorret to generate greater profits and take care of her family. Gorret hopes that in the future she will be able to own a retail shop. 

Gorret is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Gorret's future prospects by helping her to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more goods for resale

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 52 years old and married. She has three children, with one child in school. Marilyn works very hard to provide for them.

Marilyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell.

Marilyn has been in this business for nine years and sells a variety of items such as detergents, diapers, toothpaste and other miscellaneous items. 

In the future Marilyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell.

loans.name: Paulino

texts.en:
Paulino is 57 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married and has one child.
 
Paulino is providing motorela or motorcycle services. He has had this business for 10 years. 

He requested a loan of 11,000 PHP to buy tools for maintenance like a T-wrench, an air compressor and a screwdriver and to pay for the gasoline for the services.

Paulino has been a member of HSPFI since 2009.  In the future, Paulino hopes to improve his services for the education of his child.

loans.use: to buy tools for the maintenance of the motorcycle.

loans.name: Susan's Group

texts.en:
Susan's group is composed of two hard-working women. Susan is 17 years old and lives in the town of Wobulenzi in the Luweero region of Uganda. For the past three years, Susan has been working hard to manage her small business, which is farming. 

To help expand her business, Susan has requested a loan of 300,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more seeds for planting, and it will help Susan to generate greater profits and save her money for future use. Susan hopes that in the future she will be able to own a retail shop. 

Susan is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Susan's future prospects by helping her expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more seeds for planting,

loans.name: Joylyn

texts.en:
Joylyn is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 

Joylyn is providing "motorela" or motorcycle services with her husband as the driver. Aside from that, she also  has a shop selling canned goods, shampoo, soap, detergents and beverages. She has had this business for 6 years. She requested a loan of 9,000 PHP to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for the services.

Joylyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Joylyn hopes to improve her services for the eduction of her children.

loans.use: to buy tools for the maintenance of the motorcycle like T-wrench, screw driver, air compressor and pay for gasoline

loans.name: Mwatule

texts.en:
Mwatule is a 33-year-old married man. He has 4 children and all are enrolled in school. His spouse's name is Umazi. Mwatule operates a phone charging and repair business in a shop. He's worked in this business for 7 years. His primary customers are community dwellers. Mwatule's other source of income includes farming. He describes his greatest business challenge to be competition and his highest monthly expenses are for food. 

Mwatule owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Mwatule will use the Kes 40,000 loan to purchase phone accessories. Mwatule aspires to open a barber shop in the future. He joined Yehu to access capital.

loans.use: to purchase phone accessories.

loans.name: Tsisana

texts.en:
Tsisana is 47 years old. She lives in Tetritskaro District with her family: her 22-year-old son and her father (retired). Tsisana and her son are running a poultry farm. They sell mainly eggs and sometimes chickens as well. Total average monthly income of the family is 640 Laris, including the monthly pension of Tsisana’s father. 

Tsisana requested credit for the cultivation of family-owned plot of land. She will sow maize; one part of the harvested corn will be used for feeding the chickens. The surplus will be sold. After the realization of her business idea, Tsisana will save on feed for the farm. That will increase the profit. Tsisana plans to use their increased income for house renovation as their house is already old and needs renovating.

loans.use: to rent a tractor for land cultivation

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en:
Lucita is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 8 children. 

Lucita has a shop that sells AVON products like underwear and perfumes. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy products from AVON like underwear and perfumes.

Lucita has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Lucita hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of cosmetics, underwear, and perfumes from AVON

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria lives in Airport community. She is 36 years old, married with three children between 5 and 25 years old who are in school and live at home. For the past thirteen years she has been selling dried fish in the market. She started this business with money given to her by her husband, and learned this way of selling from her mother. The challenge she faces is the rainy season. She is requesting a loan to purchase more dried fish (dried cassava fish) for her business. She wants to build a house in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish (dried cassava fish) for her business

loans.name: Boubacar

texts.fr: Boubacar est un agent de développement communautaire qui travaille dans une ONG nationale. Depuis 2003, il organise les communautés villageoises afin de prévenir les maladies.Il est marié et père de eux enfants qui vont tous à l'école.Il a également en charge sa mère ainsi que ses frères et sœurs.Afin de financer les travaux de finition de sa maison en construction, il sollicite un pret de 500000f .Son ambition est de faire plus tard des études supérieures en marketing et en  management.
texts.en:
Boubacar is a community development officer who works for a national NGO.

He has been organizing village communities in order to prevent diseases since 2003. He is married and father of two children who are both in school. He also cares for his mother as well as his brothers and sisters.

In order to finance the finishing work on the construction of his house, he is seeking a loan of 500,000f. His goal is to someday further his education by studying marketing and management.

loans.use: to finance the finishing work on the construction of his house

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
Sally is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. 

Sally has a shop that sells green and yellow bananas. Aside from that she also has a shop selling canned goods, snacks, soap, detergents and beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy stocks of green and yellow bananas to sell.

Sally has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Sally hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of green and yellow bananas to sell

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
This is Nenita, 32, a resident of Dasmarinas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to July, a driver, and mother to their two children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Nenita operates a computer rental shop. In the Philippines, very few people own their own computers. Thus there is a need for them, especially for students who need to do their research and papers. She rents out computers by the hour and offers printing and typing services. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 34,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy new computer units, spare parts and accessories needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Nenita dreams of being able to give her children a good future and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and  draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional computer parts and supplies needed in her business

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 

Thelma has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store where she buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of 30,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, bath soap, detergents, "cup noodles", medicines & beverages.

Thelma has been a member of HSPFI since 2009.  In the future, Thelma hopes to improve her business for the education of  her child.

loans.use: to buy stocks of "cup of noodles", soap, shampoo, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Maggy's Group

texts.en:
Maggy's group is comprised of 5 hard-working women. Maggy is 20 years old and lives in the town of Bulenga in the Kampala west region of Uganda. For the past 2 years, Maggy has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar and soap. 

To help expand her business, Maggy has requested a loan of 700,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential commodities like sugar for resale, and will help Maggy to generate greater profits and pay school fees for herself. Maggy hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land and build a house on it. 

Maggy is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Maggy's future prospects by helping her to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more essential commodities like sugar for resale

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en:
This is Lanie, 52, a resident of Dasmarinas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Pedrito, her business partner, and a mother to her two children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Lanie operates a meat stall. They buy meat from suppliers that deliver the meat to respective market stalls. Her products are chicken and pork. There are many patrons who prefer her products since they are assured of its freshness and cleanliness.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 1000 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 15,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional supplies of chicken and pork needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Lanie hopes that her business will continue to be successful, just as she fervently hopes that her children will be able to graduate one day and will finish their studies. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for meat products needed in her business.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan es un hombre de 36 años de edad  de estado civil casado, vive en casa propia, domiciliado en el caserío Virgen Purísima Concepción del distrito de Lambayeque.
La actividad  a la que se dedica Juan es la compra y venta de animales menores, cuenta con 10 años de experiencia en el manejo de su negocio; Juan comercializa a los comerciantes de mercado de la zona. Así mismo Juan también se dedica a la agricultura que lo permite tener ingresos adicionales.
El monto solicitado es de 3,000 nuevos soles, que invertirá en la compra de alimentos, animales, arreglo de corrales y de su domicilio.
texts.en:
Juan is a 36 year old man in a common-law marriage.  He lives in his own home, located in the village Virgen Purísima Concepción in the district of Lambayeque.

The work that Juan does in the buying and sales of small animal, and he has 10 years of experience running his own business; Juan does business with the market vendors in his zone.  At the same time, Juan also works in farming to gain other income.  

The amount he is asking is 3,000 Soles, which he will invest in buying feed, animals, and repairs on the corrals and his property.

loans.use: to invest in buying foodstuffs, animals, maintenance on the corrals and on his property.

loans.name: Zaliko

texts.en:
Zaliko is 49 years old. He lives in a village nearby Tbilisi, the capital city of the country. Zaliko lives with his family: his wife – Lali, two daughters (25 and 20 years old), and an 18-year-old son. Zaliko and his daughters work as nurses in a local hospital. They get a monthly salary. Along with the above-mentioned Zaliko is actively involved in family agricultural business. They have a small dairy farm with 2 cows and 2 milk cows. Lali produces and sells on average 40 kg of cheese to retailers. 

Zaliko requested credit for expansion of the dairy farm. He will purchase additional an milk cow and the family will get 50% more dairy products. Zaliko plans to reinvest received profit in the same business, in order to expand it and make more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
This is Lilia, 47, a resident of Dasmarinas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Miguel, a driver, and mother to their two children. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Lilia oversees operations of their "tricycle" transportation business. They have one "tricycle" that carries up to four passengers to their destination within the community. The tricycle driver then remits a boundary (daily quota amount) each day to Lilia. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 500 every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 18,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy spare parts, accessories and also for the maintenance of her motorcycle. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Lilia hopes to add additional tricycle units someday and dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the spare parts and maintenance of their  tricycle unit

loans.name: Khadijah

texts.en:
Khadijah is a 40-year-old married woman. She has 6 children and all are enrolled in school. Her husband's name is Ahmed and he works as a farmer. Khadijah operates a selling charcoal business and sells her goods at the market. She's worked in this business for 5 years. Her primary customers are community dwellers. 

Khadijah describes her greatest business challenge to be seasonality and her highest monthly expenses are food, school fees, and health-related costs. She rents a house that has both electricity and piped water. Khadijah will use the Kes 30,000 loan to repair her business premises and add more stock of charcoal. Khadijah aspires to own a truck and  transport charcoal in bulk to other regions in the future. She joined Yehu to access capital.

loans.use: to repair her business premises and add more stock of charcoal.

loans.name: Saidi

texts.en: Said is a 40-year-old married man. He has four children, and all are enrolled in school. His wife's name is Ng'ombe. Said operates a boda boda and sells his goods. He's worked in this business for three years. His primary customers are community dwellers. He describes his greatest business challenge to be competition and his highest monthly expenses are food, school fees, and health. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Said will use the 50,000-shilling loan to purchase another motorcycle. Said aspires to start a motorcycle business in the future. He joined Yehu to access capital.

loans.use: to purchase another motorcycle

loans.name: Mwanahamisi

texts.en:
Mwanahamisi is a single woman aged 33 years, with one child. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, clothing and medical bills. 

Mwanahamisi operates a retail shop business, selling household consumption items like sugar, maize flour and wheat flour. She cites the high cost of purchasing products as a challenge. She dreams of expanding her business to a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar.

loans.name: Marìa Eleuteria

texts.es:
María es una mujer de 51 años de edad, es casada y tiene un pequeño hijo a su cargo. Vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijo. La casa está ubicada en el caserío Palominos en el distrito de Tambogrande. María vive en la parte  rural del distrito, pero cuenta con servicio de luz dentro de su domicilio.
La actividad que desarrolla María es el negocio de bodega-bazar, el cual se encuentra en su propio domicilio, atendiendo permanentemente. Gracias a su esfuerzo y buena presencia, cuenta con clientela ya establecida en la zona y muy buen nivel de inventarios. Su esposo se dedica a la comercialización de cerveza al por mayor y menor en dicho sector. Complementariamente es agricultor con parcela propia de 2 hectáreas en la cual siembra arroz.
El monto del crédito asciende a 4,500 nuevos soles, los cuales serán invertidos en la compra de materiales, abarrotes, productos para surtir su bodega bazar, los cuales serán traídos directamente desde Sullana para su comercialización.
texts.en:
María is a woman who is 51 years old, is married and has a small child in her care.  She lives in her own home with her husband and her son.  The house is located in the hamlet of Palominos in the district of Tambogrande. María lives in the rural part of the district, but she does get electricity in her home. 

María is developing her convenience store, which is located in her own home, and which she attends to around the clock.  Thanks to her effort and strong presence, she has established clientele in the area, as well as high-quality inventory.  

Her husband makes a living selling beer in both the wholesale and retail markets.  He is also a farmer with his own parcel of land (2 hectares), on which he grows rice.  

The amount of the loan is 4,500 nuevos soles (the currency of Peru), which will be invested in the purchase of materials, groceries and products to stock their convenience store, and which will be brought directly from Sullana for sales.

loans.use: to buy materials and groceries to stock her convenience store.

loans.name: Argentina

texts.es: Sra. Argentina su profesión  es maestra desde hace cuarenta años y trabaja en un colegio de la comunidad donde habita, es casada con dos hijos mayores los cuales no están baja su responsabilidad de los cuales recibe ayuda económica, el objetivo del préstamo es para realizar mejoras en la vivienda y comprar  materiales como: ladrillos, zinc, pintura en otro materiales de construcción  ya que ha sido uno de sus sueños, aspiración y metas, actualmente lo ha  logrado con el financiamiento que fundación león 2000 le ha brindado ya que su ingresos de trabajo no han sido lo suficiente para poder lograrlos.
texts.en: Argentina is a teacher by profession and has worked in a school in the community where she lives for forty years.  She’s married and has two adult children who are no longer in her care and who provide some economic help to her.  The objective of the loan is to do some home improvements and buy building supplies like bricks, metal sheeting, paint and other construction supplies because it’s been one of her dreams, hopes and goals that she’s now attaining thanks to financing that Fundación León 2000 has provided her since the income she earns at work is insufficient to do so.

loans.use: to buy bricks, metal sheeting, paint and other building supplies.

loans.name: Estrellas Unidas Group

texts.es:
Thomas, tiene 63 años de edad, vive en una aldea del municipio de Intibucá, junto con su esposa y sus hijos.
Don Thomas, es una persona dedicada desde pequeño a la agricultura, toda su vida a realizado actividad agrícola como su única fuente de ingresos. El cultiva papas, frijol, tomate y otros, y le dedica todo el tiempo necesario.
 El préstamo que solicita es el segundo y es por 7,000.00 Lempiras para comprar semilla de papa, abono y pago de mano de obra. Los préstamos le ayudan a mejorar la producción dándole buena asistencia a sus cultivos.
Su plan de seguir mejorando la producción es para mejorar también su calidad de vida mediante las ganancias obtenidas.
El es el presidente del grupo solidario al cual pertenece llamado Estrellas unidas, que está formado por  8  integrantes que viven en la misma comunidad y se dedican a la agricultura, en la foto se identifican así: a la izquierda esta Santos camisa color gris, seguido esta Ruperta de blusa color Fusia, María de azul y rosado, Juliana de verde y azul, Martin de Cuadriculado, Felipe de azul, Thomas de rayado con verde y Anselma de rojo a la derecha.
texts.en:
Thomas, 63, lives in a village in Intibucá municipality with his wife and children.  Thomas is a person who has worked in agriculture since he was little.  Agriculture has been his only source of income his entire life.  He grows potatoes, beans, tomatoes and others and spends all necessary time at it.

The loan he’s requested is his second one and it’s for 7000 lempiras that he will use to buy potato seeds, manure and to pay labor costs.  The loans help him improve production by providing good crop maintenance.

His plan is to continue improving production to also improve his quality of life by means of the profits obtained.

He is the president of the communal bank he belongs to which is called “Estrellas Unidas” (United Stars) and that has 8 members who live in the same community and are farmers.  In the photo they can be identified thus: On the left is Santos wearing a gray shirt, next is Ruperta in a fuschia blouse, María in blue and pink, Juliana in green and blue, Martín in plaid, Felipe in blue, Thomas in green stripes and Anselma in red on the right.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds, manure and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Luchando Por Un Sueño Group

texts.es: Valeria de 55 años es conviviente y tiene 02 hijos aún dependientes. Con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo Valeria  ha llegado a cumplir algunos de sus objetivos como mejorar su vivienda y apoyar en la educación de sus hijos. Ella comenzó vendiendo ambulatoriamente golosinas, con su trabajo y  el buen uso que le dio a sus ingresos pudo habilitar un kiosco la cual ofrece golosinas. Como actividad segundaria se dedica al tejido  la cual trabaja sobre pedidos que le hacen sus clientes. Su mayor deseo es de poner su propio taller de tejidos, ya que es muy hábil para ello. Con el crédito que solicito va a comprar galletas, chocolates, caramelo, etc. y así tener surtido su negocio. Valeria es integrante de la Alcancía Comunal “Luchando Por Un Sueño” la cual está conformado por 07 socios trabajadores y  responsables. Ellos agradecen el crédito brindado.
texts.en:
Valeria is 55 years old.  She lives with her partner and two dependent children.  With a lot of effort, Valeria has managed to reach some of her goals, such as improving her home and supporting her childrens' education.  She started selling candies from a cart, but from her hard work and the good use of her income she was able to open a kiosk where she can offer the confections.

As a secondary activity, she makes a living weaving textiles, which she does based on orders from her customers.  Her biggest desire is to open her own fabric workshop, as she is very good at this.  

With the loan she has requested, she will buy cookies, chocolates, candies, etc. to stock her business.  Valeria is a member of the communal bank “Luchando Por Un Sueño”, which is made up of seven members who are hard-working and responsible.

They appreciate the loans offered.

loans.use: to buy cookies, chocolate and candies.

loans.name: Estrella Del Mar Group

texts.es: El Grupo Solidario Estrella Del Mar está conformado por dos emprendedoras que han venido trabajando con fundación león 2000 en crédito durante el financiamiento las emprendedoras han demostrado ser responsable y con metas en la vida de superarse. La Señora Alicia su actividad es la venta de bebidas y frescos el negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación donde atiende a sus clientes diariamente, actualmente está solicitando financiamiento para la compra de granos básicos y otros alimentos que se necesitan para el negocio.
texts.en:
The “Estrella Del Mar” (Star of the Sea) solidarity group has two entrepreneurs who have been working with Fundación León 2000 loans.  During the financing the entrepreneurs have shown themselves to be responsible and having goals for self-improvement in life.  

Alicia sells beverages and fruit smoothies.  Her business is located at home.  She tends to customers there daily and is currently asking for a loan to buy basic grains and other foodstuffs that are needed for the business.

loans.use: to buy basic grains and other foodstuffs she needs for her business.

loans.name: Mbeyu

texts.en:
Mbeyu is a 50-year-old widowed woman. She has 3 children. Mbeyu operates a selling-goats business and sells them at the market. She's worked in this business for 6 years. Her primary customers are community dwellers. Mbeyu's other source of income includes farming. She describes her greatest business challenge to be seasonality and change in prices and her highest monthly expenses are food, school fees, and health. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Mbeyu will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more goats to raise and sell at a profit. Mbeyu aspires to venture into selling cows in the future. She joined Yehu to access capital.

loans.use: to buy more goats to raise and sell at a profit.

loans.name: Habiba

texts.en: Habiba is a small-scale trader. She sells ladies wear, underwear, jeans, brassieres and panties, which she has done for 3 years. She lives in Esuakyir near Abura. Habiba is married and has 1 child. She uses her income to support her husband in paying their accommodation bills. Habiba will use her loan to purchase children's dresses, underwear and ladies wear to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, she wishes to build a shop to enable her to sell dresses.

loans.use: to purchase children's dresses, underwear and ladies wear to sell.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice  lives in Air Port Community. She is  27 years old, single, and has three children between one and 6 years old that live at home. For the past ten years she  has been selling blouses, jeans, trousers, body creams and other items in the market. She is requesting a loan to purchase more  such items for her business. Her plans are to buy a piece of land and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more  blouses, jeans, trousers, body creams and other items for her business

loans.name: Maralkhan

texts.ru: Маралхан – участник группы «Акмарал», замужем, воспитывает 6 детей. Маралхан занимается выпечкой хлебобулочных изделий и их  продажей.  В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Маралхан обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS)  на увеличение товарооборота.  Доходы от кредита Маралхан планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение бизнеса.
texts.en: Maralkhan is a participant of the "Akmaral" group, married and has six children.  She is involved in baking and selling bread and baked goods.  In order to further develop her business, Maralkhan requested a loan in the amount of 30,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to increase goods turnover.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into a continued expansion of her business.

loans.use: to increase goods turnover

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
This is Elizabeth, 40, a resident of Dasmarinas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Armando, her business partner, and a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.    
                         
Elizabeth operates a van rental business. They have one van that they offer to be rented for transportation service or for people who need a van for out-of-town service. They provide their services within the city & nearby provinces. Aside from this she also operates a small tailoring shop for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 15,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of her van. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Elizabeth hopes to grow her business and dreams to be able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the spare parts and for the maintenance of their van.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is a 33-year-old married woman. She has 2 children, 4 years and 10 years old. She describes herself to be polite and a God-fearing woman. She operates a butcher shop  where she sells meat. She has been involved in this business for 8 years and employs 2 staff members. Her business is located besides a road and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be high prices of meat. She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to purchase more meat for selling. Her business goal is to run a butchery shop in her own building.

loans.use: to purchase meat.

loans.name: Juan Placido

texts.es:
Juan es un joven muy luchador y honrado que está dispuesto a dar todo de sí con el fin de salir adelante y mejorar su calidad de vida. Actualmente el vive en la ciudad de Ica, lo que lo ha llevado a enfrentar grandes retos como soportar las fuertes lluvias y temblores en su hogar.

Juan es un joven que disfruta mucho de jugar futbol con sus amigos después del trabajo. Como buen peruano es fanático del conocidísimo “Ceviche”. Gracias a sus padres, Juan pudo culminar el colegio por lo completo y cuando salió de este, estaba muy deseoso de poder estudiar Agronomía, pero por algunos percances económicos en su familia, sus padres no pudieron pagar las cuotas universitarias. Después de esto, Juan se prometió a si mismo salir delante de manera honrada y luchadora, es por esto que se dedica 10 horas diarias a manejar en su moto taxi todos los días, por el cercado de la ciudad de Ica, lo que le ha permitido generar los ingresos que necesita para su alimentos diarios.

Juan está seguro que todo marchará bien, siempre y cuando continúe trabajando desde muy temprano y ponga todo de su parte para progresar. Gracias al apoyo que se le está brindando, el podrá pagar la renovación de su brevete y también con el fin de poder matricularse en la universidad y así convertirse en un gran profesional. Juan está muy contento por el apoyo ya que renovando su brevete podrá seguir trabajando y así podrá pagar sus estudios universitarios, con mucho esfuerzo y entusiasmo el está decidido a cumplir su gran meta y sueño “Ser un gran profesional”.
texts.en:
Juan is a very hard-working and respectable young man who is prepared to give his all in order to get ahead and improve his quality of life. He currently lives in the city of Ica. This has meant that he has had to confront major challenges such as the strong winds and tremors near his home.
Juan greatly enjoys playing soccer with his friends after work. Like all good Peruvians, he is crazy about ceviche [a popular seafood dish]. Thanks to his parents, Juan was able to finish school. When he graduated, he truly wanted to study agronomy. However, due to some economic mishaps in his family, his parents were not able to pay his tuition. After that, Juan promised to get himself ahead on his own in a respectable manner, through working hard. For this reason, he works ten hours a day, every day, driving his moto taxi around the city of Ica. This has allowed him to earn the income he needs to cover his daily needs.
Juan is certain that everything will turn out ok, as long as he keeps working and gets up very early, giving his all in order to move forward. Thanks to the support of this loan, he will be able to pay for the renewal of his driver's license. This will also help him toward his goal of attending university and becoming a professional. Juan is very happy for this support because he will be able to keep working when he renews his driver's license and thus pay for his studies. He is set on reaching his goal and demonstrates a great deal of hard work and enthusiasm of reaching his dream: "To be a successful professional."

loans.use: to renew his driver's license and enroll in university.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa  es una mujer de 71 años de edad, es una mujer casada y no tiene hijos dependientes ni como carga familiar. La casa está ubicada en el Caserío Bajo Cruceta del distrito de Tambogrande - Piura. Rosa vive en este sector, y sólo cuenta con servicio básico de energía eléctrica en su domicilio.
La actividad que desarrolla Rosa es la crianza de animales menores como ovinos (25 ovinos), aves de corral  (gallinas, patos) y también tiene 3 vacunos los cuales le producen leche fresca, la cual vende en la ciudad de Tambogrande. Esta actividad la realiza hace más de 8 años. También se dedica a la agricultura en el cual tiene cultivos de limón en producción, que asiste diariamente y cosecha semanalmente para luego comercializarlos en el mercado local. Dichas actividades le genera muchas ganancias y dividendos que posteriormente administra de la mejor manera.
El monto del préstamo solicitado es de 2,000 nuevos soles, los cuales se invertirán para mantenimiento y compra de fertilizantes para su cultivo limón, pues son bastantes las tierras que posee y necesita conservarlas puesto que la cosecha es abundante. De esa manera busca mantener su negocio y comercializar productos de mejor calidad para el deleite de sus compradores.
texts.en:
Rosa, 71, is a married woman; she no longer has dependent children to support.  Her house is located in Bajo Cruceta settlement in Tambogrande-Piura District.  Rosa lives in this sector and the only utility she has in her house is electricity.

Rosa’s activity is raising small farm animals like sheep (25 sheep), barnyard fowl (chickens and ducks) and she also has three cows that produce fresh milk that she sells in the city of Tambogrande. She’s been doing this activity for more than 8 years.  She also works in agriculture.  She has lemons in production.  She cares for her crops daily and harvests weekly to sell them in the local market.  Said activities generate much profits and dividends 
which she administers in the best way possible.

The amount of the requested loan is 2000 new soles that she will use to buy fertilizer for the lemon crops because she owns quite a bit of land and needs to care for it because the harvest is abundant.  In this way she hopes to maintain her business and sell products that are of better quality for her buyers’ enjoyment.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her lemon crops.

loans.name: Liliam Elizabeth

texts.es:
Liliam  es una mujer de 30 años de edad, está conviviendo actualmente y tiene 2 hijos aún dependientes. . Vive en casa propia con su conviviente y sus hijos. La casa está ubicada en el caserío Guaraguaos Alto, en el distrito de Tambogrande. Liliam vive en la parte  rural del distrito, pero cuenta con servicio de luz eléctrica en su domicilio.
La actividad que desarrolla Liliam es la crianza de ganado menor (ovino, porcino y aves de corral), los cuales al alcanzar peso y tamaño ideal los comercializa en el mercado local. Actualmente cuenta con clientela fija, que mayormente son comerciantes de los mercados de Chiclayo. Su conviviente es agricultor, arrendando terreno para la siembra de arroz y maíz, y las ganancias son para colaborar en los gastos del hogar.
El monto del préstamo solicitado es de 1500 nuevos soles, el cual se utilizarà en la compra de una moto furgón, con la cual podrán transportar su ganado e insumo agrícolas. Con este préstamo Liliam piensa elevar su calidad de vida, ya que tiene planeado criar más aves para generar más ganancias.
texts.en:
Liliam is a 30 year old woman living with her spouse and two children who are still dependent.  She lives in her own house with her spouse and children.  The house is located in the Guaraguaos Alto settlement in Tambogrande District.  Liliam lives in the rural part of the district but her house does have electricity.

The activity Liliam carries out is raising small livestock (sheep, pigs and barnyard fowl) which when they reach ideal size and weight she sells in the local market.  She currently has a regular clientele who are merchants from markets in Chiclayo for the most part.  Her spouse is a farmer; he leases land where he grows rice and corn and profits he earns are used to collaborate with household expenses.

The amount of the requested loan is 1500 new soles that she will use to buy a motorcycle powered delivery truck to transport her livestock and farm supplies.  With this loan Liliam intends to elevate her quality of life since she plans to raise more fowl to earn higher profits.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle powered delivery truck to transport her animals and farm supplies.

loans.name: Liz Belza

texts.es: La Sra. Liz  tiene 38 años, no es casada pero convive con su pareja con el cual tienen   4 hijos que son de las edades de 3, 7, 11, 18 años de edad, ella se dedica  a la venta de    Bisutería que se encuentran en la zona siete de Julio, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Liz utilizara este préstamo  para Capital de Trabajo ya que quiere comprar bisutería por mayor, como aretes,  trabas rosones, etc. todo para mujeres, la razón para solicitar este préstamo es que ya no tiene mercadería y necesita surtir su negocio con cositas novedosas, ya que ella vende de manera ambulante, la Sra.  Liz enfrenta retos en su negocio que son Falta de capital de trabajo y  va a utilizar los beneficios siempre en aumentar su mercadería para tener mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Liz, age 38, is not married, but she lives with her life partner and their four children, ages 3, 7, 11, and 18.  She sells costume jewelry that can be found at zone seven of Julio.

This is her first cycle with the institution.  Liz will use this loan for working capital because she wants to buy wholesale jewelry.  She will buy everything for women like earrings, hairclips, and bows.  The reason for requesting this loan is that she no longer has merchandise, and she needs to stock her business with new things.

She sells in an itinerant manner, and she does face challenges in her business like the lack of working capital.  She will always use the profits to increase her merchandise in order to have greater income.

loans.use: to buy wholesale jewelry.

loans.name: Duvin

texts.es: Duvin, tiene la edad  de 34 años, está en unión libre,  vive con sus  hijos y su esposa que son su mayor prioridad. El con el crédito pretende sembrar una terreno apto para la explotación de maíz por lo cual es que solicita el crédito. El tiene pensado sembrar esta propiedad y generar el máximo de ganancias para asi darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida en su futuro, y además espera salir adelante con los pagos del crédito. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Duvin is 34 and lives in a common law marriage.  His children and wife are his highest priority. He will use the loan to plant a suitable plot of land in corn. He has been thinking of planting this property and generating a maximum profit so that he can give his family a better quality of life in the future as well as pay back the loan.

This is Duvin’s first loan from FUDECOSUR. He has not had any previous loans from state banks but FUDECOSUR provided him with a loan and did so more easily and with a much lower rate of interest.

loans.use: to cultivate corn on a suitable piece of property.

loans.name: Talimkan

texts.ru:
Талимкан – лидер группы «Учкун», замужем, воспитала 3 детей.  Талимкан занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес в 2007 году с суммы 30,000 сом (KGS).  Имея в хозяйстве 2 дойные коровы, 1 теленка и 3 коз и получая прибыль в сумме около 8,000 сом в месяц с продажи молока и молочных продуктов, Талимкан намерена и далее развивать животноводство.  
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Талимкан обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку дополнительных голов скота.  Доходы от кредита Талимкан планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья.
texts.en: Talimkan is the leader of the "Uchkun" group, married and raised three children.  She is involved in animal husbandry, having started this business in 2007 a  sum of 30,000 som (KGS).  Having two dairy cows, one calf and three goats in her business and making a profit of about 8,000 som (KGS) per month from sales of milk and milk products, Talimkan intends to continue developing her animal husbandry business.  In order to further grow her business, Talimkan requested a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy additional heads of livestock.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into a continued increase of livestock headcount.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Memuna

texts.en:
This is 35-year-old Memuna. She is married, and has 4 children aged 17 yrs, 12 yrs, 9 yrs and 6 yrs. In 1998, Memuna established her food stuff business. While she was with her mother, Memuna became interested in business because her mother was a small-scale trader. When she got married she decided to start her own business to help her husband support their family. Working 6 days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about Le 900,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,500,000. Memuna requires a loan in order to buy maggi, onions and rice for her business. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 350,000. In the future, Memuna plans to educate her children to university level. Memunatu is honest and hardworking. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy maggi, onions and rice for her business

loans.name: Gbenonkpo 12 Group

texts.fr: GBENONKPO 12 est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui sont des amies et qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe du nom de Mahoussi (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 55 ans. Mahoussi est mariée à un certain Jean. Le couple a trois enfants, mais aucun n'est scolarisés. Seulement un des enfants est encore à la charge du couple. Mahoussi vit ensemble son mari et assure ensemble avec son mari les charges de la maison. Mahoussi a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Mahoussi mène comme activité, la vente d'ustensiles de cuisine (bols, glacières, assiettes, etc.) de façon ambulante. Mahoussi  achète ses produits dans une ville du Bénin. Dans le but de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle de plus en plus nombreuses et de se faire plus de profit, Mahoussi sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe GBENONKPO 12, un cinquième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: GBENONKPO 12 is a group composed of 3 women who are friends and live in the same neighborhood. The group representative, Mahoussi (the one raising her hand on the picture), is 55. Mahoussi is married to a man named Jean. They have 3 children, but none of them go to school. Only one of them is still their dependent. Mahoussi and her husband live together and they both take care of the family financially. Mahoussi quit school at the secondary level. To meet the financial needs of her family, Mahoussi has been selling kitchen utensils (bowls, coolers, plates, etc.) door to door. She buys those items in a city in Benin. In order to meet the needs of her growing client base as well as to increase her sales and her income, Mahoussi, along with the other members of GBENONKPO 12, is applying for a fifth loan from ALIDé. Previous loans have been successfully paid back.

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Almagul

texts.ru: Алмагуль – участник группы «Учкун», вдова. Алмагуль занимается животноводством и полеводством, имеет в хозяйстве 3 дойные коровы 2 теленка и 3,05 га земли, где выращивает картофель.  В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Алмагуль обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку дополнительных голов скота.  Доходы от кредита Алмагуль планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья.
texts.en: Almagul is a participant of the "Uchkun" group, a widow.  She is involved in animal husbandry and farming and has three dairy cows, two calves and 3.05 hectares of land, where she grows potatoes.  In order to further grow her business, Almagul requested a loan in the amount of 20,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy additional heads of livestock.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into a continued increase of livestock headcount.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Santos

texts.es: Santos de 61 años de edad, habita en casa de su propiedad junto con uno de sus hijos que le colabora en la atención del negocio. Ella se dedica al comercio de productos de primera necesidad.  Es una mujer muy esmerarda, positiva y buena administradora. Trabaja desde hace muchos años en este negocio, por lo que ya logró establecer cuatro puestos más contiguos en los cuales distribuye gran variedad de sus productos y que las personas solicitan con mayor frecuencia. La ubicación del negocio se encuentra en el mercado municipal de la zona donde ella  habita. Es muy conocida en el lugar y gracias a su experiencia y buen servicio ha sabido ganarse  la confianza de muchas personas por lo que ya cuenta con muchos clientes fijos. Expresa estar muy contenta y agradecida con esta institución ya que  le ha ayudado en el pasado para lograr activar los puestos que apertura.  De la misma forma ha tomado la decisión de invertir en uno de sus puestos en el cual distribuye principalmente medicamentos de todo tipo en el cual las personas pueden encontrar pastillas para dolores,  alcohol, variedad de vitaminas, etc.  Solicita este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en la compra de variedad de productos para la salud como: variedad de pastillas, gasas, alcohol, vitaminas, etc. de tal forma que su negocio este surtido y los clientes puedan encontrar lo que buscan y así poder cautivarlos y atraer nuevos. Espera lograr aumentar sus ganancias que le permitan mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Santos is 61 years old and lives in her own house with one of her children, who works with her in the business.  She makes a living selling staple products.  She is conscientious and positive, and a good administrator.  She has worked many years in this business, and as a result she has succeeded in establishing four kiosks which are close to one another.  She distributes a large variety of products there, and customers are asking for her products with increased frequency.

The location of her business is in the municipal market in the area where she lives.  She is very well-known in the area and thanks to her experience and good service, she has gained the confidence of a lot of people and can count on many regular customers.

She has expressed satisfaction and gratitude with this institution since it has helped her in the past to increase her kiosk openings.  She has decided to invest in one of her kiosks, where she distributes primarily medicines of all kinds, among which the people can find pain killers, alcohol, a variety of vitamins, etc.  

She is requesting this loan from Integral in order to invest in the purchase of a variety of products for health, such as a selection of pills, gauze, alcohol, vitamins, etc. so that her business is well-stocked and the customers can find what they are looking for.  As a result, she will be able to build her relationship with those customers and attract new ones.  She hopes to increase her income, which will allow her to improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy a selection of pills, gauze, alcohol, vitamins, etc.

loans.name: Mirian

texts.es: La Sra. Mirian  tiene 42 años y es Separada de su pareja hace bastante tiempo, se dedica a la Venta de Asaditos, empanadas, de panza tiene su puesto de venta que se encuentra  en la zona Fortaleza,  Este préstamo es su  primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la señora  Mirian utilizara este préstamo  para la compra de insumos para la elaboración de sus asaditos y empanadas y así de esta manera incrementar su Capital de Trabajo  Su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de dinero para la compra de insumos para su venta de asaditos y empanadas. La Sra. Mirian enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia y  utilizara los beneficios En seguir comprando insumos o utensilios para seguir mejorando su negocio, la Sra. Mirian es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz y agradecida  con la institución por el apoyo brindado en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en:
Mirian, 42, has been separated from her spouse for some time.  She sells “asaditos” [grilled meat], “empanadas de panza” [beef stomach turnovers]; her food stand is located in the Fortaleza neighborhood.  This loan is her second cycle in the institution.  Mirian will use the loan to buy ingredients she uses to prepare her asaditos and empanadas in order to increase her working capital.  

The reason for requesting the loan is the lack of money to buy ingredients to buy ingredients for her asaditos and empanada sales.  The challenge Mirian faces in her business is competition and she’ll use the profits to continue buying ingredients or utensils to continue improving her business.  Mirian is a very hardworking person who feels happy and grateful to the institution for the support provided her by granting the loan.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to cook.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a married woman with six children; four attend school while the other two complete their studies. She has rented a house that has both electricity and piped water. Jane operates a door-to-door business selling secondhand clothes to the general public. She has been in this business for the past five years. Other sources of income include her husband's earnings, who works as a secretary. She joined Yehu to get loans, and she describes food as the greatest monthly expense.

She plans to use her loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to purchase more bundles of secondhand clothes for resale.

loans.use: to purchase more bundles of secondhand clothes for resale.

loans.name: Oscar Adonay

texts.es: Oscar Adonay de 48 años de edad, habita en casa de su propiedad junto con su esposa e hijos. Él se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos y de yuca. De esta forma es como se gana la vida y puede llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar. La actividad del cultivo la realiza año con año, y es la única forma que conoce de como ganarse la vida. Es un hombre muy trabajador, honrado y responsable. A pesar de las condiciones en las que vive, las cuales son muy humildes no se cansa de trabajar y de dar lo mejor a su familia. Es un hombre luchador. Siempre está al pendiente de su familia ya que para él es su principal fuente de inspiración y desea poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida. Ha tomado la decisión de acercarse a esta institución para solicitar este crédito ya que la temporada en la que se realiza la siembra, que es invierno, se aproxima, y quiere estar preparado con los principales insumos agrícolas (abonos, venenos para plagas, semillas, etc.) que es la razón por la cual solicita este crédito. Espera tener resultados favorables ya que no cuenta con otra fuente de ingresos. Confía en Dios que logrará obtener una cosecha abundante la cual le permitirá seguir llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar.
texts.en:
48-year old Oscar Adonay lives in his own house with his wife and children. He grows basic grains and yuca. This is how he earns his living and supports his family. He’s done this work for many years and it’s the only way he knows of earning his living. Oscar Adonay is a very hardworking, honest, and responsible person.

In spite of his humble living conditions, he doesn’t get tired of working and doing the best he can for his family. He puts in a lot of effort. 

Oscar Adonay has decided to approach this institution to ask for a loan. The season for planting crops (winter) is approaching, and he wishes to have everything ready such as fertilizer, insecticides, seeds etc. He is hoping for a good crop as he has no other source of income. He puts his trust in God for an abundant harvest so that he can continue providing for his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, insecticides, seeds etc.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
This is 44-year-old Ibrahim.  He is married, and has 3 children aged 15, 12 and 9 years old. In 1996, Ibrahim established his imported foodstuffs business. He began his business after he realized that his wife was the only one doing business and supporting the home. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about Le 900,000 every month from this business.  

Ibrahim has already received and successfully repaid his first loan and now requires a new loan in the amount of Le 4,500,000 to buy more imported foodstuffs for his business. In the future, Ibrahim plans to build his own house and open another outlet.   He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more imported foodstuffs for his business

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet is 23 years old and lives in the town of Bulenga in the Kampala west region of Uganda. She is married and has 3 children who are all currently in school. For the past 3 years, Harriet has been working hard to manage her small business which sells bricks. 

To help expand her business, Harriet has requested a loan of 350,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to pay her workers and buy firewood for the bricks, and will help Harriet to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Harriet hopes that in the future she will be able to own a retail shop. 

Harriet is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Harriet's future prospects by helping her to improve her business.

loans.use: to pay her workers and buy firewood to burn the bricks

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 43-year-old single woman. She has 3 children with ages ranging from 7 years to 20 years. She describes herself to be a focused woman. She operates a retail shop where she provides M-pesa services. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located beside a busy road and near a police station  and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds for float. 

Mary will use the Kes 20,000 loan to increase the float for M-pesa. Her business goal is to run a well established M-pesa  and mobile phone accessories retail shop within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will buy a plot of land and build a house .

loans.use: to use the loan proceeds for float for M-pesa (money transfer business).

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria  lives in Air Port Community. She is  39 years old, married, and has  six children between 2 to 18 years old. Five of them are in school and  all of them live at home. For the past ten years she  has been selling used clothes in the market. She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes  for her business. Her plan is to expand her  business.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes  for her business

loans.name: Emmalinda

texts.en:
Emmalinda is  42 years old, married, and has three children.  She is a  resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to provide income for their everyday expenses.

Emmalinda sells Ice candy snacks to the local neighborhood. She buys coconut, milk, and other flavorings in the market, prepares the snacks, and puts them in the freezer until they harden. Her ice candy is one of the summer treats kids and adults enjoy. She also sell ice tube and coconut juice for additional income. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, Emmalinda is requesting a loan for 30,000 PHP, which she will use to buy raw products and ingredients she uses in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Emmalinda hopes to expand her business and dreams of giving her children a high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from her studies of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients and products needed in her snack business.

loans.name: Ndiaye

texts.fr:
Madame Ndiaye est une femme de 54 ans qui  fait du commerce depuis 10 ans. Elle s’est lancée dans la vente de friperie et s’est installée chez elle pour minimiser les charges. Elle travaille avec l’IMCEC depuis plus de 3 ans et est à son 3ème crédit. Elle sollicite 100000FCFA pour acheter  deux balles de friperie et les étaler devant chez elle dans le but de le revendre.
Madame Ndiaye n’a pas de charges bien qu’étant veuve, seulement la dépense quotidienne est gérée par  ses enfants. Dans l’avenir, elle aimerait diversifier ses produits et services afin de maximiser son profit.
texts.en:
Mrs Ndiaye is 54 and has been doing business for 10 years. She started a used clothing business at home, to minimize costs. She has been working with IMCEC for over 3 years; this is her 3rd loan. She is applying for a 100000FCFA loan so she can purchase 2 bales of used clothing which she will spread outside her house in order to resell them.
Although she is a widow, Mrs Ndiaye doesn't have any financial responsibilities; her children take care of her daily expenses. In the future, she would like to diversify the products and services she offers in order to increase her profit.

loans.use: to buy used clothing she will resell.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La Sra. Francisca es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora, gracias al crédito anterior que obtuvo de kiva pudo abastecer su negocio con productos que necesitaba para la venta. Esta vez vuelve a solicitar la ayuda de Kiva y de fundación paraguaya para poder comprar arroz, fideo, azúcar, yerba y bebidas en Gral. en forma mayorista, ya que de esta forma podrá estar bien abastecida y a la vez tener mejores ingresos.
Ella agradece a la fundación y kiva por esta nueva oportunidad que le están dando.
texts.en:
Sra. Francisca is a hardworking, enterprising person. Thanks to her previous loan from Kiva she has been able to better stock her store with all the items she needed. She is once again asking for a loan from Kiva and the Fundación Paraguaya so she can buy rice, pasta, sugar, yerba (a herb), and drinks at wholesale prices. In this way she will have a well-stocked store and will earn more money.

Francisca is grateful to the Foundation and Kiva for providing this new opportunity.

loans.use: to buy rice, pasta, sugar, yerba, drinks etc.

loans.name: San Juan Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Yessica Aleyda tiene 31 años, tiene  dos hijos pequeños y forma parte del grupo "San Juan" integrado por seis socios, residentes del distrito de Comas.
La Sra. Yessica Aleyda se dedica a la atención de su bodega que viene funcionando desde hace un  año, está ubicado en su domicilio y gracias a su esfuerzo y trabajo ha ido aumentando cada día mas su stock.
El préstamo recibido lo invertirá en la compra de productos como abarrotes, golosinas, bebidas, etc. Uno de sus proyectos es implementar mas adelante un mini market ya que le daría mayores ganancias y aumentaría su clientela.
texts.en:
Sra. Yessica Aleyda is 31 and has two small children. She is a part of San Juan Communal Bank which consists of six members, all residents of Comas District.

Yessica has a small store that has been in operation for a year. It is located in her home. Thanks to her effort and hard work she has been increasing her market share day after day. 

She will use the loan to purchase products such as groceries, sweets, drinks, etc. One of her projects is to establish a mini market later since it would give her increased earnings and expand her customer base.

loans.use: to purchase products for her small store.

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es: Rafael, tiene la edad  de 34 años, está en unión libre,  vive con sus  hijos y su esposa que son su mayor prioridad. El con el crédito pretende asistir la siembra de frijol con la que cuenta, el comprara abonos plaguicidas y el pago de mano de obro de los trabajos. El cuenta con el terreno ya sembrado y es primordial darle esta asistencia para tener una buena cosecha. El tiene pensado con esta mejorar generar el máximo de las ganancias aumentado la cosecha y más ingresos económicos a la hora de la venta del producto, mejorando así la estabilidad económica. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Rafael, 34, is in a relationship and lives with his children and wife who are his greatest priority.  He intends to use the loan to care for the bean crops he has.  He will buy manure and bug killers and will pay labor costs for the tasks.  

He has a parcel of land already planted and it’s of vital importance to provide care in order to have a good harvest.  He plans that this improvement will generate the maximum profits possible increasing the harvest and his income when the time comes to sell the product thus improving his economic stability.

This is the first loan he’s gotten from Fudecosur.  He’s had no previous loans with state banks but Fudecosur offered the best terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy manure, bug killer and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Mwanatumu

texts.en:
Mwanatumu is a married woman with four children between the ages of 16 and 5 years, all enrolled in school. She runs a kiosk and also sells new clothes. She has been doing so for the last three years, and she was previously a farmer. She owns a house that has no electricity but has piped water. 

Mwanatumu aspires to open a new kiosk in future, and she describes school fees and food as her greatest monthly expense. With the Ksh. 15,000 loan, she plans to buy bundles of new clothes for resale.

loans.use: to buy bundles of new clothes for resale.

loans.name: Kerbeh

texts.en: Kerbeh  lives in Air Port Community. She is  44 years old, married, and her husband is a doctor. They have ten children between 2 and 27 years old that are in school and live at home. Starting in 2004  she  has sold palm oil and peppers in the market. She is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil and peppers  for her business. In the future she would like to own a store and educate her children to do business.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil and peppers  for her business

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is a married woman with two children, one of whom is enrolled in school. She operates a beauty salon business and has been in this business for the last five years. Her other sources of livelihood include her husband’s earnings; he is a driver. Julia has rented a house that has both electricity and piped water. She dreams of buying a car to do transportation business. 

Julia joined Yehu to get access to funds at a cheap interest rate. Julia intends to use the Ksh. 30,000 to buy chemicals and hair weaves for her business, and also open another beauty salon.

loans.use: to buy chemicals and hair weaves for her business and also open another beauty salon.

loans.name: Edith

texts.en: Edith is taking out another Kiva loan of KES 50,000 to increase her vegetable stock as she anticipates an increase in demand. With the loan, she wants to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes and green vegetables. Since the previous loan, her monthly income has increased by 50 percent. With the additional income she plans to purchase a plot of land and build a family house.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes and green vegetables.

loans.name: Rosa Angelica

texts.es:
Rosa es una mujer de 32 años de edad, es casada y tiene 2 hijos menores de edad a su cargo. Tiene casa propia, la cual está ubicada en el sector Cruz del Médano, en el distrito de Mórrope, donde vive con su esposo e hijos. La calidad de vida en la comunidad es de subsistencia. La mayoría son trabajadores independientes en negocios de comercio y crianza de animales adicionalmente dedicados a la agricultura y a trabajar como dependientes en labores agrícolas.
La actividad comercial que realiza Rosa es la crianza de  animales menores. Su esposo trabaja como pescador. Cuenta con experiencia de 10 años en dicha actividad. Su negocio de animales ubicado en su propio domicilio  cuenta con clientela fija como comerciantes de mercados de Chiclayo.
El monto del préstamo asciende a 2000 nuevos soles, los cuales se invertirán en la compra  de animales menores , animales caprinos y ovinos  para la cría. Con el préstamo actual tiene pensado ampliar corrales para la crianza y comprar alimento para engorde de animales menores y ganado porcino. Actualmente  se ha propuesto ampliar su inventario en lo referente a  animales debido a que es una actividad muy rentable en la zona. Además tiene pensado adquirir una máquina de coser para su hija que es confeccionista
texts.en:
Rosa, 32, is married and has two minor children in her care.  She owns her house that’s located in Mórrope District’s Cruz del Médano sector where she lives with her husband and children.  The community’s quality of life is at the subsistence level.  Most are independent workers in commerce or animal husbandry and also work in agriculture and also as employees doing farming tasks.

The commercial activity that Rosa does is raising small farm animals.  Her husband works as a fisherman.  She has ten years’ experience in said activity.  Her animals business is located at her house and she has regular customers like merchants from the Chiclayo markets.

The amount of the loan is 2000 new soles and she is going to use it to buy small farm animals, goat and sheep, to raise.  She intends to use the loan to expand the corrals and to buy feed to fatten up the animals and the pigs too.  She’s set the goal of expanding her inventory with respect to the animals because it’s a very profitable activity in the zone.  She also is thinking about buying a sewing machine for her daughter who is a seamstress.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and small farm animals (barnyard fowl), goats, sheep and pigs and to make improvements to the corrals.

loans.name: Sixta

texts.es:
La  Sra. Sixta  tiene 65 años edad, tiene 3 hijos todos mayores de edad, ella tiene una despensa que con mucho sacrificio logra mantener ya que madruga para realizar sus compras del mercado de San Lorenzo y una vez por semana del mercado de abasto, de esta manera logra abaratar el costo y mantener una buena clientela.
Ella comenta que le va bien, ya que su negocio está bien surtido y ofrece a su clientela muy buena variedad. Su meta es poder seguir creciendo y de esa forma poder seguir ayudando a su familia.
Sixta necesita de este crédito para la compra de bebidas, lácteos, panificados, carnes, y demás, en cantidad y de esta manera obtener mejores ganancias. En el futuro desea ampliar su negocio y también comprar  un vehículo para realizar mejor su trabajo.
texts.en:
Sixta, 65, has three adult children. She has a grocery store that with much sacrifice has been able to keep open.  She rises at dawn to go to the San Lorenzo market to make her purchases and once a week she goes to the wholesale foodstuffs market thus managing to lower costs and retain a good clientele.  She comments that she does well since her store is well-stocked and she offers her customers a very good variety.  Her goal is to continue growing this way to continue helping her family.

Sixta needs this loan to buy beverages, dairy products, baked goods, meats and others in quantity to earn better profits.  In the future she wants to enlarge the business and also to buy a vehicle to be able to do her work better.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is taking out another loan of KES 50,000 to boost her business. With the loan, she wants to purchase a water tank and new water pump for her business. Since the previous loan, her monthly income has increased, enabling her to provide basic needs to her family. Alice intends to expand her business in the future and become a wholesale supplier of water.

loans.use: to purchase a water tank and new water pump for her business.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Carmen es de la ciudad de Concepción, esta casada con el señor Antoliano. Su familia esta compuesta por 5 hijos de los cuales 3 ya son mayores e independientes, con sus propias familias y profesiones.
Carmen tiene una despensa en su casa, tambien tanto ella como su familia se dedican a la produccion de leche, y segun nos comenta la señora ella forma parte de un comite de productores de leche, en donde venden su produccion de leche, lo cual les ayuda muchisimo para trabajar mejor y mejorar sus ingresos.
